Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Do you want to change the world? At Cabify, that‚Äôs what we‚Äôre doing. We aim to make cities better places to live by improving mobility for the people living in them, connecting riders to drivers at the touch of a button. Maybe one day cities will be places where nobody needs a private car. But we‚Äôve still got a long way to go...fancy joining us?

About The Position

As a Data Analyst, you'll be part of an exceptional team of over 30 SQL and data visualization specialists. Our Data Analytics department is organized around 11 problem spaces that mirror the structure of the entire company, ensuring that every decision we make at Cabify is data-driven.

In your day-to-day role, you'll work in a multidisciplinary squad with other disciplines such as Product, Engineering, Growth, and Operations. We also follow agile methodologies within each analytics group and foster an environment of knowledge and resource sharing among the department.

If you're passionate about managing large volumes of data, you'll be delighted to know we leverage two different data warehouses, Google BigQuery and Amazon Redshift, to perform intensive analysis thus maximizing operational efficiency.

We take pride in working with one of the largest Tableau Server platforms in Europe, where we share not only powerful analysis and visualizations but also Self Service Data Sources, making data accessible to the entire company.

You Will

Work in technical data projects autonomously to enhance the company's analytics capabilities through functions such as:


Exploit large-scale data warehouses performing efficient SQL.
Define ETL models in our datawarehouse with Airflow.
Document and maintain your code and queries in Gitlab.
Create dashboards and reports using Tableau / PowerBI to communicate results and monitor KPIs regularly.
Execute exploratory analysis to shape future projects and provide action recommendations.
Present findings to squad team members to guide business and product decisions.
Work closely with engineers to define what data is needed for analysis, request creation of new app events, 3rd party integrations, collaborate in the data models design, granularity, and how they relate to existing models.
Help design new features alongside product managers and engineers, measuring their performance and testing their business impact.
Develop Data Sources to use across the organization, thus empowering business by exploring data in a trusted environment.


Our Ideal Candidate Has


Great alignment with our principles, we take this very seriously.
At least 1-2 years of working experience as a Data Analyst
Experienced in writing and understanding complex SQL and working with large data sets
Working knowledge of Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI, Looker, or any other data visualization tool
Graduate degree in Business Administration, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, or related fields
Fluency in English and Spanish


Bonus Points


A Master's degree in Business Analytics, Business Intelligence, or related
Product Analytics experience with Amplitude, Datadog, Mixpanel, or similar


What‚Äôs it like to work at Cabify?

We‚Äôre a Company Full Of Happy, Motivated People And We Never Want That To Change. Here Are Some More Reasons Why It Rocks To Be Part Of Our High-performance Team

‚åöHybrid Model (2 work-from-home days per week plus 6 weeks per year)

üí∂Excellent Salary conditions: L2 [30-40K‚Ç¨]

üèùÔ∏èRecharge days

üåçOur office is located in Madrid.

‚åöFlexible work environment & hours.

üôåRegular team events.

üöóCabify staff free rides.

üöÄPersonal development programs based on our career paths.

üßò‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è iFeel: Free access to the iFeel platform, so you can take care of your emotional well-being through therapy sessions.

üìêCoursera: your own license in Coursera to take as many courses as you wish and continue developing your skills.

üí≥Flexible compensation plan: Restaurant tickets, transport tickets, healthcare and childcare

üíªAll the equipment you need (you only have to bring your talent).

üê±A pet room, so you don‚Äôt have to leave your furry friend at home

‚òïÔ∏èAnd last but not least...free coffee and fruit!

Cabify is proud of being an equal-opportunity workplace. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees regardless of background, gender, religion, orientation, age, or ability.

Join us!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Role

We are looking for a Social Media Data Analyst to create and manage insights and analytics solutions that turn data into powerful insights. In this role, you should have a background in data and business analysis. You should be analytical and an excellent communicator. If you also have business acumen and problem-solving aptitude, we‚Äôd like to meet you. Ultimately, you will enhance our business intelligence system to help us make better decisions.

Responsibilities



Translate business needs to technical specifications.
Marketing analytics partner to feed the marketing team with insights from their own social accounts and social listening.
Ability to work with large volumes of data and find the story in the metrics, create and communicate insights by analysing data from a variety of sources, both quantitative and qualitative;
Build Insights reports weekly.
Collaborate with local and external multicultural teams to integrate strategic and creative processes.
Work closely with direct external suppliers, third-party vendors, agencies, and relevant external networks.
Develop and execute database queries and conduct analyses.
Create visualisations and reports for requested projects
Analyse big data to discover trends and patterns



About You



Experience working in Digital and Social Media (Social Listening or Business Intelligence)
Strong knowledge of how Social Media platforms work (Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, Instagram, YouTube)
Strong knowledge of Social Media Listening Tools (such as Sprinklr, Brandwatch, Talkwalker, etc will be considered an extra)
Strong knowledge of Microsoft Excel is a must
Industry experience is a must
Excellent organisational, interpersonal, and communication skills (both written and verbal).
Understanding of Branding, Marketing, and Research Communication;
Familiarity with BI technologies (e.g. Microsoft Power BI, Oracle BI)
Proven abilities to take initiative and be innovative
Analytical mind with a problem-solving aptitude
Proficiency in English. (Spanish will be considered an extra)
Knowledge of SQL queries, SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), and SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)
Knowledge of using programming languages (such as VBA macros, python, javascript) to automate analysis and reporting processes will be highly valued
Fluency with visualisation tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc.) ‚Äì the ability to create interactive, user-friendly, and compelling dashboards and reports.



At .Monks, we believe in fostering an environment where a diversity of perspectives can thrive. We proactively work to design hiring processes that promote equity and inclusion while mitigating bias. We celebrate diversity and are committed to building a team that reflects the communities we serve. We welcome and encourage qualified applicants, from all backgrounds, who are excited to contribute to our mission.

About Monks

About The Role

We are looking for a Social Media Data Analyst to create and manage insights and analytics solutions that turn data into powerful insights. In this role, you should have a background in data and business analysis. You should be analytical and an excellent communicator. If you also have business acumen and problem-solving aptitude, we‚Äôd like to meet you. Ultimately, you will enhance our business intelligence system to help us make better decisions.

Responsibilities


  • Translate business needs to technical specifications.
  • Marketing analytics partner to feed the marketing team with insights from their own social accounts and social listening.
  • Ability to work with large volumes of data and find the story in the metrics, create and communicate insights by analysing data from a variety of sources, both quantitative and qualitative;
  • Build Insights reports weekly.
  • Collaborate with local and external multicultural teams to integrate strategic and creative processes.
  • Work closely with direct external suppliers, third-party vendors, agencies, and relevant external networks.
  • Develop and execute database queries and conduct analyses.
  • Create visualisations and reports for requested projects
  • Analyse big data to discover trends and patterns


About You


  • Experience working in Digital and Social Media (Social Listening or Business Intelligence)
  • Strong knowledge of how Social Media platforms work (Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, Instagram, YouTube)
  • Strong knowledge of Social Media Listening Tools (such as Sprinklr, Brandwatch, Talkwalker, etc will be considered an extra)
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft Excel is a must
  • Industry experience is a must
  • Excellent organisational, interpersonal, and communication skills (both written and verbal).
  • Understanding of Branding, Marketing, and Research Communication;
  • Familiarity with BI technologies (e.g. Microsoft Power BI, Oracle BI)
  • Proven abilities to take initiative and be innovative
  • Analytical mind with a problem-solving aptitude
  • Proficiency in English. (Spanish will be considered an extra)
  • Knowledge of SQL queries, SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), and SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)
  • Knowledge of using programming languages (such as VBA macros, python, javascript) to automate analysis and reporting processes will be highly valued
  • Fluency with visualisation tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc.) ‚Äì the ability to create interactive, user-friendly, and compelling dashboards and reports.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Main responsibilities:

The role will contribute to the area providing support in the processes and tools improvement and in order to prevent the contract errors and the losses for the company
Data analysis of the contract errors and the company losses
To prevent losses for the company by reducing errors: Daily booking analysis of all destinations to detect ‚Äúunnormal‚Äù behavior caused by possible errors. Improvements within contract loading to reduce human error possibilities. Error detection based on the ATLAS data analysis.
Maintain collaborative communication with the rest of the team: QC Prevention agents, QC Mitigation agents and business analysts in Strategy, Processes & Tools
Identify lack of efficiencies in the current processes and develop new tools (or improve the current ones) to increase team performance




Candidate profile:

Data analysis skills is needed
SQL knowledge is needed
Tableau knowledge is needed
Advanced Python and Atlas System knowledge is desirable
Strong knowledge of Office Package use and macros
Previous experience in the Travel Industry is desirable
Excellent knowledge of Spanish and English languages

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a driven and successful Data Analyst to help our client sales teams worldwide grow, meet, and exceed their business targets.




As a Data Analyst focused on supporting the Sales team, you will be responsible for building and maintaining data and reporting capabilities, performing in-depth analysis of sales patterns, estimating the effectiveness of monetisation efforts, and providing actionable insights to both the sales teams and management.




You will contribute to key areas such as lead generation, user attribution infrastructure, and monetisation solutions, playing a critical role in driving revenue growth and expanding the brand‚Äôs customer base.




We need someone who is highly proficient with data infrastructure and reporting tools, understands the sales domain, and is genuinely interested in driving business outcomes.




What‚Äôs in it for you?




Great salary | High impact role | Scale up with high potential | Career growth | 100% Remote




Responsibilities:




Support the data infrastructure for sales: the company already has a basic data infrastructure in place, including a data warehouse (Redshift), integrated sales tools, and basic sales reporting in Tableau. They expect you to adapt this infrastructure to accommodate changes, develop more advanced reports, build new integrations, and ensure the quality and accuracy of the data.
Regularly report on the performance of the sales teams: Help develop and track appropriate KPIs.
Perform deep analysis of sales data: Focus primarily on internal data but also include external data where possible. Identify patterns and provide insights regarding offers, strategy changes, lead quality, and market shifts.
Work directly with sales teams, management, and, when necessary, marketing/development: Visualise and explain sales metrics and insights at various levels of complexity.
Form hypotheses, suggest improvements, and organise testing: Collaborate with the teams to test these hypotheses and implement improvements.




Requirements:




3+ years of experience in analytics/BI, ideally related to sales or marketing domains.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree, ideally with a focus on business administration, marketing, economics, or data processing (optional‚Äîcan be omitted if not critical).
Strong technical skills: Advanced SQL, ideally Python for automating tasks; understanding of basic statistics and A/B testing; experience with visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker); and the ability to work with raw data.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills: Ability to derive insights, form, and test hypotheses to improve business results.
Sales domain knowledge (familiarity with sales data and reporting, CRM systems, lead generation, and sales processes) is a significant advantage.
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal: Ability to clearly explain complex analytical concepts to different audiences, from sales agents to company management.
Obsession with business results: Understanding of business impact and the ability to work independently or within a team to continuously improve outcomes.
Fluency in English (native-level preferred). Spanish is a significant advantage; Russian would also be beneficial.
Experience working with B2B apps in a growth stage is also a plus.




Ready to make a significant impact? If you‚Äôre a driven Data Analyst with a passion for sales and marketing analytics, we want to hear from you! Apply now via Prosperity and help drive growth and success for our client‚Äôs sales teams worldwide.

Title: Research and Data Analyst
Description:
ABOUT US




As one of the largest entrepreneurship networks globally, Bridge for Billions creates, designs, and manages entrepreneurship programs with foundations, corporations, and public entities that have benefited more than 5,000 entrepreneurs in more than 140 countries. We exist to enable more early-stage entrepreneurs of all kinds to thrive, generating jobs and solutions for everyone, so our economies sustainably meet the needs of all.




Bridge for Billions, recognized by Forbes 30 Under 30, Ashoka, and Acumen, has worked with more than 100 organizations such as Coca-Cola, Novartis, VISA, and institutions such as the United Nations or IDB Lab in the development of large-scale entrepreneurship programs. In 8 years, Bridge has grown to a team of more than 50 people from nearly 25 nationalities, with headquarters in Madrid, where most of our team is based; an emerging LatAm HQ in Guatemala, with a few team members; and a few people based in different places around the world.




JOB MISSION




The researcher will drive research and analysis efforts to generate actionable insights, facilitate knowledge sharing and dissemination, engage with stakeholders and clients to align on needs and expectations, and support marketing initiatives with simplified and creatively presented data. This role will ensure effective project management, development of research tools, and documentation of best practices to enhance organizational learning and strategic decision-making.







ROLES & CONTRIBUTIONS




Research (60% of time dedicated to this role)

Design and implement rigorous research studies focused on entrepreneurship ecosystems.
Produce impact reports and publications on best practices.
Use advanced statistical and analytical tools to interpret data and extract meaningful insights.
Scope markets and develop tailored research tools and instruments.
Collect and manage large datasets ensuring accuracy and integrity.
Perform benchmarks against industry standards and competitors.
Ensure effective project management and adherence to research best practices.




Reports and Communication (20% of time dedicated to this role)

Produce highly accurate and detailed reports based on research findings.
Use data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) to create clear and compelling visual reports.
Present findings and participate in events to showcase thought leadership.
Simplify complex content and develop creative methods for data presentation.
Support marketing initiatives with simplified and creatively presented data.
Engage with academic, business, and professional communities to elevate the organization‚Äôs profile.




Internal Knowledge Management (20% of time dedicated to this role)

Develop a robust roadmap strategy for implementing knowledge management that builds upon industry best practices and leverages tooling and process advancements.
Document best practices and ensure lessons learned are shared across teams.
Support the continuous improvement of processes and systems through strategic insights derived from organizational data.
Build and drive the culture of knowledge sharing within the organization.
Create, capture, organize, and assess knowledge assets for enterprise use.







SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE NEEDED




Skills we look for this particular role:




Hard Skills

Educational Background: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Knowledge Management, Data or Information Science, Business Administration, Economy, or a related field.
Minimum 2 years of experience in a knowledge management, research, or analytical role.
Proven track record in conducting qualitative and quantitative research.
Experience in preparing impact reports, best practices publications, ecosystem analysis, etc.
Experience communicating with and influencing senior leadership as well as framing discussions to gain valuable feedback and experience.
Ability to conduct thorough literature reviews.
Expertise in developing research tools and instruments.
Thought leadership and ability to contribute to best practices publications.
Familiarity with knowledge management systems and documentation tools.




Soft Skills

Excellent presentation and communication skills.
Experience leading projects and delivering outcomes within tight timelines.
Ability to simplify complex content and present data creatively.
Capability to provide actionable recommendations based on an analysis.
Proactive in knowledge sharing and contributing to thought leadership.
Strong documentation and internal knowledge management abilities.
Excellent understanding of impact management theory and practices, including Theory of Change.




Skills we look for all Bridge team members:

Purpose Driven: This position aligns with your life's purpose, the impact you wish to make, and the person you want to become.
Values Aligned: You embody our core values of Courage, Grit, Empathy, and Gumption.
Startup Mindset: You're collaborative, entrepreneurial, and willing to take responsibility for your work outcomes, operating effectively even when working alone.
Proactive & Empathetic: You take initiative, are results-driven, and empathetic in all your interactions with team members, entrepreneurs, mentors, and partners.
Emotionally Intelligent: You have a deep understanding of people‚Äôs needs and expectations and can build trust and engagement quickly.
Passionate & Curious: You are passionate about your work and have a lifelong desire to learn.
Resilient: You have a growth mindset and the resilience to overcome challenges, understanding that systemic change requires hard work.
Effective Communicator: You have proven experience in resolving problems and communicating complex ideas clearly to diverse groups in a fast-paced environment.




RECRUITMENT PROCESS




Apply: Submit your application.
Initial Chat: A brief 30-45 minute conversation to discuss your interest and understand the role.
Business Case: You'll receive a challenge to complete within a set time frame.
Technical Interview: If your challenge is satisfactory, we'll discuss it further and assess your technical skills.
Mutual Interview: An open discussion where you can ask us any questions to ensure our company is the right fit for you.
References: With your consent, we'll contact two of your references for feedback.
Offer: If all goes well, you'll receive a job offer from us.




OFFER AND LOCATION




Transparent salaries and fair compensation structure, mid-range for the social sector:




Compensation: Annual salary ranging from ‚Ç¨25,000-‚Ç¨30,000
Benefits Package: Includes health insurance through Alan and a flexible benefits program with Cobee, which covers expenses from meals to childcare and training.
Location: Madrid
Starting Date: We're eager to start as soon as we find the perfect fit.
Employment Type: This is a full-time position. This position includes a 6-month trial period to assess suitability and performance




IMPACT & TEAM




Our Vision: We're set on reshaping the entrepreneurship landscape to be more just, inclusive, and effective.
Make a Real Impact: Join us in aiding entrepreneurs worldwide. As a part of our team, you'll be at the heart of a rapidly evolving social enterprise.
Team Dynamics: We're a passionate, international crew with a shared mission. See what our team members are saying on Glassdoor.
Company Values: Our four pillars are Gumption, Courage, Grit, and Empathy.
Referral Incentive: Receive a $200 bonus for successful team referrals ($100 upon hiring and an added $100 after their first 6 months).




GROWTH & DEVELOPMENT




Annual Global Retreats: Join us in global company-wide retreats, geared toward alignment and leadership growth, facilitated by external professionals.
Personal Growth: Take advantage of a dedicated learning budget, tailored for needs like backend bootcamps or leadership training sessions.
Feedback-Centered Culture: Engage in monthly one-on-ones with your lead and partake in comprehensive quarterly reviews with your peers.
Skill Sharing: We value cross-training. Team members are urged to share expertise through talks and in-house training.




WELLBEING & TIME OFF




Vacation Days: You'll have 23 vacation days, with the option to add more, in addition to chosen local public holidays.




FLEXIBILITY & WORK SET-UP




Tech Ready: We'll equip you with a new or second-hand Macbook.
Flexible Work Options: Enjoy a blend of flexible work hours and the option to work remotely.
Office Location: If you're in Madrid, our centrally-located office awaits, complete with a bright ambiance, modern amenities, and a welcoming terrace ideal for team gatherings.

Reports and Communication (20% of time dedicated to this role)

  • Produce highly accurate and detailed reports based on research findings.
  • Use data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) to create clear and compelling visual reports.
  • Present findings and participate in events to showcase thought leadership.
  • Simplify complex content and develop creative methods for data presentation.
  • Support marketing initiatives with simplified and creatively presented data.
  • Engage with academic, business, and professional communities to elevate the organization‚Äôs profile.


Internal Knowledge Management (20% of time dedicated to this role)

  • Develop a robust roadmap strategy for implementing knowledge management that builds upon industry best practices and leverages tooling and process advancements.
  • Document best practices and ensure lessons learned are shared across teams.
  • Support the continuous improvement of processes and systems through strategic insights derived from organizational data.
  • Build and drive the culture of knowledge sharing within the organization.
  • Create, capture, organize, and assess knowledge assets for enterprise use.



SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE NEEDED


Skills we look for this particular role:


Hard Skills

  • Educational Background: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Knowledge Management, Data or Information Science, Business Administration, Economy, or a related field.
  • Minimum 2 years of experience in a knowledge management, research, or analytical role.
  • Proven track record in conducting qualitative and quantitative research.
  • Experience in preparing impact reports, best practices publications, ecosystem analysis, etc.
  • Experience communicating with and influencing senior leadership as well as framing discussions to gain valuable feedback and experience.
  • Ability to conduct thorough literature reviews.
  • Expertise in developing research tools and instruments.
  • Thought leadership and ability to contribute to best practices publications.
  • Familiarity with knowledge management systems and documentation tools.


Soft Skills

  • Excellent presentation and communication skills.
  • Experience leading projects and delivering outcomes within tight timelines.
  • Ability to simplify complex content and present data creatively.
  • Capability to provide actionable recommendations based on an analysis.
  • Proactive in knowledge sharing and contributing to thought leadership.
  • Strong documentation and internal knowledge management abilities.
  • Excellent understanding of impact management theory and practices, including Theory of Change.


Skills we look for all Bridge team members:

  • Purpose Driven: This position aligns with your life's purpose, the impact you wish to make, and the person you want to become.
  • Values Aligned: You embody our core values of Courage, Grit, Empathy, and Gumption.
  • Startup Mindset: You're collaborative, entrepreneurial, and willing to take responsibility for your work outcomes, operating effectively even when working alone.
  • Proactive & Empathetic: You take initiative, are results-driven, and empathetic in all your interactions with team members, entrepreneurs, mentors, and partners.
  • Emotionally Intelligent: You have a deep understanding of people‚Äôs needs and expectations and can build trust and engagement quickly.
  • Passionate & Curious: You are passionate about your work and have a lifelong desire to learn.
  • Resilient: You have a growth mindset and the resilience to overcome challenges, understanding that systemic change requires hard work.
  • Effective Communicator: You have proven experience in resolving problems and communicating complex ideas clearly to diverse groups in a fast-paced environment.


RECRUITMENT PROCESS


  1. Apply: Submit your application.
  2. Initial Chat: A brief 30-45 minute conversation to discuss your interest and understand the role.
  3. Business Case: You'll receive a challenge to complete within a set time frame.
  4. Technical Interview: If your challenge is satisfactory, we'll discuss it further and assess your technical skills.
  5. Mutual Interview: An open discussion where you can ask us any questions to ensure our company is the right fit for you.
  6. References: With your consent, we'll contact two of your references for feedback.
  7. Offer: If all goes well, you'll receive a job offer from us.


OFFER AND LOCATION


Transparent salaries and fair compensation structure, mid-range for the social sector:


  • Compensation: Annual salary ranging from ‚Ç¨25,000-‚Ç¨30,000
  • Benefits Package: Includes health insurance through Alan and a flexible benefits program with Cobee, which covers expenses from meals to childcare and training.
  • Location: Madrid
  • Starting Date: We're eager to start as soon as we find the perfect fit.
  • Employment Type: This is a full-time position. This position includes a 6-month trial period to assess suitability and performance


IMPACT & TEAM


  • Our Vision: We're set on reshaping the entrepreneurship landscape to be more just, inclusive, and effective.
  • Make a Real Impact: Join us in aiding entrepreneurs worldwide. As a part of our team, you'll be at the heart of a rapidly evolving social enterprise.
  • Team Dynamics: We're a passionate, international crew with a shared mission. See what our team members are saying on Glassdoor.
  • Company Values: Our four pillars are Gumption, Courage, Grit, and Empathy.
  • Referral Incentive: Receive a $200 bonus for successful team referrals ($100 upon hiring and an added $100 after their first 6 months).


GROWTH & DEVELOPMENT


  • Annual Global Retreats: Join us in global company-wide retreats, geared toward alignment and leadership growth, facilitated by external professionals.
  • Personal Growth: Take advantage of a dedicated learning budget, tailored for needs like backend bootcamps or leadership training sessions.
  • Feedback-Centered Culture: Engage in monthly one-on-ones with your lead and partake in comprehensive quarterly reviews with your peers.
  • Skill Sharing: We value cross-training. Team members are urged to share expertise through talks and in-house training.


WELLBEING & TIME OFF


  • Vacation Days: You'll have 23 vacation days, with the option to add more, in addition to chosen local public holidays.


FLEXIBILITY & WORK SET-UP


  • Tech Ready: We'll equip you with a new or second-hand Macbook.
  • Flexible Work Options: Enjoy a blend of flexible work hours and the option to work remotely.
  • Office Location: If you're in Madrid, our centrally-located office awaits, complete with a bright ambiance, modern amenities, and a welcoming terrace ideal for team gatherings.

Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
Lingokids' mission is to help 100 million families worldwide raise amazing kids through playlearning‚Ñ¢.




Through play and interactive technology, Lingokids delivers premium, modern learning through educational subjects and life skills so kids can thrive as confident, conscious, resilient, lifelong learners ‚Äî ready for school and today‚Äôs ever-changing world.




Are you ready for Playlearning?‚Ñ¢




We‚Äôre looking for an exceptional Product Data Analyst to join our team who is passionate about analysing data, identifying trends, and making recommendations to improve our growth strategies. As a key member of our team, you will work closely with Product Managers to improve user experience.




Responsibilities

Analyse user and interaction data to identify patterns, trends, and insights related to product usage and growth.
Collaborate with product managers to develop A/B testing strategies, implement tests, and analyse results to optimise product features and user flows.
Create reports and dashboards that track key performance indicators (KPIs) for product and monetisation.
Provide actionable insights and recommendations to stakeholders based on data analysis to drive product improvements and growth strategy adjustments.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends, tools, and practices related to product led growth and monetisation.
Own analytics projects E2E. Define business problems, translate into data approaches for yourself and more junior members of the team, and deliver insight and tools that will drive change.




Desired experience

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Business, Marketing or a related field.
Proven experience working in a similar role, focusing on product or monetisation and data analysis in a fast growth business.
You have deep expertise in data focussed tools (e.g., SQL, Python) and techniques, and have a history of delivering impactful projects from start to finish.
Experience with data analytics tools (e.g., Amplitude, Looker) and A/B testing tools and techniques.
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to present complex data in a clear and persuasive manner.
Self-starter with the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Creative problem-solving skills and a passion for innovation.
You‚Äôre a bright, high calibre candidate who enjoys working in a warm, fast-paced and collaborative environment.




English is a must. We are a multicultural team, and we are providing a service in English so, we don't care about certificates, but we expect you to be able to communicate fluently.




You should feel equally comfortable communicating in long-form writing. We have become a fully remote company so, we believe that being articulate in both spoken and written long-form asynchronous communication is key to working efficiently together.




Experience working closely with non-technical stakeholders to refine requirements and bring them to life is a must.




Life at Lingokids

üè° Remote working: you can choose to work remotely from within your country or visit our offices if you live in Madrid.

‚öñÔ∏è Flexible hours and work-life balance: we care about the results you bring to the team. 9 to 6 and constant commuting is not for us either.

üìà Stock options: joining Lingokids means you can choose to own part of the company.

üåç Visa sponsorship: if you need a visa to work in the EU, Lingokids will assist you during the visa process, costs included.

üìö Professional growth: up to ‚Ç¨2.000 per year for conferences, books, and training.

üí¨ Language lessons: language learning is what we‚Äôre all about! We‚Äôll cover language classes for you to learn Spanish, English or Portuguese.

ü©∫ Health Insurance: we offer an optional health insurance through Adeslas, featuring competitive rates to ensure your well-being.

üß† Mental Health Support: we offer you 4 free TherapySide sessions to support your self-awareness and well-being

üí≥ Flexible compensation: you'll be able to include your monthly expenses in meals and transportations into your payroll (we use Cobee).

üç≤ Meal allowances: every month, you will receive a 60‚Ç¨ allowance on your Cobee card for you to spend on the restaurants and food delivery services.

üñ• Home office setup: you'll have a 400‚Ç¨ allowance in your first payroll to set up your home office and a 35‚Ç¨ monthly allowance for remote expenses.

üôå Feedback culture: feedback is the breakfast of champions, and we take it seriously! We have a real-time and honest feedback culture, and a formal 360¬∫ assessment every 6 months.




If you think you don't tick all the boxes, we'd still love to hear from you. Nobody checks every box, and we are looking for someone excited to join the team!

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
My client in the financial services industry is looking for a Business Data Analyst on an autonomo contract (6-12 months) with it extending to a 2-3 years project. It will be on a hybrid basis in the office 3 days a week in Madrid.




Responsibilities

Main responsible of Business requirement gathering, User Story writing and lead User Story refinement efforts within the team. Able to build small prototypes and mock-ups as part of refinement efforts.
Participate together with engineers on the design of the solution.
Work together with Stakeholders during the Acceptance stage of solutions to guarantee successful delivery.
Can understand business processes and suggest improvements to the data platform.




Requirements

Data Architecture / Data Modelling knowledge.
Python Programming for Data.
Expert in Data Analysis / SQL Programming.
Must have strong communication and stakeholder management skills.
Understanding of REST APIs / SOAP APIs ( ability to read / understand technical specifications)
Experienced in Microsoft Power BI (ability to design prototypes to support requirements)







If interested, please apply and I will be in touch to discuss the role.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who are we?

We are South Europe Technologies (S.ET); the IT, Data and Operations Shared Service Center of BNP Paribas Personal Finance, with delivery centers in Spain and Portugal, providing the best solutions to BNPP PF entities around the world such as Cetelem (specialized, between others, in financial partnership of major retailers, consumer goods companies and car dealerships).

Among Other Services, Our Portfolio Is Composed Of


Applications Management (Architecture, Project Management, Development, and Quality Assurance).
IT Risks & Cybersecurity Services.
Platforms Management.
Data Analytics and AI.
Operations.


Our offices are in Spain (Madrid) and Portugal (Lisbon, Porto). The company brings together over 200+ employees, with expertise in various technologies (Java, .Net, Python, Tibco, APIGee) and other operational roles (Functional Analyst, Project Manager, Business Analyst, Auto Stock Financing operators). We keep growing!

Our consistent track record of services delivery means comfort for our customers and opportunities for our employees.

You will find SE.T to be full of energy and an Inclusive Workplace in which you truly can make a difference.

Would you like to join our international team that delivers end-to-end solutions (applications and operations activities) to businesses of BNP Paribas Personal Finance Group entities around the world?

In a context of maintaining the high level of existing activities while growing the number of international customers, we are looking for our Data Analyst.

Mission

We are searching for the best talent to provide analytical and reporting support to the Data Office perimeter to optimize decision making and develop cross-functional data products.

Main Responsibilities


Perform data analysis: Provide conclusions, propose improvements, identify, or solve problems, or investigate business questions based on data.
Reporting: Implement and analyze data plans based on the measurement needs of your internal customers. Automate reports, design, and manage the publication of dashboards on visualization tools such as Power BI and Tableau.
Technically responsible for the data domains under the responsibility of the Data Office: Support to the definition and implementation of controls, management of registrations and modifications of the necessary views in the Information Center/Datahub, etc.
Manage the technical development of analytical products by coordinating resources from Central analytical Hubs: Reporting, ML models, ad-hoc analysis, data exploration, etc.
Contribute to the proposals on technological platforms and governance model elaborated by the Data Office with its opinion and experience.


What We Are Looking For


Academic background: Degree / Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Statistics, Big Data or equivalent experience.
You have two years of proven working experience in the data transformation to extract key insights using statistical/analytical concepts.
Proven experience in execution and automation of ETL's based on SAS, SQL or others.
Knowledge of Phyton, Dataiku and Dremio.
You are engaged in day-to-day activities.
You have a transformation mindset, looking for the excellency.
You are a Problem-Solving and Decision-Making person, who:
Demonstrates advanced analytical and diagnostic skills dealing with issues that are ambiguous, lack known precedent or appear contradictory.
Sees the big picture and is fully aware of technology and business directions.
Has department, corporate and group objectives in focus while identifying and removing barriers.


Skills


Communication skills - Oral & Written.
Ability to collaborate/Teamwork.
Proactivity.
Organized, efficient, and able to meet deadlines.
Gives and welcomes feedback. Puts success of the business and team above own interest.
Experience in the Finance sector is a plus.
Management of the MS Office package (Excel, Power Point, SharePoint, One Note knowledge).
Management of visualization tools such as Tableau and Power BI.
Fluent level of English and Spanish is a must. Any other European language is nice to have.


About Our Culture

We are proud to create, maintain and develop business solutions for BNP Paribas Group entities around the world, while keeping a high level of service and providing added value to our customers.

Working in an Inclusive and Multicultural environment, we encourage everyone to develop their talents and skills, offering various career opportunities and internal mobility programs, within local SET teams or in other entities within the Group.

We value our employees' experience by keeping a well-balanced environment with flexibility regarding the work schedule and care for everyone's personal time.

We embraced a hybrid way of working because we believe social connection always adds value to our day-to-day activities.

Benefits


Training programs, career plans and internal mobility opportunities, national and international thanks to our presence in different countries.

Flexible compensation plan.

HTML:
Who are we?

We are South Europe Technologies (S.ET); the IT, Data and Operations Shared Service Center of BNP Paribas Personal Finance, with delivery centers in Spain and Portugal, providing the best solutions to BNPP PF entities around the world such as Cetelem (specialized, between others, in financial partnership of major retailers, consumer goods companies and car dealerships).

Among Other Services, Our Portfolio Is Composed Of

  • Applications Management (Architecture, Project Management, Development, and Quality Assurance).
  • IT Risks & Cybersecurity Services.
  • Platforms Management.
  • Data Analytics and AI.
  • Operations.

Our offices are in Spain (Madrid) and Portugal (Lisbon, Porto). The company brings together over 200+ employees, with expertise in various technologies (Java, .Net, Python, Tibco, APIGee) and other operational roles (Functional Analyst, Project Manager, Business Analyst, Auto Stock Financing operators). We keep growing!

Our consistent track record of services delivery means comfort for our customers and opportunities for our employees.

You will find SE.T to be full of energy and an Inclusive Workplace in which you truly can make a difference.

Would you like to join our international team that delivers end-to-end solutions (applications and operations activities) to businesses of BNP Paribas Personal Finance Group entities around the world?

In a context of maintaining the high level of existing activities while growing the number of international customers, we are looking for our Data Analyst.

Mission

We are searching for the best talent to provide analytical and reporting support to the Data Office perimeter to optimize decision making and develop cross-functional data products.

Main Responsibilities

  • Perform data analysis: Provide conclusions, propose improvements, identify, or solve problems, or investigate business questions based on data.
  • Reporting: Implement and analyze data plans based on the measurement needs of your internal customers. Automate reports, design, and manage the publication of dashboards on visualization tools such as Power BI and Tableau.
  • Technically responsible for the data domains under the responsibility of the Data Office: Support to the definition and implementation of controls, management of registrations and modifications of the necessary views in the Information Center/Datahub, etc.
  • Manage the technical development of analytical products by coordinating resources from Central analytical Hubs: Reporting, ML models, ad-hoc analysis, data exploration, etc.
  • Contribute to the proposals on technological platforms and governance model elaborated by the Data Office with its opinion and experience.

What We Are Looking For

  • Academic background: Degree / Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Statistics, Big Data or equivalent experience.
  • You have two years of proven working experience in the data transformation to extract key insights using statistical/analytical concepts.
  • Proven experience in execution and automation of ETL's based on SAS, SQL or others.
  • Knowledge of Phyton, Dataiku and Dremio.
  • You are engaged in day-to-day activities.
  • You have a transformation mindset, looking for the excellency.
  • You are a Problem-Solving and Decision-Making person, who:
  • Demonstrates advanced analytical and diagnostic skills dealing with issues that are ambiguous, lack known precedent or appear contradictory.
  • Sees the big picture and is fully aware of technology and business directions.
  • Has department, corporate and group objectives in focus while identifying and removing barriers.

Skills

  • Communication skills - Oral & Written.
  • Ability to collaborate/Teamwork.
  • Proactivity.
  • Organized, efficient, and able to meet deadlines.
  • Gives and welcomes feedback. Puts success of the business and team above own interest.
  • Experience in the Finance sector is a plus.
  • Management of the MS Office package (Excel, Power Point, SharePoint, One Note knowledge).
  • Management of visualization tools such as Tableau and Power BI.
  • Fluent level of English and Spanish is a must. Any other European language is nice to have.

About Our Culture

We are proud to create, maintain and develop business solutions for BNP Paribas Group entities around the world, while keeping a high level of service and providing added value to our customers.

Working in an Inclusive and Multicultural environment, we encourage everyone to develop their talents and skills, offering various career opportunities and internal mobility programs, within local SET teams or in other entities within the Group.

We value our employees' experience by keeping a well-balanced environment with flexibility regarding the work schedule and care for everyone's personal time.

We embraced a hybrid way of working because we believe social connection always adds value to our day-to-day activities.

Benefits

  • Training programs, career plans and internal mobility opportunities, national and international thanks to our presence in different countries.
  • Diversity and Inclusion Committee that ensures an inclusive work environment. In recent years, several employee communities have been created to organize diversity and inclusion awareness actions (PRIDE, We Generations and MixCity).
  • Corporate volunteering program (1 Million Hours 2 Help) in which employees can dedicate time out of their working hours to volunteer activities.
  • Flexible compensation plan.
  • Hybrid telecommuting model (50%).
  • 31 vacation days.

Diversity and inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas Group in Spain is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Docker is a remote first company with employees across Europe, APAC and the Americas that simplifies the lives of developers who are making world-changing apps. We raised our Series C funding in March 2022 for $105M at a $2.1B valuation. We continued to see exponential revenue growth last year. Join us for a whale of a ride!

We are looking for a motivated Data Analyst to join our Product - Data & Growth team. In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing and transforming data from various sources, developing and maintaining data models, and creating insightful reports and dashboards that drive business decisions. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure data accuracy and provide actionable insights that support key initiatives across the organization.

This is an excellent opportunity for someone who is passionate about data, enjoys problem-solving, and is eager to contribute to a growing data team. You will have the opportunity to collaborate with senior analysts and engineers, learning from them while also contributing to Docker‚Äôs data-driven culture.

Key Responsibilities:


Data Analysis and Transformation: Analyze and transform data using tools like Snowflake and DBT, ensuring the accuracy and integrity of data across various sources.
Data Modeling: Assist in the development and maintenance of data models that support both ongoing and ad-hoc analysis, enabling the team to make informed decisions.
Reporting and Dashboarding: Create and manage comprehensive dashboards and reports using Looker, providing clear and actionable insights to stakeholders.
Collaboration: Work closely with senior analysts, data engineers, and business stakeholders to understand data requirements and contribute to data solutions that address business needs.
Data Quality: Help maintain high standards of data quality by identifying and addressing data inconsistencies and errors.
Documentation: Contribute to the development of user-facing documentation for key data processes, metrics, and models to support the data-driven culture within Docker.


Key Skills and Qualifications:


Experience: 2+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related field, with a proven ability to work in fast-paced, cross-functional environments.
Technical Expertise: Proficiency in SQL and familiarity with data warehousing concepts. Experience with tools like Snowflake, DBT, and Looker is a plus.
Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret complex data and provide actionable insights.
Communication: Excellent communication skills, with the ability to convey technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a relevant field such as Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, or a related discipline.
Attention to Detail: A meticulous approach to data analysis, ensuring accuracy and reliability in all deliverables.
Learning Mindset: A self-starter with a passion for continuous learning and improvement, eager to grow within the data team.


What to expect in the first 30 days:


Get to know Docker! Familiarize yourself with our vision, mission, values, and product
Complete all required onboarding and training sessions.
Gain access to necessary systems, databases, and platforms.
Shadow team members to learn about our development workflows and key data assets.
Begin working on initial data analysis tasks, focusing on understanding existing data models and reports.


What to expect in the first 90 days:


Achieve a solid understanding of key data models, dashboards, and reporting structures.
Take ownership of smaller data analysis projects, contributing to the development and maintenance of data models and reports.
Collaborate with senior analysts on more complex tasks, learning best practices and advanced techniques.
Contribute to the improvement of data quality by identifying and resolving inconsistencies in datasets.
Begin creating documentation for key data processes and metrics, supporting the team‚Äôs data-driven initiatives.


What to expect in the first year:


Take on larger, more complex data analysis projects, driving them from inception to completion.
Develop and maintain comprehensive dashboards and reports that provide valuable insights to stakeholders.
Continuously improve data models and reporting processes, ensuring they meet the evolving needs of the business.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver data solutions that support key business initiatives.
Establish yourself as a key contributor to the data team, actively participating in the growth and success of Docker‚Äôs data-driven culture.


We use Covey as part of our hiring and / or promotional process for jobs in NYC and certain features may qualify it as an AEDT. As part of the evaluation process we provide Covey with job requirements and candidate submitted applications. We began using Covey Scout for Inbound on April 13, 2024.

Please see the independent bias audit report covering our use of Covey here.

We use Covey as part of our hiring and / or promotional process for jobs in NYC and certain features may qualify it as an AEDT. As part of the evaluation process we provide Covey with job requirements and candidate submitted applications. We began using Covey Scout for Inbound on April 13, 2024.

Please see the independent bias audit report covering our use of Covey here.

Perks (for Full Time Employees)


Freedom & flexibility; fit your work around your life
Home office setup; we want you comfortable while you work
16 weeks of paid Parental leave
Technology stipend equivalent to $100 net/month
PTO plan that encourages you to take time to do the things you enjoy
Quarterly, company-wide hackathons
Training stipend for conferences, courses and classes
Equity; we are a growing start-up and want all employees to have a share in the success of the company
Docker Swag
Medical benefits, retirement and holidays vary by country


Docker embraces diversity and equal opportunity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our company will be.

Due to the remote nature of this role, we are unable to provide visa sponsorship.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The People Analytics Data Engineering Team is hiring a Data Analyst with experience conducting ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) work using Python. The People Analytics function at Microsoft is modernizing our data infrastructure by migrating to Microsoft‚Äôs industry-leading Fabric platform. This role will enable analysts and data scientists across Microsoft to quickly generate insights and efficiently create AI solutions based on our vast collection of People data.

As a member of our team, you will be joining a dynamic work environment where innovation and collaboration drive success. You'll work with cross-functional teams to develop impactful solutions and contribute to projects that shape our business. This role offers growth opportunities and flexibility, whether you prefer hybrid, remote, or in-office work arrangements.

Microsoft is on a mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our culture is centered on embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their authentic selves each day. In doing so, we create life-changing innovations that impact billions of lives around the world. You can help us achieve our mission by representing Microsoft in today‚Äôs competitive talent market as we search for the nation‚Äôs top talent.

Responsibilities

Expertise in Data

Identifies and leverages appropriate sources of data to address specific business needs. Evaluates data for applicability to answering relevant and impactful business questions, determines methods for integrating data across sources, and addresses data integrity and/or quality issues independently and/or in partnership with other teams. Contributes to the development and/or recommendation of initial/prototype data models and/or tools for consumption by others and escalates complex issues with those models and/or tools to appropriate Engineering or Data-Science teams.

Business and Data Landscape

Develops depth of understanding of the business, its data landscape, and the lineage of those data across multiple areas. Considers relevant data sources and external trends, anticipates data requirements, and probes for insight to understand business- or data-related topics beyond stated concerns. Identifies connections and themes across first and/or third-party data sources and anticipates opportunities to leverage those connections and themes to contribute to the development of data infrastructure and analytical frameworks that enable the evaluation of business questions.

Experimentation and Innovation

Supports and/or consults with other teams on the build and execution of formal experiments or develops prototypes/proofs of concepts, to evaluate the impact of new or changed features or processes. Partners cross-functionally to advise on experimental design or evaluation frameworks for established data sources, as well as decisions related to data use, personalization, and the interpretation of results. Takes calculated risks and applies learnings, reports results, and identifies relevant data-driven recommendations and/or connections to results of other work.

Customer/Stakeholder Orientation

Leverages understanding of data and the business to examine projects through a customer- and/or stakeholder-oriented focus. Manages customer and/or stakeholder expectations regarding project/product progress and timeline and takes responsibility to enhance customer excellence. Assists and learns from senior team members to interpret results, develop insights, and communicate results to customers and/or stakeholders. Possesses a basic understanding of model accuracy and its dependency on data quality and can articulate these topics in relevant terms in customer or stakeholder discussions.

Improvement and Efficiency

Recommends efficiency improvements for core work related to analytics and reporting that are reusable, self service, and directed to meaningful interpretation of data and driving business decisions. Makes recommendations for efficient methods for conducting ad-hoc analyses, and whether to make them standard. Shares domain knowledge to create clarity, support readiness to consume and leverage data and/or insights and evaluate the viability of automated methods for use in data collection, reporting, and/or analysis.

Data Privacy and Governance

Stays abreast of data privacy requirements, responsible and ethical data handling practices, and models compliance with classification and governance rules and regulations. Ensures data have undergone appropriate Corporate, Executive, and Legal Affairs (CELA) reviews and ensures work products are in alignment with principles and controls and is aware of where to seek further expertise on data privacy rules and regulations when needed to determine the impact of updated guidance on work activities and results.

Model Evaluation

Understands linkages between analytical model(s) and business objectives. Assists with testing models on test applications. Analyzes model performance. Incorporates implicit and explicit customer feedback into model evaluation. Conducts review of data analysis and modeling techniques to determine factors that may have been overlooked or need to be reexamined. Contributes to the summary of the review process. If model is deemed deficient, seeks to determine why.

Orchestration and Collaboration

Works within and across teams to ensure alignment in data sources, methods, models, analytical tools and processes, and business priorities to deliver key insights and results. Engages stakeholders to identify and act on opportunities to leverage resources, data sources, and solutions that were instrumental to success in similar contexts and consults across teams on decisions related to data sourcing, analyses, and the interpretation of analytical results.

Data Analysis

Determines appropriate analytical and inferential techniques to address business questions, executes analyses and interprets results with actionable recommendations, and partners to build on others' analyses and frameworks. Critically evaluates the choice of tools, techniques, and assumptions to ensure they are appropriate within context and provides feedback on features and functions of analytical tools and/or models.

Reporting and Sharing Results

Shares and simplifies relevant findings and insights to tell stories of analyses through one or more means including dashboards, reports, data visualizations, self-service platforms, slides, internal forums, ad-hoc inquiries, and/or talking points. Ensures presented results are accessible, provides information accurately and clearly, and appropriately speaks to the needs of the intended audience(s). Recommends and makes improvements to insights reporting as appropriate.

Other


Embody our culture and values


Qualifications

Required Qualifications


Bachelor's Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Analytics, Data Science, Engineering, Computer Science, Business, Economics or related field AND 2+ years experience in data analysis and reporting, data science, business intelligence, or business and financial analysis
OR Master's Degree in Mathematics, Analytics, Data Science, Engineering, Computer Science, Business, Economics or related field
OR equivalent experience.
2+ years experience in ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) related work
2+ years experience using Python language
2+ years experience working with relational databases
1+ year(s) experience building data models (PowerBI, Tableau, etc.)

Additional Or Preferred Qualifications


Bachelor's Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Analytics, Data Science, Engineering, Computer Science, Business, Economics or related field AND 3+ years experience in data analysis and reporting, data science, business intelligence, or business and financial analysis
OR Master's Degree in Mathematics, Analytics, Data Science, Engineering, Computer Science, Business, Economics or related field AND 1+ year(s) experience in data analysis and reporting, data science, business intelligence, or business and financial analysis
OR equivalent experience.

Data Analytics IC3 - The typical base pay range for this role across the U.S. is USD $83,400 - $167,800 per year. There is a different range applicable to specific work locations, within the San Francisco Bay area and New York City metropolitan area, and the base pay range for this role in those locations is USD $108,900 - $183,000 per year.

Certain roles may be eligible for benefits and other compensation. Find additional benefits and pay information here: https://careers.microsoft.com/us/en/us-corporate-pay

Microsoft will accept applications for the role until September 12, 2024.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Title: Data Analyst, Lever Insights
Description:
At Lyft, our mission is to improve people‚Äôs lives with the world‚Äôs best transportation. To do this, we start with our own community by creating an open, inclusive, and diverse organization.

Data and analytics are at the heart of Lyft‚Äôs products and decision-making. The Central Market Management team works in a dynamic environment, where we embrace moving quickly to build the world‚Äôs best transportation.

Within Central Market Management, an Analytics Lead on the Decision & Insights team will take on a variety of problems ranging from long term business strategic decisions to weekly agile marketplace operations. We‚Äôre looking for a passionate Analytics Lead to take on some of the most interesting and impactful problems in ridesharing. You will work closely on Rider Engagement initiatives to help run the marketplace more efficiently. This is fundamental to the Lyft marketplace as these Rider Engagement initiatives help us communicate with riders, improve their experience and balance driver supply with rider demand. The ideal candidate has deep analytical skills, exceptional problem solving skills, and is comfortable working with a highly cross functional team.

Responsibilities:


Manage and improve Rider Engagement investment processes to run the marketplace more efficiently
Partner with Data Science, Product, Engineering, P&L Management and other cross-functional stakeholders to achieve business goals
Leverage analytics to understand critical business problems and recommend action plans
Develop frameworks, roadmaps, and metrics for the team and broader organization
Collaborate with other leaders and executives to build data-informed business strategies and roadmaps


Experience:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Engineering, Math, Economics, Analytics, Finance, Business or other related quantitative field
3-5 years experience in consulting, analytics, technology, strategic finance, or start-up operations
Strong ability in building decision making frameworks and data analysis, able to dissect business issues, analyze large amounts of data, and draw actionable conclusions
Very strong attention to detail, experience developing processes to implement strategy
Ability to think strategically about complex and unstructured business problems, leading to recommendations and action plans
Strong written and verbal communication skills for internal stakeholders, including senior leadership
Ability to effectively and independently build and maintain cross-functional relationships with stakeholders, manage multiple competing priorities, and drive projects to completion
Experience with a two-sided marketplace is especially desirable
Highly proficient in SQL and Excel/Google Sheets; Proficiency in Python is a plus
Entrepreneurial self-starter - you naturally take ownership, look for opportunities, and do whatever it takes to drive results


Benefits:


Great medical, dental, and vision insurance options
Mental health benefits
Family building benefits
In addition to 12 observed holidays, salaried team members have unlimited paid time off, hourly team members have 15 days paid time off
401(k) plan to help save for your future
18 weeks of paid parental leave. Biological, adoptive, and foster parents are all eligible
Pre-tax commuter benefits
Lyft Pink - Lyft team members get an exclusive opportunity to test new benefits of our Ridership Program


Lyft is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer committed to an inclusive and diverse workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other basis prohibited by law. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

This role will be in-office on a hybrid schedule ‚Äî Team Members will be expected to work in the office 3 days per week on Mondays, Thursdays and a team-specific third day. Additionally, hybrid roles have the flexibility to work from anywhere for up to 4 weeks per year.

The expected base pay range for this position in the San Francisco area is $114,000 - $142,500. Salary ranges are dependent on a variety of factors, including qualifications, experience and geographic location. Range is not inclusive of potential equity offering, bonus or benefits. Your recruiter can share more information about the salary range specific to your working location and other factors during the hiring process.
