Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities

Kforce has a client in Atlanta, GA that is seeking a Data Analyst who will support the Supply Chain and Logistics Organization with data analytics to help accurately predict failed orders by using historical data. The hiring manager is looking for candidates who understand how to create SQL queries and understands processes associated with data optimization. The Supply Chain/Logistics data will focus primary on the Pro customer at Organization and with a goal to improve upon the company's supply chain network as well as the Pro customers experience. Candidates who have exposure/ understand predictive models and how they operate are sought after but not a must have for the position. The goal of the Data Analyst's role is to optimize/analyze the Pro Customers/Supply Chain's data in order to tactically intercept orders who have a high likelihood of failing.

Requirements


SQL experience
Supply Chain experience
Tableau experience


Additional Skills


BigQuery
Supply Chain/Logistics background
Introduction into predictive models; Will need to run the ML models but will not need to create them
Strong analytical background
Ability to understand what variables matter and ability to ensure they are correct


The pay range is the lowest to highest compensation we reasonably in good faith believe we would pay at posting for this role. We may ultimately pay more or less than this range. Employee pay is based on factors like relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, location, performance, union contract and business needs. This range may be modified in the future.

We offer comprehensive benefits including medical/dental/vision insurance, HSA, FSA, 401(k), and life, disability & ADD insurance to eligible employees. Salaried personnel receive paid time off. Hourly employees are not eligible for paid time off unless required by law. Hourly employees on a Service Contract Act project are eligible for paid sick leave.

Note: Pay is not considered compensation until it is earned, vested and determinable. The amount and availability of any compensation remains in Kforce's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified in its discretion consistent with the law.

This job is not eligible for bonuses, incentives or commissions.

Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Shiji Group is a major software supplier in the hospitality and retail industries. Developing worldwide leading products and technologies, aimed at the international market and speeding up its globalization progress. Our team of more than 5,000 talented employees, in 70+ subsidiaries worldwide, is constantly adapting to facilitate the transition to fully integrated systems for our clients through a network of secure, scalable, and ready for the future platforms, so clients can focus on their core competencies of serving their customer and guests.




Job Description



We are expanding our team, and are currently looking for a proactive and detail oriented Data Analyst, to contribute to our international growth. The ideal candidate will have experience with data analysis and management, be comfortable with technology / SaaS Business Intelligence Tools, and is motivated by the opportunity to develop new ways to ensure a 100% data delivery & quality with the least effort possible.





Reporting to the Director of Product & Operations, the responsibilities include:


Perform data analysis and special reports for key clients, marketing and sales to identify data-driven trends and understand what matters and why.
Prepare excellent presentations, and consultancy documents to be delivered to clients.
Prioritize projects and the special data reporting pipeline and delivery times.
Execute, build and maintain data projects using Python, Excel, Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, Google Data Studio and some other data analysis tools like SPSS.
Structure, organize and maintain masses of information from different DBs to efficiently deliver on time the projects in pipeline.
Collaborate with the product managers to develop new visualizations, CRM data analysis and special data projects.


Qualifications



Candidates must be motivated, proactive and responsible individuals with:


Highly analytical mind.
Advanced Excel user.
Advanced Python user.
Experience managing the main Business Intelligence tool (Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, Google Data Studio).
Experience with advanced statistical methodology with knowledge in Python.
Desirable Knowledge in managing data through MySQL and API connections.
Results oriented.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to work well under pressure and manage their own time to deliver the Task / Projects.
Desirable knowledge in the Hotels sector and online reputation.




Requirements:


Excellent level of English. (Spanish desired).
Degree or being studying information technology, business administration, engineering or mathematical sciences.


Additional Information


Flexible work schedule
Free coffee, tea, and afterwork drinks
Brand new office located in the center of Barcelona
International team and fantastic work environment
Team building activities and charity donation programs
Discounts on Private health insurance, ticket restaurant, transport, kindergarten
Show more

Title: BI Data Analyst
Place: Sant Cugat del Vall√®s, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
This role is responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining business intelligence solutions using Microsoft Power BI. The role involves analyzing and interpreting complex data sets to provide actionable insights that support business decision-making and enhance organizational performance. The role also includes developing automated processes and integrating analytics to drive efficiencies and innovation. Effective communication and collaboration with business stakeholders are essential to ensure alignment and successful presentation of developed solutions.

Responsibilities


Develops and maintains Power BI reports, dashboards, and visualizations to communicate data-driven insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Analyzes complex data sets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that inform business decisions.
Designs and implements automated data processing and analytics workflows to improve efficiency and accuracy.
Partners with business stakeholders to understand their requirements and translate them into actionable BI solutions.
Ensures data quality and integrity by implementing robust data governance and validation processes.
Collaborates with data engineering teams to build and maintain data pipelines, ensuring seamless integration of data from various sources.
Leads and mentors a team of BI developers, providing guidance, training, and support to junior team members.
Communicates project progress, challenges, and solutions to stakeholders effectively, ensuring alignment and timely delivery.
Represents the BI team in cross-functional projects, driving the implementation of BI solutions and ensuring their alignment with business objectives.
Continuously evaluates and improves existing BI methodologies, staying updated with the latest trends and technologies in the field.


Education & Experience Recommended


Four-year or Graduate Degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Data Science, Business Analytics, or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience.
Typically has 4-7 years of work experience in business intelligence, data analytics, or a related field, or an advanced degree with 3-5 years of work experience.


Requirements


Python
AI/ML Knowledge


Knowledge & Skills


Microsoft Power BI
SQL (Programming Language)
Data Analysis
Data Visualization
Data Warehousing
Business Intelligence
Data Governance
Statistical Analysis
Effective Communication
Project Management
Stakeholder Management
Results Orientation
Learning Agility
Customer Centricity


Impact & Scope


Impacts multiple teams and may act as a team or project leader, providing direction to team activities and facilitating information validation and team decision-making processes.

Title: Data Analyst Apprentice
Description:
Barcelona, Spain

Hybrid

We are looking for an apprentice specialized in data analytics. Join a dynamic team in a complex Supply Chain and work for a leading perfumery company. We'll need you to leverage data in order to optimize supply chain, drive efficiency and enhance decision-making. We offer the chance to join a worldwide company promoting careers internally.

At dsm-firmenich people are at the heart of the company. We are committed to equal employment opportunities and value diversity in the workplace.

Your Key Responsibilities


Collect, clean, and organize data related to the supply chain, including data on suppliers, inventory, capacity, and Row materials.
Support regional IBP & operational processes, including inventory and supply chain management, Supply Planning, process management across AMET and EUR region.
Analyze data using statistical methods and software such as PBI, VBA, Python, or SQL to identify trends and patterns in the supply chain.
Create visualizations and reports to communicate findings to stakeholders, including senior management, developing dashboards to track progress over time.
Identify areas for improvement in the supply chain, such as reducing lead times, improving inventory management, and cost saving.
Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs). Stay up to date with industry trends and best practices in supply chain management and data analysis.


We bring


A rich history and a promising future of bold scientific innovation and passionate creation with our customers;
A space to grow by encouraging and supporting curiosity and an open mindset;
A culture that prioritizes safety and well-being, both physically and mentally;
A flexible work environment that empowers people to take accountability for their work and own the outcome;
Barrier-free communities within our organization where every employee is equally valued and respected ‚Äì regardless of their background, beliefs, or identity;
A firm belief that working together with our customers is the key to achieving great things;


You bring


Master's degree in Statistics, Engineering, data scientist, or equivalent.
Critical thinking and proactive work style.
Analytical skills.
Pro-active, positive attitude, and willing to learn.
Proficiency in Excel, Power BI, and other data analysis tools, to create and operate reports.
Knowledge is some code language software (SQL/ Python/VBA/M)
English is must, French/Spanish is a plus

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Techsoulogy is our way of doing things and our corporate brand that unifies a broad portfolio of specialist advertising, media, and entertainment firms. It combines the latest technology with a human-first approach and a constant exploration of knowledge in order to shape the media landscape.

At Techsoulogy we aim to provide a technology and human service that guarantee all areas of the advertising industry throughout the world achieving their goals profitably, effectively and ethically.

Our values drive our culture, which is the most important asset of our company.


We're fair
We're dedicated
We're honest
We're courageous
We're Team lovers


TAPPX with Techsoulogy

Tappx is a fast-growth AdTech company inside the Techsoulogy family. It delivers digital advertising solutions for multiple platforms including mobile, OTT/CTV and desktop.

Tappx‚Äô proprietary technology empowers publishers to maximize ad revenues across mobile and OTT channels. It offers a distinct point of difference, technology which has been specifically engineered for mobile and OTT markets, thereby offering brands and agencies increased trust and transparency.

Tappx has headlined across numerous high profile competitive growth rankings such as Red Herring in 2016, TECH5 in 2018 and in 2020 Tappx was featured as Europe‚Äôs 2nd fastest growing advertising company in The Financial Times FT1000.

In Tappx we keep growing and, therefore, we are looking for new talented people to join our Data team in our IT department.

As a Data Analyst you will:


Analyze complex datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business decisions.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports in Power BI, Data Studio, and Looker Studio.
Create clear and compelling data visualizations to communicate findings to stakeholders.
Ensure visualizations are tailored to meet the specific needs of different audiences.
Extract, clean, and preprocess data from various sources to ensure accuracy and reliability.
Work closely with business units to understand their data needs and provide relevant insights.
Translate business requirements into technical specifications for data projects.
Track and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success of initiatives.
Ensure reports are accurate, consistent, and delivered on time.
Stay updated with the latest tools and technologies in data analysis and visualization.
Perform statistical analyses to validate hypotheses and support business case development.
Use statistical methods to quantify the impact of various strategies and initiatives.


Your Dream Job Awaits at Techsoulogy! üöÄ

Indefinite Contract with Competitive Conditions

Flexible Working Hours (Take Control of Your Schedule) with core time

Hybrid Model in Barcelona (1 day in the office and the rest teleworking) or 100% Remote Work Anywhere in Spain

Cool HQ Offices in Barcelona and Co-Working in Madrid

Elevate Your Work Experience with Techsoulogy! üåü

Private Health Insurance

Mental Health Care with 20 Free Hours of Psychologist Support

1&1 English or Spanish Language Lessons

Continuous Training & Development Budget

Healthy Snacks, Coffee and (a lot of) Tea (HQ)

Fun-Filled Arcade Room (HQ)

Team Building Activities Twice a Year

Inspiring Internal Talks and Events

Interesting Employee Referral Program

Engage in Techsoulogy‚Äôs CSR Initiatives

Flexible Compensation for Transport, Meals, and Kindergartens

Ready to shape your future? Join us! üöÄ

#Techsoulogy #CareerPerks #JoinUsNow #WorkPerks #CareerGrowth

Requirements:

We are looking for if you have:


Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Engineering and Science programs, Economics, or a related field
3+ years of experience as a Data Analyst in programming languages such as Python, PySpark and experience with data manipulation tools like SQL.
3+ years of experience in data analysis and reporting.
Experience integrating data from a variety of sources.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
Experience in HTML and CSS is a plus.


Desirable:


Good at understanding data and extracting insights from it.
Pattern detection.
Fast learner, absorbs new domains quickly.
Proactivity.
Analytical mind.
Problem-solving aptitude.
Knowledge of Python, SQL and GCP.
Curiosity driven.
Result oriented

Title: Data Analyst Intern, EMEA
Description:
What You'll Do:

As a member of our Solutions & Innovation Analytics team, you won't just analyze data; you'll be the cornerstone that connects groundbreaking ideas with real-world business applications. Here, your expertise will not only shape solutions but also empower our clients and commercial teams to make impactful decisions.

What You'll Do:


Data-Driven Innovation: Leverage cutting-edge tech like Hadoop, Vertica, Tableau, Git, Python, and SQL to transform complex business challenges into groundbreaking solutions.
Collaboration at Its Core: Work side by side with cross-functional teams to deliver insights that not only drive revenue but also foster client success.
Tech Playground: Immerse yourself in an environment where experimenting with advanced analytics tools isn't just encouraged, it's part of your daily work.
Diverse Projects: From user need identification to scaling complex data solutions, your role will be dynamic, impactful, and full of opportunities to innovate.



Who You Are:


A problem-solver with a passion for analytics and a logical approach to challenges.
Interested in solving data problems using Python & SQL, and enthusiastic about automating and scaling solutions.
Business-minded with a goal to turn data insights into actionable strategies.
Team player who thrives in a collaborative, inclusive, and vibrant workspace.
Fluent in English and skilled at simplifying complex concepts for diverse audiences.
Eligible to work in Spain with no restrictions.



Your Work Environment:


State-of-the-art open office with a cozy, collaborative vibe.
Flexible remote working options - balance your life the way you want.
A tech-forward, primarily digital workspace.
Choose your hours: start early or a bit later, as long as the work's done.
Need special work hours? Let's talk about it!



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.


Show more
HTML:
What You'll Do:

As a member of our Solutions & Innovation Analytics team, you won't just analyze data; you'll be the cornerstone that connects groundbreaking ideas with real-world business applications. Here, your expertise will not only shape solutions but also empower our clients and commercial teams to make impactful decisions.

What You'll Do:

  • Data-Driven Innovation: Leverage cutting-edge tech like Hadoop, Vertica, Tableau, Git, Python, and SQL to transform complex business challenges into groundbreaking solutions.
  • Collaboration at Its Core: Work side by side with cross-functional teams to deliver insights that not only drive revenue but also foster client success.
  • Tech Playground: Immerse yourself in an environment where experimenting with advanced analytics tools isn't just encouraged, it's part of your daily work.
  • Diverse Projects: From user need identification to scaling complex data solutions, your role will be dynamic, impactful, and full of opportunities to innovate.


Who You Are:

  • A problem-solver with a passion for analytics and a logical approach to challenges.
  • Interested in solving data problems using Python & SQL, and enthusiastic about automating and scaling solutions.
  • Business-minded with a goal to turn data insights into actionable strategies.
  • Team player who thrives in a collaborative, inclusive, and vibrant workspace.
  • Fluent in English and skilled at simplifying complex concepts for diverse audiences.
  • Eligible to work in Spain with no restrictions.


Your Work Environment:

  • State-of-the-art open office with a cozy, collaborative vibe.
  • Flexible remote working options - balance your life the way you want.
  • A tech-forward, primarily digital workspace.
  • Choose your hours: start early or a bit later, as long as the work's done.
  • Need special work hours? Let's talk about it!


We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Associate Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
At Beyond, we power the business of Short Term Rentals through our cutting-edge, full-stack Revenue Management System. Venture-backed, we pioneered this space and have grown to be the globally dominant leader - obsessed with delivering value and performance to our customers. And the way we've been able to achieve those heights is our belief that People are the most important part of any business - starting with ours. We employ over 170 Beyonders across the globe who share in our commitment to making Beyond the best place to work.

It's with that in mind that Beyond is looking to add an Associate Business Intelligence Analyst. Reporting to our Director, Revenue Operations, you will play a critical role in delivering actionable and meaningful metrics to both internal and external stakeholders. Your primary objective will be to provide comprehensive insights that enable our internal teams to gain a holistic understanding of how our products and services connect with each other, and with our customers.

To excel in this position, you should possess a strong technical background and a proven track record in developing reporting, business intelligence, and data solutions. We're looking for someone hands-on, results-oriented, and eager to work cross-functionally.

Before reading further‚Ä¶

Beyond is passionate about diversity and cultivating our team's potential. If you're hungry for a good opportunity, but don't meet every point in this job description, please apply anyway!

As our Associate Business Intelligence Analyst, you'll be responsible for:


Data, Data, & more Data - Analyze & optimize our current data transformation pipelines. Create new data models to support business insights & monitor data quality.
Technical Partnership - Partner closely with other Tech, Product and Data engineering teams on the day-to-day execution of analytics, projects & new data initiatives.
Harvesting insights - Enabling effective decision-making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format.
Business Expertise - Leveraging a deep, data-driven understanding of the key drivers and metrics underpinning Beyond's products and business lines to draw insights and make recommendations that will help the company grow and scale effectively.
Showing the way to key stakeholders - Conduct deep-dive analysis with complex SQL queries and translate requirements into effective & innovative data visualizations and solutions in Mode. Partnering closely with our GTM, Finance & Product teams to support their business objectives through analysis.


So what kind of person are we looking for in this role? The person who will be successful in this role will be an:


Innovator - Insights without action are lost opportunities and you regularly seek new information, try new approaches, and want to increase the pace of learning
Storyteller - You love telling stories with data, and have a playbook for how to bring people along in the process
Explorer - You seek information that challenges assumptions and delight in finding insights that are not obvious.
Advisor - You have the ability to distill and share key data and insights that lead to better decision-making and strategy


Now that we've told you what the job looks like, here are the qualifications we're looking for in a candidate:


2+ years of experience working in a Business Intelligence / Analytics environment.
Strong data modeling & proficiency SQL skills with experience working with complex & large data sets.
Experience harnessing data from multiple sources and making it usable and accessible for non-technical users.
Hands-on experience with data transformation tools, query engines and data visualization tools (dbt, airflow & Mode are what we use)
Experience articulating business questions, and using available data to find answers that translate into business recommendations.
You have exceptional business intuition and conceptual thinking, with the ability to readily map business processes to the appropriate metrics.
Experience with dbt / Python is a plus


So what can you expect after you apply? Your application will be personally reviewed by a member of the Beyond hiring team and if there is a match in your experience and the role, you will:


Have a video conversation with someone on our Recruiting team. This is a high-level conversation about your experience and interest, but also an opportunity for you to learn more about us
Interview with our Director, Revenue Operations & BI
Complete a technical assignment
Meet with our team for deeper dive video conversations
Interview with our Chief Revenue Officer
Interview with our Chief Technology Officer/Cofounder


Company Values:

We are serious about our core values: We Care, We Are On the Same Team, We Inspire Trust, We Go Beyond, We Ship It, We're Curious. If those resonate with you, and you're ready to work with a team that lives and breathes those values, we want to hear from you.

Benefits:

Beyond offers a wide variety of benefits like: stock options, unlimited PTO, private health insurance and more! You can learn more about our benefits by visiting our careers site!

We Care about Diversity, Equity and Inclusion:

Beyond is committed to building a workplace that attracts humans of all genders, ethnicities, backgrounds, statuses and lifestyles. At our core, we care about our people and encourage every employee, partner and applicant to share their whole self with us. We are respectful of and empathetic towards different viewpoints, and believe that our ability to help short term rental managers succeed relies on us building a dynamic and diverse team. Whoever you are, you can Belong @ Beyond.

Any communication regarding job openings, interviews and/or offers will come from our @beyondpricing.com email domain

Please review our GDPR Statement here.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Company

Shalion is a data-driven company working for world-class manufacturers and brands worldwide. With its Digital Shelf Optimization and Retail Media solutions, Shalion provides innovative tools that facilitate e-commerce monitoring.

We, at Shalion, enable brands to make smarter business decisions in eCommerce, based on actionable data and insights providing information on online product prices, availability, share of search, etc. in more than 800 e-retailers and 50 different countries. Our client portfolio includes industry giants such as Heineken, Lego, Danone, and Nestl√©.

The role

As a Data Analyst at Shalion, your responsibilities include:


Developing and maintaining client and internal dashboards in Looker.
Collaborating with Product teams to shape the product roadmap based on customer feedback and market insights.
Translating business requirements into technical tasks, ensuring timely delivery.
Working closely with Data Engineers to expand and enhance datasets, contributing to roadmap planning.
Ensuring data quality and consistency across dashboards.
Translating product questions into actionable insights.
Support the team in solving problems and challenges related to reporting and information analysis to create best practices in data usage and consumption.


Your profile should include the following:


2+ years of experience working as a data analyst or visualization expert.
Hands-on and strong working knowledge of SQL.
High experience level with modern visualization tools such as Looker, Tableau, Qlik Sense, or Power BI.
Solid statistical background.
Experience working with business stakeholders and engineers.
Experience in data modeling for visualization.
Communication, teamwork, and problem-solving skills.
Ability to structure information, analyze it, and extract data according to business needs


Ideally you will also have:


An advanced degree in a quantitative field such as math, physics, computer science, statistics, etc.
Experience with market research analysis.
Experience working with a modern cloud data warehouse (Redshift, Snowflake, BigQuery, or similar).
Knowledge of Git and command-line
Prior experience modeling data in LookML and dbt (data build tool)
Be fluent with one or more common data-related programming languages (Python or R).
UX skills.


Soft Skills:


Prioritization: Skillful at prioritizing tasks, gaining stakeholder buy-in, and resolving conflicts.
Resilience: Able to thrive in ambiguous situations and enjoy problem-solving.
Curiosity: Eagerness to learn and engage in constructive discussions.
Quality-oriented: Can discern data quality and value code testing for growth.


What We Offer You


The possibility to contribute to developing a company-wide data direction, processes, and standards.
Hybrid work: one remote day and four days of in-office work to boost our productivity and promote a work-life balance.
To be part of a high-performing team in a fast-paced, innovative environment.
Talented, diverse, and very friendly work environment;
The fast-growing project, where you can grow and develop
A challenging project, where you can have great contributions and impact
International environment with more than 10 nationalities
Fresh fruit every day
Office with a good location in Barcelona (Sarri√†- Sant Gervasi).
Fixed-term contract.


Interview process


First interview HR screening
Second interview SQL assignment
Third interview CDO

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
Apply now ¬ª

We provide inspiration worldwide with our intelligent solutions for industrial automation. We offer a high degree of flexibility to our more than 20.000 employees. We provide you excellent prospects for turning your ideas into reality ‚Äì because innovation requires freedom and security. We need you. Apply now and keep the world moving.

Data Analyst Intern

About FESTO

FESTO is a leading global company in automation technology and technical education. We are committed to driving innovation and providing high-quality products and services to our customers. Our Digital Sales Hub in Barcelona is at the forefront of driving data-driven decisions to optimize our sales and marketing processes and strategies.

Job Summary

We are looking for a motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst Intern to join our Digital Sales Hub in Barcelona. This internship will provide hands-on experience in data analysis and the opportunity to work on impactful projects that enhance our digital sales and marketing capabilities. As a Data Analyst Intern, you will support our team by collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data to help drive informed business decisions.

Key Responsibilities


Assist in collecting, cleaning, and analyzing marketing and sales data from various sources to support business operations.
Support the creation and maintenance of marketing and sales reports, dashboards, and visualizations to monitor key performance indicators (KPIs).
Help identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in marketing and sales data to provide actionable insights.
Collaborate with the marketing team to understand data needs and provide analytical support.
Conduct ad-hoc data analysis and present findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.
Assist in ensuring data quality and integrity across different data sets.
Stay up to date with industry trends and best practices in data analysis and reporting.


Qualifications


Currently pursuing a Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Marketing, Economics, or a related field.
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
Proficiency in Python and familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Good knowledge of SQL.
Familiarity with statistical analysis and data modeling techniques.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Strong problem-solving skills and a proactive approach to work.


Preferred Qualifications


Knowledge of digital marketing metrics and analytics.
Understanding of marketing strategies and campaigns.


What We Offer


Hands-on experience in data analysis and the opportunity to work on meaningful projects.
Mentorship from experienced professionals in the field.
A collaborative and supportive work environment.
Potential for future career opportunities within FESTO.


Company: Festo Automation S.A.U.

Location:

l¬¥Hospitalet de Llobregat, ES, 8908

We look forward to your application!

Apply now ¬ª

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (Executive)
Description:
Marketing Data Analyst (Executive)







Dorna Sports is an international sports management, marketing and media company, which manages numerous World Championships in Motorcycle Racing. With a dynamic and fast-paced environment, Dorna Sports focuses on teamwork, stability and performance, and this role will also let you experience the true nature of Motorsports!







Main responsibilities







As a member of the Business Intelligence team, your main responsibilities will be collecting the data from different sources, analyzing the metrics and prepare comprehensive data reports.







Social Media Analytics




Track detailed performance/KPIs and deliver regular data-driven actionable insights to improve results

Benchmark reports: Analyze market dynamics, trends, positioning of Dorna‚Äôs championships and other relevant competitions in terms of Social Media/ Digital




Digital products insights




Transform the data/reports from Digital Products team to company insights available for all the company




Fan centric insights




Identification and description of our fan

Work cross-functionally with our Fan Experience team to provide them with insights







Candidate basics







Previous experience in Digital Analytics
University degree in Business Administration, Economics, Marketing or any related field
Fluent level of English and Spanish.
Intermediate to Advanced Microsoft Excel and Power Point proficiency is required to complete basics expectations of this role.
Experience with Sharepoint
Proficiency in data visualization tools (Data Studio, Power BI‚Ä¶)







Skills







Can learn "on the job" independently.
Committed team player
Excellent Analytical skills
Data-driven and agile marketing mindset
Attention to detail
Presentation and written communication skills.







Dorna is an inclusive company and guarantees respect for the diversity of its employees. The company does not discriminate due to gender, age, race, culture, physical ability, or any other reason. Candidates will never be eliminated from consideration due to any of those stated factors.

Title: Data Analyst, H&B Europe
Description:
Job Description

As a Data Analyst for the Health & Benefits (H&B) Europe Operations team, you will be a pivotal player in supporting our core platform, Benefits Engine, and ensuring the integrity and utility of our data. Your expertise in Excel, PowerBI, SQL, and PowerPlatform will enable you to produce critical ad-hoc reports, maintain and enhance reporting dashboards, and participate in our Global Data Clean-Up Programme as the Business Lead. You will also champion our Data Community across Europe, fostering best practice sharing and skill leveraging to enhance our country teams' capabilities.

The role will report into the H&B Europe Operations Leader, who will also serve as the Compensation Manager.

The Role

As a Data Analyst you will have responsability on below funtions:

Production of Ad-Hoc Reports: Utilise your expert knowledge in Excel, PowerBI, and SQL to generate essential reports, providing insights and supporting decision-making processes.

Creation of Reporting Dashboards: Employ your proficiency in PowerBI to maintain, improve, and develop new reporting dashboards that visualise data effectively for stakeholders.

Data Clean Up Programme Business Lead: Oversee the data cleaning processes as an expert in Benefits Engine and its data architecture. Ensure data accuracy and quality while being accountable for the completion of data cleaning tasks by collaborating with colleagues in-country or within the GSD teams.

Run the Data Community for Europe: Lead the regional data expertise community, currently including Spain, GB, and Netherlands, and expand it to encompass all countries. Facilitate the exchange of best practices and enhance the skills across the region.

PowerPlatform Experience: Demonstrate advanced proficiency with PowerPlatform, including the ability to create and manage workflows, apps, and automations that streamline operations and drive efficiencies.

Platform Connectivity Maintenance: Monitor and maintain the connectivity between Benefits Engine and local servicing platforms in Spain, Italy, Switzerland, and Poland, ensuring seamless integration and data flow.

Benefits Insights: Be a part of the development of the Market Facing Technology (MFT) strategy for Benefits Insights for local clients within Europe. Ensure timely implementation of future clients, suggest enhancements for the tool and oversee issue fixes as and when they occur.

Additional Responsibilities

Data Analysis and Mapping: Apply your data analysis and mapping skills to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for improvement within our data sets.

Stakeholder Engagement: Engage with stakeholders to understand their data needs and deliver solutions that meet or exceed expectations.

Continuous Learning: Stay abreast of the latest developments in data analysis tools and techniques, ensuring that our operations remain cutting-edge and efficient.

Data Factory and Azure AI Builder Expertise: Utilise your knowledge of Azure Data Factory to orchestrate and automate data movement and transformation. Leverage Azure AI Builder to infuse AI into applications, enhancing data analysis and insights.

Qualifications

The Requirements


Proven experience in data analysis, reporting, and dashboard creation.
Strong working knowledge of Excel, PowerBI, SQL, Benefits Engine, and preferably Benefits Insights, PowerPlatform, Azure Data Factory, and Azure AI Builder.
Experience in leading data-related communities and initiatives.
Familiarity with data cleaning processes and data quality management.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
Detail-oriented with a commitment to quality.
Ability to speak other European languages in addition to English an advantage, but not critical.


Equal Opportunity Employeer
Show more
HTML:
Job Description

As a Data Analyst for the Health & Benefits (H&B) Europe Operations team, you will be a pivotal player in supporting our core platform, Benefits Engine, and ensuring the integrity and utility of our data. Your expertise in Excel, PowerBI, SQL, and PowerPlatform will enable you to produce critical ad-hoc reports, maintain and enhance reporting dashboards, and participate in our Global Data Clean-Up Programme as the Business Lead. You will also champion our Data Community across Europe, fostering best practice sharing and skill leveraging to enhance our country teams' capabilities.

The role will report into the H&B Europe Operations Leader, who will also serve as the Compensation Manager.

The Role

As a Data Analyst you will have responsability on below funtions:

Production of Ad-Hoc Reports: Utilise your expert knowledge in Excel, PowerBI, and SQL to generate essential reports, providing insights and supporting decision-making processes.

Creation of Reporting Dashboards: Employ your proficiency in PowerBI to maintain, improve, and develop new reporting dashboards that visualise data effectively for stakeholders.

Data Clean Up Programme Business Lead: Oversee the data cleaning processes as an expert in Benefits Engine and its data architecture. Ensure data accuracy and quality while being accountable for the completion of data cleaning tasks by collaborating with colleagues in-country or within the GSD teams.

Run the Data Community for Europe: Lead the regional data expertise community, currently including Spain, GB, and Netherlands, and expand it to encompass all countries. Facilitate the exchange of best practices and enhance the skills across the region.

PowerPlatform Experience: Demonstrate advanced proficiency with PowerPlatform, including the ability to create and manage workflows, apps, and automations that streamline operations and drive efficiencies.

Platform Connectivity Maintenance: Monitor and maintain the connectivity between Benefits Engine and local servicing platforms in Spain, Italy, Switzerland, and Poland, ensuring seamless integration and data flow.

Benefits Insights: Be a part of the development of the Market Facing Technology (MFT) strategy for Benefits Insights for local clients within Europe. Ensure timely implementation of future clients, suggest enhancements for the tool and oversee issue fixes as and when they occur.

Additional Responsibilities

Data Analysis and Mapping: Apply your data analysis and mapping skills to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for improvement within our data sets.

Stakeholder Engagement: Engage with stakeholders to understand their data needs and deliver solutions that meet or exceed expectations.

Continuous Learning: Stay abreast of the latest developments in data analysis tools and techniques, ensuring that our operations remain cutting-edge and efficient.

Data Factory and Azure AI Builder Expertise: Utilise your knowledge of Azure Data Factory to orchestrate and automate data movement and transformation. Leverage Azure AI Builder to infuse AI into applications, enhancing data analysis and insights.

Qualifications

The Requirements

  • Proven experience in data analysis, reporting, and dashboard creation.
  • Strong working knowledge of Excel, PowerBI, SQL, Benefits Engine, and preferably Benefits Insights, PowerPlatform, Azure Data Factory, and Azure AI Builder.
  • Experience in leading data-related communities and initiatives.
  • Familiarity with data cleaning processes and data quality management.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
  • Detail-oriented with a commitment to quality.
  • Ability to speak other European languages in addition to English an advantage, but not critical.

Equal Opportunity Employeer

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Mission:

At Schneider Electric, you will contribute to solving the climate crisis and accelerating the energy transformation that our planet urgently needs. You will work among colleagues with very diverse personal and professional experiences, united by a vision of a better world.

Location & commitments:


Full-time job
Warsaw, Poland (office in Konstruktorska street)
Hybrid job (2 days remotely)
Your manager: Micha≈Ç Sirak


Your IMPACT:


Research and identify data and analytical business needs and determine possible solutions
Conduct data discovery, profiling, analyze data lineage and determine schema
Automate data sets extractions and transformations for analytical or reporting consumption
Scale-up, productionize, and maintain developed automations
Design, build and operate robust and scalable dashboards and visualizations
Perform light statistical analysis and machine learning
Listen to stakeholders and develop a deep understanding of their needs and priorities
Tenaciously solve problems and make decisions under uncertainty
Actively contribute to scrum ceremonies including sprint planning, daily stand-up, sprint review and retrospectives


Your Profile:


University degree in: Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Economics or equivalent
Hands-on experience with Python, databases and SQL
Hands-on experience designing, building, and operating dashboards and visualizations in Tableau or equivalent
Effectively communicating complex topics with non-technical users
Experience in applying statistical analysis
Passionate about learning every day and transferring knowledge
Good command of English


Preferred qualifications:


Experience with AWS
Experience with Databricks (or cloud-based data warehouse)
Experience with PySpark


Our Offer:


EXCITING JOB in an international company, which is leading the Digital Transformation of Energy Management and Automation, with significant market share,
DEVELOPMENT - the opportunity to gain valuable work experience in a supportive team of professionals,
ONBOARDING TRANINGS to help you find your way in our company,
WIDE CHOICE OF BENEFITS - private medical care, life insurance, sports card, performance bonus, benefits cafeteria with the possibility to exchange points for selected products or services,
BENEFITS FOR EMPLOYEES‚Äô CHILDREN from the company's social fund,
ADDITIONAL FAMILY LEAVE - for the birth of a child or adoption, to care for a family member or for bereavement (additional leave beyond the terms of labor law),
PROJECT WORK OPPORTUNITY (e.g., ambassador programme, mentoring, digitisation projects),
DIVERSE TEAM - working in a diverse team and the opportunity to use foreign languages in your daily work,
ACCESS TO TRAINING PLATFORM - training tailored to your needs and career goals,
RECOGNITION - points that can be exchanged for various products and services,
PARTICIPATION IN CSR or SUSTAINABILITY PROJECTS - 1 fully paid volunteer day per year,
EMPLOYEE REFERRAL PROGRAM - have a say in who you work with and get an attractive financial bonus,
NO FORMAL DRESS CODE - we welcome people as they are and see diversity as a value to the company.


Curiosity, Inclusion, Teamwork:

Nobody is flawless and not all career paths are the same. The important thing is that we have the will to learn and develop ourselves further. Because we know that career also means having to find your strengths first. Apply now, even if you don't fulfil all the requirements (yet). We look forward to getting to know you!

‚ÄØ

Your next step? Now apply online!

Looking to make an IMPACT with your career?

When you are thinking about joining a new team, culture matters. At Schneider Electric, our values and behaviors are the foundation for creating a great culture to support business success. We believe that our IMPACT values - Inclusion, Mastery, Purpose, Action, Curiosity, Teamwork - starts with us.

IMPACT is also your invitation to join Schneider Electric where you can contribute to turning sustainability ambition into actions, no matter what role you play. It is a call to connect your career with the ambition of achieving a more resilient, efficient, and sustainable world.

We are looking for IMPACT Makers; exceptional people who turn sustainability ambitions into actions at the intersection of automation, electrification, and digitization. We celebrate IMPACT Makers and believe everyone has the potential to be one.

Become an IMPACT Maker with Schneider Electric - apply today!

‚Ç¨36 billion global revenue

+13% organic growth

150 000+ employees in 100+ countries

#1 on the Global 100 World‚Äôs most sustainable corporations

You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled.

Schneider Electric aspires to be the most inclusive and caring company in the world, by providing equitable opportunities to everyone, everywhere, and ensuring all employees feel uniquely valued and safe to contribute their best. We mirror the diversity of the communities in which we operate, and ‚Äòinclusion‚Äô is one of our core values. We believe our differences make us stronger as a company and as individuals and we are committed to championing inclusivity in everything we do. This extends to our Candidates and is embedded in our Hiring Practices.

You can find out more about our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion here and our DEI Policy here

At Schneider Electric, we uphold the highest standards of ethics and compliance, and we believe that trust is a foundational value. Our Trust Charter is our Code of Conduct and demonstrates our commitment to ethics, safety, sustainability, quality and cybersecurity, underpinning every aspect of our business and our willingness to behave and respond respectfully and in good faith to all our stakeholders. You can find out more about our Trust Charter here

Schneider Electric is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It is our policy to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct.

Title: B2B Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

About Our Organization:

Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world across multiple formats, including print, digital, mobile and live events. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for more than 130 years and today has one of the world‚Äôs largest news-gathering operations globally. It is home to leading publications and products including the flagship Wall Street Journal, America‚Äôs largest newspaper by paid circulation; Barron‚Äôs, MarketWatch, Mansion Global, Financial News, Investor‚Äôs Business Daily, Factiva, Dow Jones Risk & Compliance, Dow Jones Newswires, OPIS and Chemical Market Analytics. Dow Jones is a division of News Corp (Nasdaq: NWS, NWSA; ASX: NWS, NWSLV).

About the Team: Our Technology team drives the evolution of our Technology, Engineering, Data, Product and User Experience functions. With a keen focus on delivering cutting-edge solutions, we shape the digital landscape for our customers, readers, and users. From revolutionizing visuals to optimizing tools and harnessing the power of data, mobile, video, and social platforms, our team is committed to providing a seamless and immersive experience across all touchpoints. Collaborating closely with our newsrooms and strategic partners, we spearhead the development of groundbreaking products and technologies. About the Role:

The B2B Analytics team focuses on developing analytics solutions to help the organization make better data driven decisions. Our team is passionate about enabling others to use data and analysis to measure and monitor performance, identify risks and opportunities and find ways to continually add value.

This role will primarily support the B2B side of the business, which includes Risk and Compliance, Factiva, Newswires, B2B Sales, Marketing, Content Licensing and Finance; but may also include exposure to other areas of the business, such as Advertising and our Energy lines of business. The ideal candidate will have previous experience in developing datasets, dashboards and data solutions that drive core insights. This position will report to the Manager of B2B Analytics.

You Will

Develop Stakeholder Partnerships


Develop strong partnerships with Product Proposition, Product Management, Marketing, B2B Sales, Content Licensing, Finance, Data Collection, Data Engineering and other B2B Stakeholder Business teams and work across all levels and areas of the organization.
Executie data project roadmaps based on the B2B Business teams‚Äô priorities.


Understand B2B Data


Build a thorough understanding of all the B2B data sources that we leverage in our Analysis projects
Partner with data engineers and data collection colleagues to collect, cleanse and consistently organize data.


Conduct Analysis, Create Dashboards, Improve Processes & Ensure Quality


Analyze large datasets to surface trends and deliver recommendations with tangible business outcomes.
Create intuitive reports, dashboards and data solutions using visualization tools (e.g. Tableau)
Continuously identify ways to improve and streamline processes around data and reporting
Ensure the quality of data and reporting, and partner with teams to improve accuracy and consistency


Clearly Communicate


Communicate technical information clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences


You Have


Team oriented and collaborative with eagerness to help others, and aspiration to be challenged and learn
Self starter able to work independently, coordinate with multiple partners and complete projects start to finish
Detail oriented with focus on assuring quality, consistency and accuracy in data and processes
Undergraduate degree or equivalent in combination of training and experience, preferably in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related disciplines.
Experience working with large datasets in a fast-paced and fluid environment with the ability to understand and solve complex non-routine problems.
Experience with data visualizations tools and techniques, and using data to tell a story (e.g. Tableau, Looker)
Extensive experience with SQL, and familiarity with Excel/Sheets, Github, Python/R
Experience with ETL processes and cloud-based or traditional tools (AWS experience a plus)


Reasonable accommodation: Dow Jones, Making Careers Newsworthy - We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.EEO/AA/M/F/Disabled/Vets. Dow Jones is committed to providing reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities, in our job application and/or interview process. If you need assistance or accommodation in completing your application, due to a disability, email us at talentresourceteam@dowjones.com. Please put "Reasonable Accommodation" in the subject line and provide a brief description of the type of assistance you need. This inbox will not be monitored for application status updates.

Business Area: Dow Jones - Experience - Data & AI

Job Category: Data Analytics/Warehousing & Business Intelligence

Union Status

Non-Union role

Since 1882, Dow Jones has been finding new ways to bring information to the world‚Äôs top business entities. Beginning as a niche news agency in an obscure Wall Street basement, Dow Jones has grown to be a worldwide news and information powerhouse, with prestigious brands including The Wall Street Journal, Dow Jones Newswires, Factiva, Barron‚Äôs, MarketWatch and Financial News.

This longevity and success is due to a relentless pursuit of accuracy, depth and innovation, enhanced by the wisdom of past experience and a solid grasp on the future ahead. More than its individual brands, Dow Jones is a modern gateway to intelligence, with innovative technology, advanced data feeds, integrated solutions, expert research, award-winning journalism and customizable apps and delivery systems to bring the information that matters most to customers, when and where they need it, every day.

If you are a current employee at Dow Jones, do not apply here. Please go to the Career section on your Workday homepage and view "Find Jobs - Dow Jones." Thank you.

Req ID: 42408

Title: Data Analyst Intern, Emerging, EMEA
Description:
What You'll Do:

As a member of our Performance Media Analytics team, you won't just analyse data; you'll be the cornerstone that connects groundbreaking ideas with real-world business applications. Here, your expertise will not only shape solutions but also empower our clients and commercial teams to make impactful decisions:


Client insights: you will analyze complex data from multiple sources to understand the performance of our advertisers campaigns and generate innovative and impactful insights
Data-Driven Innovation: Leverage cutting-edge tech like Hadoop, Vertica, Tableau, Python, and SQL to transform complex business challenges into groundbreaking solutions.
Reporting tools and metrics: you will develop and scale reports and metrics that will present actionable insights to teams across the business and strategic leadership teams
Tech Playground: Immerse yourself in an environment where experimenting with advanced analytics tools isn't just encouraged, it's part of your daily work.
Collaborative projects: you will work on ad hoc projects with different teams to automate analyses globally, improve our internal processes and our way of working and scale knowledge across the company.



Your Work Environment:


Flexible remote working options - balance your life the way you want.
A tech-forward, primarily digital workspace.
Need special work hours? Let's talk about it!



Who You Are:


A problem-solver with a passion for analytics and a logical approach to challenges.
Interested in solving data problems using Python & SQL, and enthusiastic about automating and scaling solutions.
Business-minded with a goal to turn data insights into actionable strategies.
Team player who thrives in a collaborative, inclusive, and vibrant workspace.
Fluent in English and skilled at simplifying complex concepts for diverse audiences.



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Data Analyst II (They/She/He)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Join our team and become an integral part of Glovo's Global Operations! We provide a dynamic and challenging environment filled with numerous opportunities for growth and development.

Couriers are the cornerstone of Glovo‚Äôs marketplace. We are seeking a Data Analyst who can strike the perfect balance between creativity and data-driven precision, turning seemingly impossible projects into reality.

In this role, you will be responsible for delivering insights and data to drive the core strategies of the Courier Supply Excellence team. By leveraging analytics, you will globally identify methods to enhance courier engagement at the order, hourly, and monthly levels. The KPIs you will influence are crucial to operations, as every decision made will directly affect the whole operational investment.

THE JOURNEY


Bring your boldest ideas to life and make an immediate global impact.
Understand and address local and regional needs by stepping into the shoes of the couriers and truly understanding their perspective.
Continuously explore and refine key operational metrics (delivery time, efficiency, costs), gaining a comprehensive understanding of Glovo‚Äôs operations.
Offer analytical support to teams across more than 20 countries by deepening the understanding of Glovo's operational model.
Enhance the strategies we use to define each market‚Äôs approach.
Manage dashboards and create new tools to improve the department‚Äôs metric visibility.
Develop analytical frameworks and models, while effectively communicating with the entire department.
Dive deep into data to identify key factors and actions to improve KPIs, taking accountability for outcomes.
Innovate to contribute to the ongoing improvement of courier profitability.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Math, Statistics or similar
+2 years of work experience providing internal teams with the necessary data to make the right decisions, banking / financial background is a plus
Strong analytical and coding skills: SQL and Excel proficiency (or extensive coding experience), and BI platforms experience (Looker, Tableau, PowerBI,‚Ä¶)
Python and experience working with analysis tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Scikit, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R is highly valued
Strong strategic vision and business mindset
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Comfortable working in high-growth and high-performance start-ups with a fast-paced
Professional English


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


üåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Data Analyst (Retention Analytics Team)
Description:
Job Description

Hi there!

We are Semrush, a global IT company developing our own product ‚Äì a platform for digital marketers. New stars are born here, so don‚Äôt miss your chance. This is our Data Analyst role for those who strive to implement functional processes and drive them to full completion.

We are seeking a Data Analyst with a h2 focus on Data Analysis and Business Intelligence (BI) to join our Retention division. The ideal candidate will support the development, implementation, and deployment of analytics on customer and product data, delivering actionable insights to drive business decisions. A basic understanding of Data Science principles will be beneficial in enhancing the analytical capabilities of our team.

Tasks in the role


Data Analysis & Reporting:
Conduct in-depth analysis of product insights and customer behavior to identify data-driven opportunities for improving customer retention and fostering profitable growth.
Analyze and report on data patterns and customer pain points using various data sources, including structured and unstructured data, benchmarks, and operational metrics.
Create meaningful reports and insights to support hypotheses, driving testing and experimentation.
Provide ad-hoc analysis and reporting to meet the evolving needs of the Retention division.

Business Intelligence:
Design and develop dashboards and reports in BI tools like Tableau or PowerBI, ensuring they are user-friendly and aligned with UI/UX best practices.
Create and maintain reporting specifications for new reports/dashboards and perform testing/validation to ensure data integrity, accessibility, and accuracy.
Consult with Retention division staff to identify new business reporting needs and provide guidance on complex data environments.

Data Systems & Documentation:
Document data analysis efforts, including data sources, reporting specifications, and issue/problem resolutions.
Ensure proper documentation of reporting and analytical tools for future reference and continuity.



Requirements

Who we are looking for

Technical Skills:


Strong experience in SQL and database design.
Proficiency in designing dashboards and reports in BI tools such as Tableau or PowerBI.
Basic knowledge of data science principles, with the ability to apply them to drive actionable insights.
Experience with cloud platforms and cloud storage solutions is a plus.
Understanding of data extraction using API calls.
Professional Skills:
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present complex data clearly and concisely.
Strong analytical skills, with the ability to interpret data and make data-driven decisions.
Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.



Not required, but a plus


2+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related field
Familiarity with cloud platforms, particularly GCP, is an advantage
Basic programming skills in Python or R for data manipulation and analysis
You share our common values: Trust, because we prefer to speak up and be our true selves; Sense of Ownership, because it‚Äôs not worth wasting time on something you don‚Äôt believe in; and enthusiasm for Constant Changes, because we are always looking to make things better



A Bit About The Team

You can get to know the team better at one of the interviews, but some brief information about future colleagues will be useful now.

Our team is a dynamic mix of analysts and engineers who collaborate on a wide range of analytics projects, including data analysis, dashboard development, model building, and A/B testing across various domains. We work closely with the Retention division, delivering actionable insights and helping to drive data-driven decisions. What sets us apart is our chill, supportive vibe and a deep belief in success through collaboration. We prioritize teamwork, knowledge sharing, and continuous learning. Everyone‚Äôs contributions are valued, and we work together to solve complex problems while keeping the atmosphere positive and fun. If you enjoy a collaborative environment where innovation is encouraged and teamwork drives success, you‚Äôll fit right in!

We will try to create all the right conditions for you to work and rest comfortably


This offer stands for the ‚Äúhybrid‚Äù work format: some days, you work from the office, and some #wfh. Trust us, it‚Äôs an efficient way of work. Proven!
Flexible working day start
Unlimited PTO
Hobby benefit
Breakfast, snacks, and coffee at the office
Corporate events
Training, courses, conferences
Gifts for employees



Finally, a Little More About Our Company

Semrush is a leading online visibility management SaaS platform that enables businesses globally to run search engine optimization, pay-per-click, content, social media and competitive research campaigns and get measurable results from online marketing.

We‚Äôve been developing our product for 16 years and have been awarded G2s Top 100 Software Products, Global and US Search Awards 2021, Great Place to Work Certification, Deloitte Technology Fast 500 and many more. In March 2021 Semrush went public and started trading on the NYSE with the SEMR ticker.

10,000,000+ users in America, Europe, Asia, and Australia have already tried Semrush, and over 1,000 people around the world are working on its development. The Semrush team is constantly growing.

Semrush is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, creed, color, national origin, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, ancestry, physical or mental disability, or medical condition including medical characteristics, genetic identity, marital status, military service, or any other classification protected by applicable local, state or federal laws. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, merit, and individual qualifications.

¬°Esta es tu oportunidad! En Grupo NeoElectra, l√≠der en el sector energ√©tico y en plena expansi√≥n, buscamos un Analista Business Intelligence para nuestras oficinas en Sant Just Desvern (Barcelona).


Si eres una persona resolutiva, motivada y con ganas de crecer profesionalmente en un entorno din√°mico, ¬°te invitamos a seguir leyendo!


Responsabilidades:


  • Dise√±ar, documentar, implementar y desarrollar el datawarehouse de la compa√±√≠a (desarrollo SQL y Power BI): Implementar procesos ETL para la carga de datos en el datawarehouse conectando con las diferentes fuentes de informaci√≥n (ERP, API's, CRM, archivos .xlsx, .csv etc), limpieza y transformaci√≥n de datos, etc
  • Integrar y automatizar la extracci√≥n de fuentes de datos internas y externas en la base de datos (ETL) administrando la estructura de datos (control de acceso, mantenimiento, monitorizaci√≥n).
  • Automatizar procesos de reporte y mejorar la eficiencia de los flujos de trabajo con una mejora continua, propuesta de nuevas implementaciones y soluciones.
  • Colaborar con diferentes equipos para comprender y/o descubrir necesidades, traducirlas en requisitos funcionales y brindar soluciones BI.
  • Crear tableros interactivos personalizados para el usuario final para facilitar la consulta y visualizaci√≥n de datos.

  • Experiencia trabajando en equipos de data engineering preferiblemente en entornos de datawarehouse en la nube.

  • Conocimiento de modelado de datos dimensional.
  • Experiencia previa o conocimiento de Power BI
  • Familiaridad con el entorno Azure o certificaciones DP-203 o DP-500.


Ofrecemos:

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Lo Que Ofrecemos

Your mission:

As a Data Analyst for KION ITS (Industrial Trucks & Services) Production and Order Processing (Inventory) Data, you will extract and analyze data from diverse data sources and systems to successfully implement new pricing strategies and processes.

You will translate commercial operations demands into technical requirements, architecture concepts and interface definitions, finding clever, automated and intelligent solutions and implement those in an independent manner.

Tareas y Cualificaciones

Your profile:


Completed studies in computer science, (business) information systems, (business) mathematics or a comparable education.
Experience in translate business needs into technical specifications and preparing clean and structured data models.
Experience in working with modern data infrastructures und data integration processes.
Used to collaborate closely in interdisciplinary teams with business stakeholders, product managers, data analysts among others.
Experience working with technologies like SAP, SAP Business Warehouse, Power BI, Python, Azure, Dataverse and SQL-based databases.
High degree of initiative and solution orientation
Fluent in English, German is a plus.
