Title: BI Specialist
Description:
Our Manifesto

At Heura we are food activists, and our mission is to provide a solution that leaves animals out of the equation, while feeding millions of people in a sustainable way. Technology gives us the opportunity to build a food system that not only solves our current challenges but also responds to our values.

We also know that great goals can only be achieved by diverse teams of people with different backgrounds, perspectives, orientations, abilities, food tastes, dress sense, and time zones - we don't just accept our differences; we fully support and celebrate them.

But ultimately, we all have one common goal: accelerating the protein transition.

And that‚Äôs why we are looking for a BI Specialist! To join the Good Rebels team and help us achieve our mission through facilitating informed and strategic decision making through the analysis and visualization of business-relevant data.

Your Challenge


Business Requirements Analysis: Collaborate with different departments to understand their needs and translate them into technical requirements. Identify key areas for improvement and optimization opportunities through data analysis.
Dashboard Design and Development: Create interactive and visually appealing dashboards to facilitate decision-making. Ensure dashboards are intuitive, easy to use, and tailored to end-users. Utilize data visualization tools such as Power BI.
Data Extraction and Transformation: Obtain data from various sources (databases, ERP systems, CRM systems, etc.) and transform it into usable information. Design and maintain ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes to ensure data quality and consistency.
Data Analysis: Perform complex data analyses to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies. Generate ad hoc reports to answer specific business questions.
Data Management: Ensure the integrity, accuracy, and security of the data. Implement and maintain an efficient and scalable data model.
User Training and Support: Provide training and support to end-users to help them effectively use the dashboards. Create documentation and user guides for the developed tools and dashboards.
Continuous Improvement: Monitor dashboard performance and make adjustments as needed. Stay updated on the latest trends and technologies in BI to continuously improve offered solutions.
Communication and Collaboration: Act as a liaison between the IT department and business areas to ensure alignment of technological and business objectives. Facilitate meetings and presentations to communicate findings and recommend actions based on data analysis.
BI Strategy Development: Contribute to the development and implementation of the company's BI strategy. Ensure BI solutions are aligned with the organization's strategic objectives.
Process Automation: Identify and automate repetitive processes to improve operational efficiency. Implement automatic alerts and notifications based on critical business data.
Power BI ownership: from modelling, data sources, metric calculation, visualizations, service, effective distribution and security access



YOU WILL FEEL COMFORTABLE, ENJOY AND DO GREAT AT THIS ROLE IF YOU HAVE:


A Caring attitude towards our mission and see it as a ‚Äúpersonal‚Äù problem to be solved professionally.
Desire to help, assist and solve people's needs with a GoodVibes attitude.
Passion for the business and a deep understanding of it to make sure your job at this role is aligned to business needs and goals.
Previous experience in similar roles, ideally at an FMCG company or a high-growth startup.
Computer engineering, computer CFGS or similar. Ideal Power BI Certification.
Proficiency with Microsoft Power BI (Desktop application and the Service, and Gateway). Any other similar BI tool such as Tableau, SAS, Qlik, Sisense, Oracle Analytics Cloud, MicroStrategy or Microsoft Excel would be beneficial.
Be familiar with data sources, data warehouses, data models, data quality, data visualization and data security.
Be able to use SQL, Python, R or other programming languages to manipulate and analyze data.
Be aware of the latest trends and innovations in BI, such as cloud computing, artificial intelligence and big data.
Excel skills with Power Query and Data Modelling
Underlying awareness of SQL Server, or any other Database Management systems
Knowledge of SAP solutions
An analytical, critical thinking and problem-solving mindset to approach everyday challenges.
Ability to prioritize and anticipate opportunities
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in both English (mandatory) and Spanish.
Ability to create strong and trustful relationships with internal and external stakeholders.



Heura Life Benefits

To make this world a better place is hard work, so we support our Dream Team with:


Culture of freedom, responsibility, and constructive feedback
An entrepreneurial environment that encourages innovation
Regulatory local labour days + 5 extra ones for Vacations! (capped in 30 labour days yearly)
Flexible working environment
Private Health Insurance or Medical Allowance
Organic coffee, tea & plant-based drinks (in local offices)
Discounted gym memberships
Discounts on Heura‚Äôs products
Flexible retribution (in Spain)
After-work gatherings and other cool company events (in local offices)
and‚Ä¶



‚Ä¶ Working with top-talented and amazing Good Rebels! üëáüèΩ

We care deeply, which leads us to have a genuine curiosity to understand the core of challenges and get the right diagnosis in order to recognize what will have the most impact.

We find the best hacker solution to each challenge; if it exists, we go for it, if not, we enjoy creating it. We ensure the structures we build are the most efficient ones: we grow two trees from one seed.

We are also high achievers: we never give up. We are fully focused on generating scalable impact taking end-to-end accountability.

None of this would make sense if we didn‚Äôt enjoy the journey. We smile and celebrate every day because we are passionate about our work and our mission.

If you see yourself here and can meet the essential requirements, we would love for you to apply. Or, do you know someone who would be a perfect fit? Let them know!

Our mission is to build a net-positive food system by accelerating the protein transition with the ambition of not just being an alternative to current problems but successors by creating value chains that integrate what matters and empowering people to be part of this change.

üåøüíõ

Title: Data Analytics
Description:
Who We Are

We simplify wealth creation. Founded in 2014 in Vienna, Austria by Eric Demuth, Paul Klanschek and Christian Trummer, we‚Äôre here to help people trust themselves enough to build their financial freedom ‚Äî for now and the future. Our user-friendly, trade-everything platform empowers both first-time investors and seasoned experts to invest in the cryptocurrencies, crypto indices, stocks*, precious metals and commodities* they want ‚Äî with any sized budget, 24/7. Our global team works across different cultures and time zones, bringing our products to more than 4 million customers, making us one of Europe‚Äôs safest and most secure platforms that powers modern investing.

Headquartered in Austria but operating across Europe, our products are built by fast-moving, talented, ‚Äúroll-up-your-sleeves-and-make-it-happen‚Äù kind of people. It‚Äôs these diverse perspectives and innovative minds operating as ONE TEAM that keep Bitpanda at the cutting edge of our industry. So if you‚Äôre someone who thinks big, moves fast and wants to make an impact right from day one, then get ready to join our industry-changing team. Let‚Äôs go!

Your mission

Do you want to join a growing team of data enthusiasts who operate a modern data platform and build user-friendly data products? Are you passionate about enabling decision making and constantly learning with us? Then our Data Engineering team will be perfect for you!

What You‚Äôll Do


Contribute to the ongoing design of our core data model to support advanced analytics and reporting.
Engage and collaborate with stakeholders to identify reporting needs/requirements and potential enhancements early on.
Ensure high data quality of the core data layer.
Enable analysts across the whole organisation.
Contribute to team strategy and roadmapping to align the team‚Äôs efforts with broader organisational goals.



Who You Are


Strong experience with SQL, Python and dbt - Airflow is a plus.
Hands-on experience with data-modelling
Understanding of different data-modelling concepts (dimensional modelling, OBT, ‚Ä¶) and data quality
Willingness to learn and to grow with the team



What‚Äôs In It For You


Hybrid-working model with a 50/50 split between in-office and home, plus 60 Work From Anywhere days annually
Total compensation package including participation in our Bitpanda stock option plan
Competitive benefits programs and policies shaped by our flexibility-first philosophy
Exclusive premiums when trading on Bitpanda
Company-wide and team events ‚Äî both in-person and virtually!
Bitpanda swag to keep you living the brand



And, above all, the opportunity to learn and grow as part of Bitpanda‚Äôs incredible journey towards being Europe‚Äôs future #1 investment platform.

Bitpanda is committed to fostering a fair and equal environment based on trust and mutual respect. We believe that a diverse and inclusive workplace is paramount to our success and we are committed to building a team that represents a wide variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills.

HTML:
Who We Are

We simplify wealth creation. Founded in 2014 in Vienna, Austria by Eric Demuth, Paul Klanschek and Christian Trummer, we‚Äôre here to help people trust themselves enough to build their financial freedom ‚Äî for now and the future. Our user-friendly, trade-everything platform empowers both first-time investors and seasoned experts to invest in the cryptocurrencies, crypto indices, stocks*, precious metals and commodities* they want ‚Äî with any sized budget, 24/7. Our global team works across different cultures and time zones, bringing our products to more than 4 million customers, making us one of Europe‚Äôs safest and most secure platforms that powers modern investing.

Headquartered in Austria but operating across Europe, our products are built by fast-moving, talented, ‚Äúroll-up-your-sleeves-and-make-it-happen‚Äù kind of people. It‚Äôs these diverse perspectives and innovative minds operating as ONE TEAM that keep Bitpanda at the cutting edge of our industry. So if you‚Äôre someone who thinks big, moves fast and wants to make an impact right from day one, then get ready to join our industry-changing team. Let‚Äôs go!

Your mission

Do you want to join a growing team of data enthusiasts who operate a modern data platform and build user-friendly data products? Are you passionate about enabling decision making and constantly learning with us? Then our Data Engineering team will be perfect for you!

What You‚Äôll Do

  • Contribute to the ongoing design of our core data model to support advanced analytics and reporting.
  • Engage and collaborate with stakeholders to identify reporting needs/requirements and potential enhancements early on.
  • Ensure high data quality of the core data layer.
  • Enable analysts across the whole organisation.
  • Contribute to team strategy and roadmapping to align the team‚Äôs efforts with broader organisational goals.


Who You Are

  • Strong experience with SQL, Python and dbt - Airflow is a plus.
  • Hands-on experience with data-modelling
  • Understanding of different data-modelling concepts (dimensional modelling, OBT, ‚Ä¶) and data quality
  • Willingness to learn and to grow with the team


What‚Äôs In It For You

  • Hybrid-working model with a 50/50 split between in-office and home, plus 60 Work From Anywhere days annually
  • Total compensation package including participation in our Bitpanda stock option plan
  • Competitive benefits programs and policies shaped by our flexibility-first philosophy
  • Exclusive premiums when trading on Bitpanda
  • Company-wide and team events ‚Äî both in-person and virtually!
  • Bitpanda swag to keep you living the brand


And, above all, the opportunity to learn and grow as part of Bitpanda‚Äôs incredible journey towards being Europe‚Äôs future #1 investment platform.

Bitpanda is committed to fostering a fair and equal environment based on trust and mutual respect. We believe that a diverse and inclusive workplace is paramount to our success and we are committed to building a team that represents a wide variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills.

Title: Business Insights Analyst
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

We are looking for a world-class analyst to become part of our SEE (Southeastern Europe) Growth team. Are you able to translate data into actionable insights? Are you looking for a challenging experience in the fast and rapidly changing environment helping to build a product that will disrupt the On-demand market? If your answer is YES and you are eager to join a strongly data-driven and results-focused team we are looking forward to meeting you!

THE JOURNEY


Understand business needs of SEE countries under your scope and create insightful analysis helping your team to make the right decisions to boost Glovo presence and orders.
Identify growth opportunities to increase our user base focusing on traffic, conversion and retention rates and leveraging on levers such as pricing, promotions, events, CRM and other marketing levers etc.
Drive projects end-to-end translating business challenges into insights and actions
Identify growth opportunities to increase our user base, step change retention rates and maximize profitability
Take ownership of the reporting of KPIs by creating customized tools and using the available ones
Ensure these tools are scalable and up-to-date
Assist your colleagues in gaining access to the right data, and Communicate and simplify concepts to the audience's needs
Drive clarity and solve ambiguity using data-driven approaches
Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how our users interact with both our consumer and business products, identify growth opportunities, and execute on projects to drive growth and engagement


What You Will Bring To The Ride


2-3 years of work experience on analytical roles leading analysis and turning insights into actions
Bachelor's degree in Math, Engineering, Business, Stats or Quantitative field
SQL proficiency is mandatory / Python is a plus
Ninja expertise with Excel / Google Sheets is a must
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker or Qlikview
Business acumen and passion for end-to-end project management (from ideation and analysis into implementation).
Hands-on attitude is a must. You‚Äôll have to roll up your sleeves!
Proficiency in English
Strong consumer understanding skills


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


üåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Game Data Analyst
Description:
Ready for your next adventure?




We are Socialpoint, a world-renowned mobile games studio based in sunny Barcelona. Our games are positioned in the top rankings of both iOS and Android, and they are played and loved by millions of fans all over the world. We are proud members of the Take-Two Interactive and Zynga family, and we are on a mission to offer a great gaming experience and bring fun to everyone! We are looking to welcome yet another brilliant Game Data Analyst into our Analytics team, where you will be part of the Two Dots analytics team, work to understand our gamers‚Äô behavior, and work with the game teams to improve the product, drive retention & user conversion. Applying quantitative analysis, data science, statistics & programming, you‚Äôll draw business insights that add real value to Socialpoint . To truly make an impact you‚Äôll need to learn quickly & work well in a fast-paced environment while collaborating closely with analytics & game teams.







What will you do in Socialpoint?




Work with the game development teams to provide insights into user behavior and answer key business questions, turning our vast amount of data into actionable insights and transferable learnings.
Visualize and communicate the results of your analysis to senior stakeholders, making data driven recommendations that support key decisions.
Design and analyze A/B tests and other causal impact analysis to assess the impact of new features and changes.
Continuously educate stakeholders on data literacy and analytics best practices, to ensure they are empowered and autonomous to run analytically correct analysis.
Occasionally participate in advanced analytics projects, teaming up with other game data scientists & analysts to develop data tools and products.







Requirements




2-3 years experience applying analytics to answer business questions and mine for insights that drive value.
A bachelor degree in a quantitative field (e.g Stats, Maths, Physics, Engineering).
Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python for data exploratory analysis.
Experience with A/B testing.
Strong analytical skills in applied statistics. Prior experience with bayesian statistics is a plus.
Experienced creating dashboards and visualizing findings with a front-end visualization tool like Tableau or Looker.
Experienced designing and analyzing randomized experiments.
A fast learner, highly meticulous and proactive individual.
Pragmatic, you know how to balance short term and long term deliverables.
A team player, you establish effective relationships to work with others for the win.







What's in it for you as a Socialpointer?




Due to the COVID-19 crisis, we have employed a hybrid working from home/office system. So, what does this mean? All we ask is that you live within commuting distance of our office so you are able to come into the office for important meetings/events.

We have a hybrid working from home/office system. So, what does this mean? All we ask is that you live within commuting distance of our office so you are able to come into the office once a week or when you have important meetings/events.

Relocation support to help you move to Barcelona (if you‚Äôre not already here).
An impressive 25 days annual leave, plus a week in December (not including public holidays).
Monthly meal allowance at the office. Breakfast, Lunch and snacks included.
Private medical insurance for you and your family, to keep your health bar full.
Choose from the latest IOS or Android device upon joining (phone or tablet).
Free language lessons (English, Catalan & Spanish ).
Spotify Premium to add that special soundtrack that every adventure deserves.
Legendary social events & parties to let off some steam.
Players develop‚Ä¶Oops, sorry! People development is key for us: an amazing budget just for you to spend skilling up your abilities & knowledge to achieve real growth opportunities!







Benefits




Coming to work in the office? Don‚Äôt worry - we have you covered. Check out some of our onsite benefits:

State of the art gym facilities so you can level up your build stats.
Book an appointment with our onsite physiotherapist for your aches and pains.
A massive gaming room equipped with all consoles and games you could ask for.
Drop by our onsite hairdressers for a trim (and forget your wallet; it's a Guild perk).
Amazing catering for Breakfast and Lunch with our specialty coffee
Wellness room.
Gaming room .







Intrigued? We‚Äôd love to hear from you. Please click ‚Äúapply‚Äù to level up and submit your application in English.




Socialpoint is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. You‚Äôre welcome on the team no matter where you‚Äôre from, who you like, what you look like, or if you prefer Xbox over Playstation. It‚Äôs a trick question ‚Äì mobile wins every time! We hire based on your qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities. Our games are for everyone, and so is our workplace.

We have a hybrid working from home/office system. So, what does this mean? All we ask is that you live within commuting distance of our office so you are able to come into the office once a week or when you have important meetings/events.

  • Relocation support to help you move to Barcelona (if you‚Äôre not already here).
  • An impressive 25 days annual leave, plus a week in December (not including public holidays).
  • Monthly meal allowance at the office. Breakfast, Lunch and snacks included.
  • Private medical insurance for you and your family, to keep your health bar full.
  • Choose from the latest IOS or Android device upon joining (phone or tablet).
  • Free language lessons (English, Catalan & Spanish ).
  • Spotify Premium to add that special soundtrack that every adventure deserves.
  • Legendary social events & parties to let off some steam.
  • Players develop‚Ä¶Oops, sorry! People development is key for us: an amazing budget just for you to spend skilling up your abilities & knowledge to achieve real growth opportunities!



Benefits


Coming to work in the office? Don‚Äôt worry - we have you covered. Check out some of our onsite benefits:

  • State of the art gym facilities so you can level up your build stats.
  • Book an appointment with our onsite physiotherapist for your aches and pains.
  • A massive gaming room equipped with all consoles and games you could ask for.
  • Drop by our onsite hairdressers for a trim (and forget your wallet; it's a Guild perk).
  • Amazing catering for Breakfast and Lunch with our specialty coffee
  • Wellness room.
  • Gaming room .



Intrigued? We‚Äôd love to hear from you. Please click ‚Äúapply‚Äù to level up and submit your application in English.


Socialpoint is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. You‚Äôre welcome on the team no matter where you‚Äôre from, who you like, what you look like, or if you prefer Xbox over Playstation. It‚Äôs a trick question ‚Äì mobile wins every time! We hire based on your qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities. Our games are for everyone, and so is our workplace.

Title: HR Data Analyst (100% remote-friendly within Spain/Poland)
HTML:
Welcome to the good side of tech üëã

You might have heard about us, but with a different name: Doctoralia. It all started 10 years ago, when we asked ourselves: is anyone in healthcare thinking about patients? We jumped in and we empowered patients by giving them access to leave and read reviews about their visit. We then provided doctors with the technology to manage bookings easily and save time, so they could devote themselves to what they always wanted: treating patients. And today is the day in which we ask you: will you join us in the next step of making the healthcare experience more human?

Docplanner at scale

We are leaders in 13 countries so far, and more than 90 million patients trust us every month. Almost 300.000 specialists believe in us and our product, and so do leading venture capital funds such as Point Nine Capital, Goldman Sachs Asset Management and One Peak Partners. And yet, employing over 2.700 people all over the globe, we managed to keep the startup-mindset we started with over 10 years ago.


Job Description

Our primary objective is to assist business in making decisions based on data, with a particular emphasis on producing global reports as the primary and most reliable source of information. A team of 12 experts provides support to various departments, including marketing, sales, customer success, finance, and people experience, for both short-term and long-term projects. Collaborating closely with stakeholders, we strive to develop reports, analyses, models, and recommendations that enable us to gain a deep understanding of how we can enhance the satisfaction of both doctors and patients.

How would you be impacting our mission?

  • Derive facts from data and translate them into actionable insights and recommendations;
  • Support the People Experience (HR) team with identifying opportunities and making intelligent, data-driven decisions. You will execute end-to-end data projects and be the main point of contact for the internal stakeholders;
  • Leverage reporting, data analytics, data quality and visualization to provide insights for routine and ad-hoc operational requests;
  • Co-creating key definitions of KPIs, and ensuring their global alignment.


Qualifications

What will help you thrive?

  • Demonstrable experience in using SQL to derive actionable insights;
  • Have 2+ years of experience in the business/ data/ HR analysis area;
  • Experience in working with business oriented teams, knowing how to adjust their way of explanation to the audience;
  • Experience in data management and visualization (experience in Tableau is a plus);
  • Experience in conducting quantitative and qualitative research; can work with multiple sources of data;
  • Experience in leading and executing end-to-end Data projects;
  • Strong presentation skills, with the ability to influence and engage diverse audiences;
  • Strong written and oral communication skills in English.

Which skills are ‚Äòbonus points‚Äô?

  • Have a degree in Economics, Statistics, Econometrics or a related field;
  • Experience in working in an international team;
  • Can take a step back from the technicalities and examine them through a business lens;
  • Like to see the instant effects of your work;
  • Are careful, diligent, and detail-oriented.


Additional Information

What will you get in return?

Let‚Äôs talk money

  • Flexible remuneration and benefits system via Flexoh, which includes: restaurant card, transportation card, kindergarten, and training tax savings;
  • Share options plan after 6 months of working with us.

True flexibility and work-life balance

  • Remote first in one of our legal entities or hybrid work model in one of our office locations;
  • Flexible working hours;
  • Paid time off according to your location of work;
  • Additional paid holiday on your birthday or work anniversary (you choose what you want to celebrate).

Health comes first

  • Health insurance according to your location of work;
  • Access to iFeel, a technological platform for mental wellness offering online psychological support and counseling.

What does the recruitment process look like?

  • A 30-minute Screening Call with one of our Talent Acquisition Partners: Lilly Kilian or Anna Reinhardt;
  • Meet our CPO Lucjan Samulowski within two separate 60-minute meetings.
  • A 60-minute technical interview with Wiktor Kulikowski - BI Manager
  • A 60-minute business case review with Lucjan and Wiktor

We promote and embrace equal opportunities in our hiring process, and also every day at work. When you apply for our roles you receive equal treatment regardless of age, disabilities, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or parental status, race, color, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation or any other dimension of human difference. If you require additional support in your recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to let us know. Behind those words you‚Äôre reading, there‚Äôs a person (hi!) who already helped a candidate by adapting the interviews, and now we‚Äôre lucky to have this person with us. So, even if you‚Äôve never asked for it before, may this serve as a sign that, now, you can do so. We can only truly be equal if we adapt to each other.

‚ÄúWe believe all humans, in all their beautiful diversity, should have equal rights, dignity and respect. Period.‚Äù Mariusz Gralewski, CEO

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

You're an original. So are we.

We're a company of people who like to forge our own path. We invented the blue jean in 1873, and we reinvented khaki pants in 1986. We pioneered labor and environmental guidelines in manufacturing. And we work to build sustainability into everything we do. Our brands stand for freedom and self-expression around the world.

Where we lead, others follow. For more than 160 years, we've used the strength of our brands to lead with our values and make an outsized impact on the world. We employ more than 15,000 people globally to support our great brands: Levi's¬Æ, Dockers¬Æ, Denizen¬Æ, Signature by Levi Strauss & Co.‚Ñ¢ and Beyond Yoga.

About The Job

Levi‚Äôs is looking for a seasoned Analyst and Data Visualization Expert to support the data science and analytics team focused on Direct To Consumer data products. The ideal candidate is a great storyteller and strong technical contributor who has experience solving business problems with data-driven tools. You will be responsible for delivering a suite of analytical products including analyses, dashboards, insights, and recommendations with especial focus on clickstream data. You will collect, analyze, and present data to improve strategic decision making and to track the benefits unlocked by the data products. You should have a high degree of curiosity about the business and the skills to discover impactful insights from data. You should be able to communicate those insights in a way that builds confidence and enables decisions that drive business value.


Conduct analysis to estimate expected value of data products. Measure and track benefits created by data products, and convert them to financial or key KPI metrics
Support business stakeholders and regional data analysts by understanding their needs and providing guidance and support.
Create dashboards to track adoption and business impact of features and data product launched.
Dive deep into complex business problems and provide insights on digital features and AI model performance through hypothesis testing. Partner with cross functional teams on implementation.
Partner with data science, data analytics and product managers on planning, goal setting and prioritization.
Partner with data and engineering teams to improve instrumentation and product/models health reporting, pre/post analysis and business debugging.
Partner with A/B test team to design experiments and post-hoc analysis of results.
Bring data to life through storytelling in a clear and meaningful way to audiences with mixed levels of technical expertise and informing key strategic decisions.
Promote a culture of data driven technical excellence, ownership, collaboration.


About You


3+ years of professional experience analyzing complex data, drawing conclusions, and making recommendations.
3+ years of applied data visualization experience. Tableau and PowerBI as main visualization tools.
3+ years of experience in extracting & manipulating large data sets from various relational databases using SQL (Amazon Redshift, Oracle, Google BigQuery).
Coding skills in at least one statistical or programming language (R or Python preferred) to import, summarize, and analyze data.
Hands on experience working with big data, ideally clickstream data, in big data volume sectors such as ecommerce, gaming, social network etc. ecommerce platforms are a plus.
Ability to translate and present complex analysis in executive summaries. Clear and effective written and verbal communication and strong interpersonal skills.
Strong problem solving skills.
Bachelor's in economics, Statistics, Data, Data Science and Engineering (Masters is a plus) or equivalent experience.


LOCATION

Barcelona, Spain

FULL TIME/PART TIME

Full time

Current LS&Co Employees, apply via your Workday account.

Title: Data & Analytics Junior Consultant - Azure
Description:
At EY, you‚Äôll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we‚Äôre counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

In a fast-changing and uncertain world, the right insights make the difference between seizing an opportunity and missing it entirely. EY Knowledge helps EY to win in the market by providing the right insights at the right time through an agile, client-first organization.

The Oportunity

You will be the overall responsible for the development and execution of various projects, leading a team, ensuring the successful completion of all project phases from requirements gathering to production deployment. This includes the following aspects: technical-functional definition, ETL development and data modeling, visualization, as well as conducting training sessions and overseeing the rollout among other key aspects.

Primary Responsibilities

You will participate in the definition and functional analysis in close collaboration with the client, ensuring solutions tailored to their needs. You will work on a daily basis with SQL databases, data modeling using ETL tools, and data warehouse environments in Azure technology (i.e., Data Lake, Synapse, Data Factory, Power BI).

Your responsibilities will extend to internal and external training on relevant tools for the team, identifying necessary training and certifications for team growth. You will stay updated on the latest technological trends, with a particular emphasis on Data & Analytics, through continuous commitment to training and proactive exploration of new innovations in the sector.

You will closely collaborate with your Manager on operational activities, including team hour input management, forecasting analysis for the upcoming months, etc

Competencies / Skills:


Fluent in Spanish and English
Minimum of 1 year of experience working as a consultant/developer in data platforms, participating in end-to-end Data & Analytics projects
Education in Computer Engineering, Telecommunications, Data Science, Industrial Engineering, or holding a Higher Education degree or another academic path that has provided you with the capacity for development and critical thinking in this environment.
Additional training in Analytics, Big Data, or a similar discipline will be highly valued.
Communicative, analytical, and business-oriented skills to understand project contexts and assist in decision-making for our clients. Demonstrating a proactive and participatory attitude is important.
Proven abilities and experience in project management, teamwork, and adaptation to changing environments effectively while optimizing available resources. Results-oriented, independence, autonomy, dynamism, and freshness in decision-making, improvisation skills, and agility in day-to-day problem-solving.
Desirable to have worked in consulting firms to understand the needs and day-to-day dynamics of our organization. Solid knowledge in Data & Analytics technologies, with demonstrated experience in SQL development, ETL technologies, and visualization with a focus on Power BI. Knowledge in data modeling, with particular relevance to adaptation to Cloud environments (AWS, Azure, Google). Previous experience in consumption of data coming from SAP sources is valuable.


Technical Skills


Microsoft Azure:
Data Factory
Synapse
Data Lake
Power BI
OpenAI
Machine Learning
AWS and Google Cloud as nice to haves


What We Offer


Continuous learning: You‚Äôll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
Success as defined by you: We‚Äôll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
Transformative leadership: We‚Äôll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
Diverse and inclusive culture: You‚Äôll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.

Title: Data Analyst, Retail Media
Description:
What You'll Do:

The Retail Media EMEA Analytics team, part of the rapidly expanding Criteo Retail Media business, leverages our grand set of shopper data to design and develop actionable insights for our Retailer and Brand clients. We bring the analytical perspective onto the business and provide recommendations based on high quality data analysis and strong understanding of our industry and products. We leverage our unique position to provide our commercial teams and clients with visibility into shopper behavior, market trends and product performance that can't be found anywhere else.

Criteo‚Äôs high-growth business model brings both opportunities and challenges. This position requires working with large sets of data and a variety of stakeholders to solve complex business problems by thinking strategically and proposing innovative solutions. The ideal candidate functions with minimal oversight and has the ability to learn new concepts quickly.


Mine massive data sets and turn them into understandable and actionable insights
Build scalable analytic solutions using state of the art tools of Criteo analytics stack (Hadoop, Vertica, PySpark‚Ä¶)
Develop innovative analytical approaches to measure Brands & Retailers‚Äô performance from design to presentation of results, leveraging all our expertise in Data Science (statistical thinking, A/B testing, bootstrapping, data visualization‚Ä¶)
Frequently interact with other teams (R&D, product, commercial teams‚Ä¶) and clients to share data-driven recommendations and insights
Develop and maintain deep knowledge of Criteo Retail Media products and technologies as they evolve



Who You Are:

You are passionate about data and want to work with leading edge technologies in online industry:


You have at least 2 years‚Äô experience in Data Science or Data Analytics
Master‚Äôs degree or higher in a quantitative field (Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, etc.)
Fluency in the core toolkit of Data Science/Data Analytics: SQL is required, Python is a real asset (master most common data libraries: pandas, numpy‚Ä¶)
Outstanding analytical skills: passion for translating data-speak into relevant, compelling stories
A background in the digital industry or consulting is a plus
You have the combination of technical skills, passion for learning, and the soft skills to work with all personality types in a dynamic environment
You are fluent in English



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
SegurCaixa Adeslas es la compa√±√≠a No Vida l√≠der en Espa√±a en seguros de salud, con una cuota de mercado en torno al 30%. Integrada en el Grupo Mutua Madrile√±a y participada por CaixaBank, la aseguradora ocupa tambi√©n una posici√≥n relevante en otros ramos principales como Hogar, Accidentes o Decesos.




En los √∫ltimos a√±os se ha convertido en una entidad de referencia gracias a la implantaci√≥n de un modelo de negocio basado en el crecimiento sostenido y rentable, que sit√∫a al cliente en el centro de la estrategia. A trav√©s de su acuerdo de bancaseguros con CaixaBank, SegurCaixa Adeslas comercializa sus productos en la mayor red bancaria de Espa√±a. Adicionalmente, la aseguradora cuenta con una red tradicional con m√°s de 4.000 puntos de venta y atenci√≥n al cliente.




Estamos convencid@s de que las personas son el principal valor de nuestra compa√±√≠a y por eso SegurCaixa Adeslas se muestra absolutamente comprometida con la igualdad de oportunidades entre hombres y mujeres. Nuestro Plan de Igualdad persigue hacer efectivo este principio y por ello, el proceso de selecci√≥n de nuestras ofertas garantiza la igualdad de oportunidades a todas las candidaturas.




Seleccionamos para incorporar en Barcelona a un/a Senior Data Analyst para el Dpto. de Planificaci√≥n y Gesti√≥n de la Informaci√≥n.

Las funciones a realizar ser√°n las siguientes:




Elaborar seguimientos comerciales sobre las campa√±as desarrolladas por Marketing.
Anticiparse a las necesidades de la Direcci√≥n General de Negocio en la definici√≥n, mantenimiento y creaci√≥n de informes de seguimiento comercial.
Revisar y garantizar la fiabilidad de los datos que se muestran en los seguimientos, as√≠ como su distribuci√≥n en plazo.
Realizar mejoras en los informes de seguimiento actuales e implementar automatizaciones que permitan ahorrar tiempo para desarrollar nuevas tareas.
Realizar presentaciones ah-hoc para la Direcci√≥n y la red comercial.

Title: Data Analyst II RTO (They/She/He)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Are you passionate about utilizing data to drive operational excellence? Join our Real Time Operations team as a Data Analyst and play a pivotal role in uncovering insights that optimize our global operations. If you thrive in fast-paced environments and want to contribute to reshaping real-time operations on a global scale, we're excited to hear from you.

THE JOURNEY


Work closely with product managers, business operations, and data engineering to guide product in problem discoveries, monitor and give visibility of product metrics and KPIs.
Translate product and business questions into analysis and actionable insights.
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
Own end-to-end everything analytics related to real-time operations products development cycle, from data requirement gathering and opportunity sizing, to experimentation and post-launch impact analyses.
Build robust relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business, and product.
Apply various advanced mathematical and statistical modeling techniques and analyses (A/B test, multivariate test, clustering, supervised learning, etc) to solve for product and business problems that drive the highest impact.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


+2 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role, preferably in product facing teams
Experience with the application of statistical modeling and advanced analytics to provide product-shaping insights
Excellent SQL skills
Solid proficiency in statistical programming (Python) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Jupyter/iPython notebooks
Demonstrated experience in designing and analyzing experiments in digital products (A/B test, multivariate, etc)
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau and Looker
Excellent spoken and written English


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


üåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Customer Service Data Analyst
Description:
As you contemplate your future, you might be asking yourself, what's the next step? Start your journey with us!

We are now looking for a technical Business Analyst for Customer Support. The Customer Support area has been transformative during the pandemic. During the last year it has been transformed from a supporting department to a key differentiator against the competition. We have developed some features that revolutionized the way people manage their bookings and made travelling more flexible from a consumer point of view.

Why eDreams ODIGEO

Join the world's leading travel subscription platform and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe.

20 million customers ‚Äì 44 markets ‚Äì 5 brands ‚Äì 5.4M members in Prime

16.2 million bookings FY23 - More than 50,000 bookings per day - 100 million daily user searches

1400 employees ‚Äì More than 50 different nationalities - 99% permanent contracts - 36.3 average age

We're a leading travel tech company, revolutionising the travel booking experience through our consumer insight, innovative technology, market leadership, and Prime, the world's first travel subscription program.

What you will do:

The Role's Key Responsibilities and Tasks

As an eDOer, you will have clear objectives, great challenges and a clear overview of how your work contributes to the global company project and its customers. As a Customer Service Data Analyst you will be in charge of:


Responsible for execution of key analysis, being the data entry point for the business team and including taking ownership of the different data sources from the business side. Understand the business needs, gather the data and present the key insights: ‚ÄúContribute to the Customer Support strategic roadmap with numbers‚Äù
Analyze Data from the whole area, we serve both the Product area as well as all our centers. This means you‚Äôll be answering questions like how can we best utilize our VIP agents as well as going into depth about how we can improve our chatbot
Elaborate business cases to support strategic product decisions: e.g. should we train more agents? what is the next feature we should develop? should we double down on our efforts and redirect more customers to the chat bot ?
Create dashboards and tracking: master the internal Business Intelligence tools to contribute to the monitoring and tracking of our business KPIs. Work with data engineering and data science teams to be able to leverage all our internal data
Contribute to the delivery of Customer Service strategic projects: participate in the delivery of the key internal projects, giving support from the business side to ensure progress and effective delivery of the desired outcomes. Work together with product and call centers in the execution of the projects, giving support from the analytical and business side



What you need to succeed:

Good to have

Bring your unique perspective, speak up, and offer disruptive solutions. You'll have the opportunity to learn and grow while making a real impact on our team. Here's what you need to succeed:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a quantitative discipline (Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, etc.),
2-4 years experience in a role with strong analytical component
Strong knowledge of SQL is a requirement, as well as experience in working with databases and large sets of data; python programming skills and experience with Google DataStudio will be highly valued
Advanced Office skills. Strong experience with analytical tools, ideally with the Google toolset (spreadsheets, google docs, etc)
Strong analytical skills, fast-learner, with high attention to detail and focused on results and productivity
A self-starter and team player, who also enjoys to have fun!
Business Proficiency in English



What‚Äôs in it for you?

The best talent deserves the best benefits

At eDO, we want you to be a part of our success story and great culture.

Here's what we offer:


A rewarding Compensation package! üí• Prime Plus membership, competitive salary and benefits package, including flexible benefits, performance-based bonuses, birthday day off, discounts and partnerships, relocation support and the possibility of choosing your equipment and, even better, keeping it for free after 3 years.
Continuous learning to fuel your growth and explore new horizons! üìö Learn and grow with free Coursera access, soft skills workshops, tech training, leadership development, and more. Plus, enjoy a great onboarding program.
Grow opportunities to empower your career, and unleash your potential! üöÄ Personalised career paths and the eVOLVE Program will help you discover, grow, and thrive. Internal mobility opportunities let you pursue horizontal career changes and promotions.
Your Well-being is our priority. Embrace Freedom and Flexibility! üíô At eDO, we value flexibility, employee care, and transparency. We offer a hybrid home-office model focused on outcome, not time-in-seat. You'll be able to find the right work-personal life balance that suits you best.
Work hard, party hard! We believe in having fun and connecting with colleagues! üéâ Join eDO for after-work events, padel tournaments, parties, and more. Create communities based on your passions, like sports and music. Come to work as you are, with no dress code, and enjoy free fruit, coffee, and tea at our offices.
Enjoy a dynamic and healthy environment! üí´ Be innovative, take risks, and share your ideas. Our diverse and open-minded teams support high performance, learning, and growth. You'll work in an Agile mindset environment with recognition at our core.



Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at eDO? Follow us on LinkedIn and discover more about life at eDO!

If you are ready for a career opportunity with unmatched benefits, continuous learning, and a supportive work-life balance, look no further! Take your career to new destinations by applying now and help our diverse, inclusive, and passionate team shape the future of travel.

Apply now!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status. Our people are the key to our success. Each one of them is unique in their own way and the respect for their uniqueness is and will always be a passion and motivation.

As you contemplate your future, you might be asking yourself, what's the next step? Start your journey with us!

We are now looking for a technical Business Analyst for Customer Support. The Customer Support area has been transformative during the pandemic. During the last year it has been transformed from a supporting department to a key differentiator against the competition. We have developed some features that revolutionized the way people manage their bookings and made travelling more flexible from a consumer point of view.

Why eDreams ODIGEO

Join the world's leading travel subscription platform and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe.

20 million customers ‚Äì 44 markets ‚Äì 5 brands ‚Äì 5.4M members in Prime

16.2 million bookings FY23 - More than 50,000 bookings per day - 100 million daily user searches

1400 employees ‚Äì More than 50 different nationalities - 99% permanent contracts - 36.3 average age

We're a leading travel tech company, revolutionising the travel booking experience through our consumer insight, innovative technology, market leadership, and Prime, the world's first travel subscription program.

What you will do:

The Role's Key Responsibilities and Tasks

As an eDOer, you will have clear objectives, great challenges and a clear overview of how your work contributes to the global company project and its customers. As a Customer Service Data Analyst you will be in charge of:

  • Responsible for execution of key analysis, being the data entry point for the business team and including taking ownership of the different data sources from the business side. Understand the business needs, gather the data and present the key insights: ‚ÄúContribute to the Customer Support strategic roadmap with numbers‚Äù
  • Analyze Data from the whole area, we serve both the Product area as well as all our centers. This means you‚Äôll be answering questions like how can we best utilize our VIP agents as well as going into depth about how we can improve our chatbot
  • Elaborate business cases to support strategic product decisions: e.g. should we train more agents? what is the next feature we should develop? should we double down on our efforts and redirect more customers to the chat bot ?
  • Create dashboards and tracking: master the internal Business Intelligence tools to contribute to the monitoring and tracking of our business KPIs. Work with data engineering and data science teams to be able to leverage all our internal data
  • Contribute to the delivery of Customer Service strategic projects: participate in the delivery of the key internal projects, giving support from the business side to ensure progress and effective delivery of the desired outcomes. Work together with product and call centers in the execution of the projects, giving support from the analytical and business side


What you need to succeed:

Good to have

Bring your unique perspective, speak up, and offer disruptive solutions. You'll have the opportunity to learn and grow while making a real impact on our team. Here's what you need to succeed:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a quantitative discipline (Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, etc.),
  • 2-4 years experience in a role with strong analytical component
  • Strong knowledge of SQL is a requirement, as well as experience in working with databases and large sets of data; python programming skills and experience with Google DataStudio will be highly valued
  • Advanced Office skills. Strong experience with analytical tools, ideally with the Google toolset (spreadsheets, google docs, etc)
  • Strong analytical skills, fast-learner, with high attention to detail and focused on results and productivity
  • A self-starter and team player, who also enjoys to have fun!
  • Business Proficiency in English


What‚Äôs in it for you?

The best talent deserves the best benefits

At eDO, we want you to be a part of our success story and great culture.

Here's what we offer:

  • A rewarding Compensation package! üí• Prime Plus membership, competitive salary and benefits package, including flexible benefits, performance-based bonuses, birthday day off, discounts and partnerships, relocation support and the possibility of choosing your equipment and, even better, keeping it for free after 3 years.
  • Continuous learning to fuel your growth and explore new horizons! üìö Learn and grow with free Coursera access, soft skills workshops, tech training, leadership development, and more. Plus, enjoy a great onboarding program.
  • Grow opportunities to empower your career, and unleash your potential! üöÄ Personalised career paths and the eVOLVE Program will help you discover, grow, and thrive. Internal mobility opportunities let you pursue horizontal career changes and promotions.
  • Your Well-being is our priority. Embrace Freedom and Flexibility! üíô At eDO, we value flexibility, employee care, and transparency. We offer a hybrid home-office model focused on outcome, not time-in-seat. You'll be able to find the right work-personal life balance that suits you best.
  • Work hard, party hard! We believe in having fun and connecting with colleagues! üéâ Join eDO for after-work events, padel tournaments, parties, and more. Create communities based on your passions, like sports and music. Come to work as you are, with no dress code, and enjoy free fruit, coffee, and tea at our offices.
  • Enjoy a dynamic and healthy environment! üí´ Be innovative, take risks, and share your ideas. Our diverse and open-minded teams support high performance, learning, and growth. You'll work in an Agile mindset environment with recognition at our core.

Title: Data Analyst - Account Management Operations (They/She/He)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

In this role you will be part of the Account Management Team at Glovo Headquarters, that is focused on growing and retaining Glovo partners. You will be directly responsible for overseeing, challenging and rethinking the processes, data & tools of the post-sales operational landscape, based on solid data driven conclusions, so that they can be implemented on a global scale.

THE JOURNEY


Stakeholder management: Partner closely with senior sales leaders and cross functional partners to align on strategy
Communication: find simple ways to convey insights and recommendations from sophisticated analysis results to business leaders.
Data Analysis: Utilize advanced data analysis techniques to interpret complex datasets; Analyze and report weekly and monthly metrics to identify trends and stop opportunities for improvement.
Process Optimization: leverage critical thinking skills to analyze Account Management processes and lead the implementation of optimization strategies to drive efficiency and effectiveness in sales operations.
Automation: Design and implement automation solutions to remove manual processes.
Planning: Partner with Account Management leadership to set performance targets for local teams, recommend actions for improvement and work together to integrate positive changes within the operational environment.
Forecast: provide analytical and operational support to continuously improve our forecasting, pipeline management, and methodologies and processes.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


Bachelor or equivalent in Business Administration, Economics, Mathematics, Finance, Accounting
4+ years of work experience with 2+ years in Sales Operations, preferably in a fast-growing B2B environment.
Technical and Proficient in data. Analyzing data sets with SQL queries, or crafting models and prototype tools, data is a core part of your toolkit.
Experience with BI tools and data visualization like Tableau, Power BI or Looker.
Experience with Salesforce.
Experience in complex problem solving, and working in a fast paced environment.
Demonstrated ability in critical thinking and process optimization, with a proven track of identifying inefficiencies and implementing solutions to enhance business operations.
Verbal and written communication skills. Strong consensus building and executive presence to communicate and defend plans.


Nice to have


Experience with Python or R is a strong plus.
Experience with forecasting and target setting, using data to establish future goals.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


üåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Data Analyst - Customer Lifecycle & Growth
Description:
At Preply, we are unlocking human potential through learning.

We believe learning with a great tutor is life-changing. That‚Äôs why we match online tutors from across the globe with learners and empower them to create live language classes with AI-powered tools and learning materials. This is how we deliver progress, create engagement and keep our global community of learners motivated. So far, over 32,000 tutors have given more than 15 million lessons to learners from over 175 countries.




Meet the team!

At Preply, we're growing a talented Data Team to empower top-notch decision-making across our organization. Our team collaborates closely with various other chapters - including product, business, and platform - leveraging analysis, experimentation, causal inference, and machine learning.

As a key player, you‚Äôll be embedded in cross-functional teams, partnering with Product Managers, Marketing, Tech Leads, and the Data Strategy team. Check out our Tech Radar to see the tools and technologies we love using at Preply!




What You‚Äôll Be Doing

Develop and implement data frameworks to enhance our organic growth strategies, including SEO, CRM, and Referral programs
Drive virality and word-of-mouth growth by analyzing user behavior and helping teams capitalize opportunities where we have high user engagement
Generate strategic insights to shape top-level roadmaps.
Collaborate with teams to define KPIs for organic growth and maintain dashboards to monitor performance.
Identify trends and opportunities, providing actionable insights to support team initiatives.
Examples of areas you will cover are:
Collect, organize and interpret, utilizing statistical and analytical techniques, trends, patterns, and correlations from large SEO data sets (internal and external data)
Analyze cross-channel data, particularly in SEO and SEM, to optimize marketing efficiency and prevent cannibalization.




What You Need To Succeed

3-5 years' experience in Data Science/Analysis, focusing on data analytics for business growth strategy;
Previous experience in fast-paced Technology or Management Consulting companies;
Proven ability to work with product teams, run experiments, and identify product optimization opportunities;
Strong background in quantitative fields (e.g., statistics, mathematics);
Proficient coding skills in SQL;
An outcome-driven approach with a passion for problem-solving and exploring new ideas.
A creative mindset with a proactive attitude, along with stakeholder management and influencing skills;
Fluency in English and eager to work on a global product with a multicultural team.




Nice To Have

Experience with CRM tools (e.g., Braze) and referral programs;
Knowledge of SEO and third-party tools (e.g., Google Search Console, Ahrefs, Adwords);
Familiarity with predictive modeling;
Experience in digital businesses (B2B, B2C, B2B2C);
Knowledge of Looker, Amplitude, Snowflake, and growth/retention analytics frameworks.




Why You‚Äôll Love It At Preply

An open, collaborative, dynamic and diverse culture;
A generous monthly allowance for lessons on Preply.com, Learning & Development budget and time off for your self-development;
A competitive financial package with equity, leave allowance and health insurance;
Not in Barcelona? We offer an attractive relocation package to join us in our Preply Barcelona Hub
Access to free mental health support platforms;
Access to Gympass-partnered wellness and gym centers throughout Spain to promote and support well-being and physical health;
The opportunity to unlock the potential of learners and tutors through language learning and teaching in 175 countries (and counting!).




Our Principles

Care to change the world - We are passionate about our work and care deeply about its impact to be life changing.
We do it for learners - For both Preply and tutors, learners are why we do what we do. Every day we focus on empowering tutors to deliver an exceptional learning experience.
Keep perfecting - To create an outstanding customer experience, we focus on simplicity, smoothness, and enjoyment, continually perfecting it as every detail matters.
Now is the time - In a fast-paced world, it matters how quickly we act. Now is the time to make great things happen.
Disciplined execution - What makes us disciplined is the excellence in our execution. We set clear goals, focus on what matters, and utilize our resources efficiently.
Dive deep - We leverage business acumen and curiosity to investigate disparities between numbers and stories, unlocking meaningful insights to guide our decisions.
Growth mindset - We proactively seek growth opportunities and believe today's best performance becomes tomorrow's starting point. We humbly embrace feedback and learn from setbacks.
Raise the bar - We raise our performance standards continuously, alongside each new hire and promotion. We build diverse and high-performing teams that can make a real difference.
Challenge, disagree and commit - We value open and candid communication, even when we don‚Äôt fully agree. We speak our minds, challenge when necessary, and fully commit to decisions once made.
One Preply - We prioritize collaboration, inclusion, and the success of our team over personal ambitions. Together, we support and celebrate each other's progress.




Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

Preply is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. Different opinions and viewpoints are key ingredients in our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company.

Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status. Together, we are The World Class.
