Title: Finance Reporting Data Analyst - SQL Advanced - (100% remote-friendly within Spain)
Description:
We are the largest digital healthcare platform in the world, present in 15 countries and currently connecting over 30 million patients to more than 2 million healthcare professionals. We seek to make the experience in health more human and we live and breath this mission.


We obsess over the challenge of minimizing patients' pain and helping healthcare professionals thrive managing their patients and expand their online presence. Through services that bring health to users, we provide a space for questions, opinions and a way to find the health professional that best fits your needs.


To deliver the best result, we have motivated people with an innovative spirit, giving everyone the opportunity to actively contribute and grow within the company. The DocPlanner team is our secret sauce and for the 2nd consecutive year we were recognized as a Great Place To Work. We love diversity because each unique individual's perspective makes us stronger. We encourage everyone to participate in our hiring process. We‚Äôd love for you to bring your unique skill set and join the team!




Job Description



The resource, working within the Financial Reporting team, will play a key role in supporting the evolution of financial reporting in a challenging and stimulating environment. You will help bridge the gap between finance and BI. Our primary objective is to assist the business in making decisions based on data, with a particular emphasis on producing reports as the primary and most reliable source of information.


A team of 12 experts provides support to various departments, including marketing, sales, customer success, finance, and people experience, for both short-term and long-term projects. Collaborating closely with stakeholders, we strive to develop reports, analyses, models, and recommendations that enable us to gain a deep understanding of how we can enhance the satisfaction of both doctors and patients.


You will be an integral part of the Financial Reporting team, working closely with the Data Analytics team to support business decisions based on data.

How would you be impacting our mission


Financial Reporting and Analysis:
Track key financial metrics and KPIs, ensuring they align with organizational goals;
Develop and maintain comprehensive financial dashboards using advanced BI tools;
Provide detailed insights into financial performance, trends, and variances;
Provide insights for long-term strategic decisions;
Data Management and Integration:
Ensure accurate and timely collection of financial data from systems like Oracle NetSuite;
Integrate data from multiple sources for a unified financial view;
Performance Measurement:
Analyze profitability and cost efficiency to identify improvement areas;
Regulatory and Compliance Reporting:
Support audits and for regulatory documentation;
Automation and Process Improvement:
Automate repetitive financial tasks to improve efficiency;
Implement process improvements to reduce manual efforts and errors;
Enhanced Reporting and Visualization:
Utilize BI tools like Tableau for dynamic, interactive reports and dashboards;
Enhance report quality and accessibility beyond traditional spreadsheets.


Qualifications



What will help you thrive?


Bachelor's degree in Economics, Statistics, Econometrics or a related field.
Demonstrable experience in using SQL to derive actionable insights, either in commercial or academic setting (must have).
Knowledge of Python/R and desire to expand your knowledge.
Experience with statistical modeling and descriptive statistics.
Experience in partnership with internal stakeholders.
Experience in leading and executing end to end BI projects.
Strong written and oral communication skills in English; proficiency in other languages such as German, Spanish, and Italian is a plus.
Ability to gather, organize, analyze, and report large volumes of financial data with speed and accuracy.
Strong attention to detail with the ability to provide high-quality work efficiently.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to adapt and work in a quickly changing environment, managing competing demands.

Which skills are ‚Äòbonus points‚Äô?


Master's degree in Economics, Statistics, Econometrics or a related field.
Able to take a step back from the technicalities and examine them through a business lens.
Open to cooperating with a lot of people from many teams in different countries.
Like to see the instant effects of your work.
Knowledge of ERP finance applications (Oracle, Oracle - NetSuite, SAP).
Relevant experience in accounting and financial reporting.


Additional Information



What will you get in return?


Let‚Äôs talk money


Flexible remuneration and benefits system via Flexoh, which includes: restaurant card, transportation card, kindergarten, and training tax savings;
Share options plan after 6 months of working with us

True flexibility and work-life balance


Remote first in one of our legal entities or hybrid work model in one of our office locations;
Flexible working hours;
Paid time off according to your location of work;
Additional paid holiday on your birthday or work anniversary (you choose what you want to celebrate).

Health comes first


Health insurance according to your location of work:
Access to iFeel, a technological platform for mental wellness offering online psychological support and counseling.

What does the recruitment process look like?


A 30-minute meeting with Ro - Head of International Talent Acquisition
SHL test
A 45-minute meeting with Nicol√≤ Truffa - Head of Financial reporting
A 60-minute meeting Wiktor Kulikowski - Business Intelligence Manager including the live SQL testing
Business Case - Prepare a Business Case
Present it within the with Nico and Wiktor for 90 minutes
Meet the Team for 15 minute meeting

Please submit your CV exclusively in English.


We promote and embrace equal opportunities in our hiring process, and also every day at work. When you apply for our roles you receive equal treatment regardless of age, disabilities, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or parental status, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation or any other dimension of human difference. If you require additional support in your recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to let us know. Behind those words you‚Äôre reading, there‚Äôs a person (hi!) who already helped a candidate by adapting the interviews, and now we‚Äôre lucky to have this person with us. So, even if you‚Äôve never asked for it before, may this serve as a sign that, now, you can do so. We can only truly be equal if we adapt to each other.


‚ÄúWe believe all humans, in all their beautiful diversity, should have equal rights, dignity and respect. Period.‚Äù Mariusz Gralewski, CEO

Description:

Adem√°s, en 2021, la compa√±√≠a ha invertido recursos para avanzar en el desarrollo de un pipeline adicional de casi 5GWh de proyectos de almacenamiento.




Debido a este crecimiento y a la fuerte apuesta de Grenergy, actualmente buscamos incorporar a un/a Data Analyst en nuestro equipo de Asset Management:




C√≥mo ser√° tu d√≠a a d√≠a:




Desarrollar y mantener procesos de extracci√≥n de datos desde diferentes fuentes externas mediante el uso de APIs. Asegurar la integraci√≥n y la calidad de los datos extra√≠dos.
Gesti√≥n de Bases de Datos: Dise√±ar, implementar y mantener bases de datos eficientes y seguras. Asegurar la integridad, consistencia y disponibilidad de los datos.
Mejora permanente en las herramientas de reporting, incorporando las buenas pr√°cticas presentes en el mercado.
Control y reporte del desempe√±o t√©cnico-econ√≥mico de activos fotovoltaicos y e√≥licos de la Compa√±√≠a.
Colaboraci√≥n interdepartamental: Trabajar en estrecha colaboraci√≥n con otros equipos

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a talented Junior Data Analyst to help us change the world of digital advertising together!




WHO WE ARE

Seedtag is the leading Contextual Advertising Platform. Our proprietary, machine learning-based technology provides human-like understanding of the content in the web, the highest level of brand safety in the industry and unmatched cookieless targeting capabilities.

We engage with the market on both demand and supply side to create, activate and launch high-quality advertising campaigns at scale. We are committed to creating a more beautiful, respectful and engaging way to do advertising.




KEY FIGURES

2014 ¬∑ Founded by two ex-Googlers

2018 ¬∑ 16M total turnover & Internationalization & Getting growth

2021 ¬∑ Fundraising round of 40M‚Ç¨ & +11 countries & +260 Seedtaggers

2022 ¬∑ Fundraising round of 250M‚Ç¨ + expansion into the U.S market




YOUR CHALLENGE

You will propose new analysis to get the most out of our current data and define what additional data will be needed to improve our current Contextual Understanding
Your data visualization skills will be key to grasp the attention of the public and transmit complex information into simple explanations
You will get full ownership of our contextual data to offer insights and communication strategies to our most relevant clients
You will present your results internally and externally, co-creating contextual strategies with big clients (from Nissan to Coca-Cola, Heineken, Tag Heuer, etc.)
You will help us build contextual tools that would allow the democratization of data inside the company: from sales, to marketing, to operations, the different teams should be using contextual data in their day-to-day
Some experience building extract, transform, load (ETL) data pipelines will be needed here.
You will analyze performance of our current Contextual products and actively proposing improvements together with the Product Team
Finally, you will build a strong knowledge of the ecosystem and sector to develop a strong instinct of how to improve our products and positioning. Creativity here will also be a must!
During all these tasks, you will be using the latest technologies developed by our Machine Learning Engineers: amazing NLP and CV models to get the most out of massive amounts of data!




YOU WILL SUCCEED IN THIS ROLE IF

You have a relevant degree in engineering, mathematics, statistics or an analytics related field
You have between 1 and 3 years of work experience in Data Analysis or a related field
You are proficient in SQL and Python: data treatment and data visualizations are a must
You have an analytical mind capable of structuring complex problems into simple, iterative, solutions
You have full proficiency in Spanish and English
You are energetic, proactive and eager to work in a dynamic environment
You are a real team player with good communication and cooperation skills
You have proven ability to work in a fast-paced, informal, dynamic and exigent environment
You like to have fun while working and don‚Äôt take yourself too serious!




It would be a big plus if you

Have previous experience in a startup or have a background in consulting
Have previous experience in presenting and communicating data analysis results and insights to external stakeholders




SEEDTAG PERKS

üöÄ Key moment to join Seedtag in terms of growth and opportunities

üíØ One Seedtag: Work for a month from any of our open offices with travel and stay paid if you‚Äôre a top performer (think of Brazil, NY..., üèñÔ∏è)

‚åõ Flexible schedule to balance work and personal life

üá¨üáß üá™üá∏ üá´üá∑ Optional company-paid English, Spanish and/or French courses

üìö Access to learning opportunities (learning & development budget)

üçª We love what we do, but we also love having fun. We have many team activities you can join and enjoy with your colleagues! A Yearly offsite with all the company, team offsites, and Christmas events.

üèã Gympass




BENEFITS OF WORKING AT SEEDTAG

Growth: International, highly demanding work environment in one of the fastest growing AdTech companies in Europe. We reject "that‚Äôs the way it‚Äôs always been done". In Seedtag you can find an energetic, fresh workplace, multicultural work environment where our members are from different countries in Europe, LATAM, US and so many more!
Impact: The chance to have a direct impact, here you don't work for the sake of working, we all have an impact on seedtag in our own way, rowing in the same direction.
Diversity of methodology and people: Seedtag DNA is unique and highly appreciated by very different types of Seedtagers. We embrace diversity and encourage everyone to seek the best version of themselves and to show who they really are. With a total flexible methodology.
Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you, you can work from home, the beach or the office. The important thing is to work on your goals.




Are you ready to join the SEEDTAG adventure? Then send us your CV!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst




Job Summary:

We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst with a strong focus on SQL and data analysis. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience in data analysis, with a preference for those who are also familiar with PySpark or other big data processing frameworks. This role requires a detail-oriented individual with excellent analytical skills and the ability to present complex data insights in a clear and concise manner.

Key Responsibilities:

Perform data analysis to support business decision-making, including data extraction, transformation, and visualization.
Develop and optimize SQL queries for data retrieval, reporting, and analysis.
Work with large datasets using PySpark or other big data processing frameworks to drive data-driven insights.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into actionable data insights.
Conduct statistical analysis using Python or other tools to support data-driven decision-making.
Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and quality in all analyses and reports.
Present findings and insights to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.

Qualifications:

Experience:

Experience as a Data Analyst, with a strong focus on SQL and data analysis.
Practical experience with PySpark or other big data processing frameworks is highly desirable.

Technical Skills:

Proficient in SQL, with a strong understanding of database management and query optimization.
Experience with PySpark, including writing Spark jobs and working with large datasets.
Familiarity with Python for statistical analysis and data manipulation is a plus.
Knowledge of data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) is advantageous.

Soft Skills:

Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex data insights clearly.
Detail-oriented with a commitment to accuracy and quality.
Ability to work independently and in a team-oriented environment.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Shiji Group is a major software supplier in the hospitality and retail industries. Developing worldwide leading products and technologies, aimed at the international market and speeding up its globalization progress. Our team of more than 5,000 talented employees, in 70+ subsidiaries worldwide, is constantly adapting to facilitate the transition to fully integrated systems for our clients through a network of secure, scalable, and ready for the future platforms, so clients can focus on their core competencies of serving their customer and guests.




Job Description



We are expanding our team, and are currently looking for a proactive and detail oriented Data Analyst, to contribute to our international growth. The ideal candidate will have experience with data analysis and management, be comfortable with technology / SaaS Business Intelligence Tools, and is motivated by the opportunity to develop new ways to ensure a 100% data delivery & quality with the least effort possible.





Reporting to the Director of Product & Operations, the responsibilities include:


Perform data analysis and special reports for key clients, marketing and sales to identify data-driven trends and understand what matters and why.
Prepare excellent presentations, and consultancy documents to be delivered to clients.
Prioritize projects and the special data reporting pipeline and delivery times.
Execute, build and maintain data projects using Python, Excel, Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, Google Data Studio and some other data analysis tools like SPSS.
Structure, organize and maintain masses of information from different DBs to efficiently deliver on time the projects in pipeline.
Collaborate with the product managers to develop new visualizations, CRM data analysis and special data projects.


Qualifications



Candidates must be motivated, proactive and responsible individuals with:


Highly analytical mind.
Advanced Excel user.
Advanced Python user.
Experience managing the main Business Intelligence tool (Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, Google Data Studio).
Experience with advanced statistical methodology with knowledge in Python.
Desirable Knowledge in managing data through MySQL and API connections.
Results oriented.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to work well under pressure and manage their own time to deliver the Task / Projects.
Desirable knowledge in the Hotels sector and online reputation.




Requirements:


Excellent level of English. (Spanish desired).
Degree or being studying information technology, business administration, engineering or mathematical sciences.


Additional Information


Flexible work schedule
Free coffee, tea, and afterwork drinks
Brand new office located in the center of Barcelona
International team and fantastic work environment
Team building activities and charity donation programs
Discounts on Private health insurance, ticket restaurant, transport, kindergarten

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Years of experience needed ‚Äì 5+ Years

(At least 5 years‚Äô working experience in business analysis, project management skills being a plus)

Job Summary ‚Äì

You are interested in companies, customers and market behavior and methods to measure and anticipate it. Moreover:
You are a data driven person, with a passion to identify patterns in the data, identify the root causes, and suggest solutions from complex datasets.
You are passionate about coding, simplifying the complexity, automation and making processes more efficient.
You are keen on building and maintaining contacts with users/ clients, data scientists, and project managers and provide advanced analytics recommendations.
You are never satisfied until a problem is solved.




Technical Skills:

Collaborate with technical teams to ensure data accuracy, consistency, and availability for analysis.
Conduct data analysis to gain insights into business processes, performance, and trends.
Identify opportunities to automate data analyses and streamline reporting.
Leverage data science software like Python as well as analytics/visualization tools like Excel, PowerBI and Tableau to transform raw data into meaningful insights.
Determine the most effective ways to visualize data, ensuring clarity and actionable insights.
Present the results and recommendations to the project team and contribute to the action plan for improvements.
Be in contact with users, assess their feedback and propose path forwards on how to improve the possible solutions.
Work independently, taking ownership of deliverables and driving them to successful completion

Experience required includes:

Experience in deploying ML and data science solutions.
Project management certifications: PMI, Agile




Qualification

Must be, at least, intermediate in Python.
Extensive knowledge of Excel, PowerPoint and Powerbi.
Excellent analytical thinking, analysis, and problem-solving skills.
Ability to think creatively and suggest original solutions to business.
Strong verbal and written communication/presentation skills.
Bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in business, Economics or any relevant field;
English proficiency

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Main responsibilities:

The role will contribute to the area providing support in the processes and tools improvement and in order to prevent the contract errors and the losses for the company
Data analysis of the contract errors and the company losses
To prevent losses for the company by reducing errors: Daily booking analysis of all destinations to detect ‚Äúunnormal‚Äù behavior caused by possible errors. Improvements within contract loading to reduce human error possibilities. Error detection based on the ATLAS data analysis.
Maintain collaborative communication with the rest of the team: QC Prevention agents, QC Mitigation agents and business analysts in Strategy, Processes & Tools
Identify lack of efficiencies in the current processes and develop new tools (or improve the current ones) to increase team performance




Candidate profile:

Data analysis skills is needed
SQL knowledge is needed
Tableau knowledge is needed
Advanced Python and Atlas System knowledge is desirable
Strong knowledge of Office Package use and macros
Previous experience in the Travel Industry is desirable
Excellent knowledge of Spanish and English languages

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a talented Business Data Analyst to help us change the world of digital advertising!




WHO WE ARE

Seedtag is the leading Contextual Advertising Platform. Our proprietary, machine learning-based technology provides human-like understanding of the content in the web, the highest level of brand safety in the industry and unmatched cookieless targeting capabilities.

We engage with the market on both demand and supply side to create, activate and launch high-quality advertising campaigns at scale. We are committed to creating a more beautiful, respectful and engaging way to do advertising.




KEY FIGURES

2014 ¬∑ Founded by two ex-Googlers

2018 ¬∑ 16M total turnover & Internationalization & Getting growth

2021 ¬∑ Fundraising round of 40M‚Ç¨ & +10 countries & +230 Seedtaggers

2022 ¬∑ Fundraising round of 250M‚Ç¨ + expansion into the U.S market + 400 Seedtaggers




YOUR CHALLENGE

You will get full ownership of our business data, and will be expected to propose and conduct analyses that transform Seedtag‚Äôs data into significant business opportunities and KPI improvements.
You will analyze the performance of our current Contextual products and processes and proactively propose initiatives that seek to improve Seedtag‚Äôs commercial and operational results.
You will develop tools that automate internal processes, increasing efficiency and efficacy of Seedtag teams.
You will help build tools that enable the democratization of data inside the company, and allow Seedtag teams to make informed, data-driven decisions.
Finally, you will build a solid knowledge of the adTech ecosystem and develop strong business acumen.




YOU WILL SUCCEED IN THIS ROLE IF

You have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Business, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science or Engineering. Specific certifications / education in Data / Business Intelligence are a plus.
You have 3-5 years of experience in a fast-paced environment, either start-up, corporate or consulting.
You have advanced skills in SQL for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.
You have experience with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes and tools.
You have knowledge of database management systems (e.g., BigQuery, MySQL).
You have experience working with programming languages such as Python or R for data analysis and manipulation.
You have experience in data visualization tools such as Looker, Power BI, or similar and you have knowledge of Excel/ Sheets.
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights that drive business value.
You have the ability to collaborate with business stakeholders to identify information needs and define business requirements.
You have excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders




It would be a big plus if you

Have experience in forecasting, trend analysis, and predictive modeling
Have previous experience in presenting and communicating data analysis results and insights to external stakeholders




SEEDTAG PERKS

üöÄ Key moment to join Seedtag in terms of growth and opportunities

üíØ One Seedtag: Work for a month from any of our open offices with travel and stay paid if you‚Äôre a top performer (think of Brazil, Mexico..., üèñÔ∏è)

üçΩÔ∏èüöò Access to a flexible benefits plan with restaurant, transportation, and kindergarten tickets and discounts on medical insurance

‚åõ Flexible schedule to balance work and personal life

üèã Gympass

üá¨üáß üá™üá∏ üá´üá∑ Optional company-paid English, Spanish and/or French courses

üìö Access to learning opportunities (learning & development budget)

üçª We love what we do, but we also love having fun. We have many team activities you can join and enjoy with your colleagues!




BENEFITS OF WORKING AT SEEDTAG

Growth: International, highly demanding work environment in one of the fastest growing AdTech companies in Europe. We reject "that‚Äôs the way it‚Äôs always been done". In Seedtag you can find an energetic, fresh workplace, multicultural work environment where our members are from different countries in Europe, LATAM, US and so many more!
Impact: The chance to have a direct impact, here you don't work for the sake of working, we all have an impact on seedtag in our own way, rowing in the same direction.
Diversity of methodology and people: Seedtag DNA is unique and highly appreciated by very different types of Seedtagers. We embrace diversity and encourage everyone to seek the best version of themselves and to show who they really are. With a total flexible methodology.
Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you, you can work from home, the beach or the office. The important thing is to work on your goals.




Are you ready to join the SEEDTAG adventure? Then send us your CV!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Shiji Group is a major software supplier in the hospitality and retail industries. Developing worldwide leading products and technologies, aimed at the international market and speeding up its globalization progress. Our team of more than 5,000 talented employees, in 70+ subsidiaries worldwide, is constantly adapting to facilitate the transition to fully integrated systems for our clients through a network of secure, scalable, and ready for the future platforms, so clients can focus on their core competencies of serving their customer and guests.




Job Description



We are expanding our team, and are currently looking for a proactive and detail oriented Data Analyst, to contribute to our international growth. The ideal candidate will have experience with data analysis and management, be comfortable with technology / SaaS Business Intelligence Tools, and is motivated by the opportunity to develop new ways to ensure a 100% data delivery & quality with the least effort possible.





Reporting to the Director of Product & Operations, the responsibilities include:


Perform data analysis and special reports for key clients, marketing and sales to identify data-driven trends and understand what matters and why.
Prepare excellent presentations, and consultancy documents to be delivered to clients.
Prioritize projects and the special data reporting pipeline and delivery times.
Execute, build and maintain data projects using Python, Excel, Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, Google Data Studio and some other data analysis tools like SPSS.
Structure, organize and maintain masses of information from different DBs to efficiently deliver on time the projects in pipeline.
Collaborate with the product managers to develop new visualizations, CRM data analysis and special data projects.


Qualifications



Candidates must be motivated, proactive and responsible individuals with:


Highly analytical mind.
Advanced Excel user.
Advanced Python user.
Experience managing the main Business Intelligence tool (Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, Google Data Studio).
Experience with advanced statistical methodology with knowledge in Python.
Desirable Knowledge in managing data through MySQL and API connections.
Results oriented.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to work well under pressure and manage their own time to deliver the Task / Projects.
Desirable knowledge in the Hotels sector and online reputation.




Requirements:


Excellent level of English. (Spanish desired).
Degree or being studying information technology, business administration, engineering or mathematical sciences.


Additional Information


Flexible work schedule
Free coffee, tea, and afterwork drinks
Brand new office located in the center of Barcelona
International team and fantastic work environment
Team building activities and charity donation programs
Discounts on Private health insurance, ticket restaurant, transport, kindergarten

Description:
ABOUT AXA




Whatever their stage of life, we provide over 108 million customers with the products and services they need to progress. Your work environment:

It provides guidance and support to subsidiaries around the world, to ensure the coordination and monitoring of the Group's global strategy, the application of its standards, the consistency of commercial approaches and the sharing of best practices. Within the Group, you will join the newly created Global Chief Underwriting Office (GUO) in charge of establishing, enabling, and driving profit and growth through Insurance Product Underwriting Strategy, Portfolio Design and Technical Underwriting Excellence & monitoring in partnership with the AXA Entities, for all lines of Business.

If you ‚Ä¶

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
My client in the financial services industry is looking for a Business Data Analyst on an autonomo contract (6-12 months) with it extending to a 2-3 years project. It will be on a hybrid basis in the office 3 days a week in Madrid.




Responsibilities

Main responsible of Business requirement gathering, User Story writing and lead User Story refinement efforts within the team. Able to build small prototypes and mock-ups as part of refinement efforts.
Participate together with engineers on the design of the solution.
Work together with Stakeholders during the Acceptance stage of solutions to guarantee successful delivery.
Can understand business processes and suggest improvements to the data platform.




Requirements

Data Architecture / Data Modelling knowledge.
Python Programming for Data.
Expert in Data Analysis / SQL Programming.
Must have strong communication and stakeholder management skills.
Understanding of REST APIs / SOAP APIs ( ability to read / understand technical specifications)
Experienced in Microsoft Power BI (ability to design prototypes to support requirements)







If interested, please apply and I will be in touch to discuss the role.

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
Apply now ¬ª

We provide inspiration worldwide with our intelligent solutions for industrial automation. We offer a high degree of flexibility to our more than 20.000 employees. We provide you excellent prospects for turning your ideas into reality ‚Äì because innovation requires freedom and security. We need you. Apply now and keep the world moving.

Data Analyst Intern

About FESTO

FESTO is a leading global company in automation technology and technical education. We are committed to driving innovation and providing high-quality products and services to our customers. Our Digital Sales Hub in Barcelona is at the forefront of driving data-driven decisions to optimize our sales and marketing processes and strategies.

Job Summary

We are looking for a motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst Intern to join our Digital Sales Hub in Barcelona. This internship will provide hands-on experience in data analysis and the opportunity to work on impactful projects that enhance our digital sales and marketing capabilities. As a Data Analyst Intern, you will support our team by collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data to help drive informed business decisions.

Key Responsibilities


Assist in collecting, cleaning, and analyzing marketing and sales data from various sources to support business operations.
Support the creation and maintenance of marketing and sales reports, dashboards, and visualizations to monitor key performance indicators (KPIs).
Help identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in marketing and sales data to provide actionable insights.
Collaborate with the marketing team to understand data needs and provide analytical support.
Conduct ad-hoc data analysis and present findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.
Assist in ensuring data quality and integrity across different data sets.
Stay up to date with industry trends and best practices in data analysis and reporting.


Qualifications


Currently pursuing a Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Marketing, Economics, or a related field.
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
Proficiency in Python and familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Good knowledge of SQL.
Familiarity with statistical analysis and data modeling techniques.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Strong problem-solving skills and a proactive approach to work.


Preferred Qualifications


Knowledge of digital marketing metrics and analytics.
Understanding of marketing strategies and campaigns.


What We Offer


Hands-on experience in data analysis and the opportunity to work on meaningful projects.
Mentorship from experienced professionals in the field.
A collaborative and supportive work environment.
Potential for future career opportunities within FESTO.


Company: Festo Automation S.A.U.

Location:

l¬¥Hospitalet de Llobregat, ES, 8908

We look forward to your application!

Apply now ¬ª

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:


Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.


Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.


Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.


At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.


We are looking for a Data Analyst for a project based in Porto (hybrid - twice a week at the office).


Requirements:

  • BS/MS Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Math or a similar area;
  • Experience in data workflow creation (data preparation and data reconciliation) in Alteryx or similar data analytics tools (for example Dataiku, Knime, etc.);
  • Experience with Business Intelligence - Data visualization tools, mainly Power BI;
  • Experience to develop and maintain Power Apps and Power Automate solutions;
  • Good knowledge about SQL;
  • Fluent English (mandatory).


If you‚Äôre interested in this job please send your CV in English to catarina.sa@decskill.com with reference ‚ÄúCS/Data_Analyst‚Äù.

Title: Data Analyst - Saudi Arabia
Description:
Make an impact by working for sectors where technology is the enabler, everything is ground-breaking and there‚Äôs a constant need to be innovative.

Be part of the team that combines business knowledge, technological edge and a design experience. Our different backgrounds and know-how are key in developing solutions and experiences for digital clients.

Face challenges and learn other ways of thinking and seeing the world - there‚Äôs always room for your energy and creativity.

About The Role

Data Analyst is responsible for examining and interpreting complex data sets to derive meaningful insights and support business decision-making. Focused on descriptive and diagnostic analytics to answer questions of where your company has been, where it is now, why things are the way they are now, and support the decision about what are the next steps.

Their mission involves organizing data, conducting statistical analysis, creating data models, and collecting data requirements from Businesses.

Data analysts collaborate with different teams to understand their analytical requirements, identify key metrics, and communicate data-driven findings to stakeholders effectively.

As a part of your job, you will:


Gathering and analyzing business requirements to determine the best solution for data reporting and analysis.
Designing data solutions such as data warehousing, data marts, dashboards, and reporting systems.
Developing and maintaining data models, reports, and visualizations.
Collaborating with IT teams to ensure proper data integration and management.
Assisting stakeholders in interpreting data insights and making informed business decisions.



What are we looking for?


Proficiency in SQL for data querying and analysis;
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, or Matplotlib);
Knowledge of statistical analysis techniques and tools (e.g., R, Python libraries like pandas);
Ability to interpret and analyze complex data sets;
Familiarity with data cleansing and preparation techniques.



Personal traits:

Ability to adapt to different contexts, teams and Clients

Teamwork skills but also sense of autonomy

Motivation for international projects and ok if travel is included

Willingness to collaborate with other players

Strong communication skills

We want people who like to roll up their sleeves and open their minds. Believe this is you? Come join the Team!

Celfocus is a European high-tech system integrator, providing professional services focused on creating business value through Analytics and Cognitive solutions ‚Äì addressing Telecommunications, Energy & Utilities, Financial Services and other markets' strategic opportunities.

Serving Clients in 25+ countries, Celfocus delivers solutions such as accelerating digital network transformation in Autonomous Networks, elevating and monetising business services in B2B2x ecosystems, and providing highly relevant customer experiences through Hyper-personalisation solutions.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

‚Ç¨40,000 - ‚Ç¨45,000 + 10% bonus + benefits

Porto (2 days per week in the office)




Our client




Our client is a global strategic technology and payments partner. They deliver seamless personalised shopping experiences to over 29m international shoppers, who in turn generate ‚Ç¨22.9bn revenue.




With 2,000 employees spread across 50 countries, they integrate with 300,000 point of sale systems in a number of luxury retailers and brands including Harrods, Selfridges, John Lewis, Liberty‚Äôs, Apple, Cartier, De Beers, Herm√®s, Rolex, Dior and Jimmy Choo.




Their products include tax-free shopping, smart data and intelligence, marketing and sales, POS technology and payment solutions.




The role




The Data Analyst will help the business to understand customer needs and behaviours through the analysis of complex data sets and subsequent translation into meaningful, shareable insights and stories.




This role will be hands on with building visualisations in Tableau and ad hoc analysis (using SQL) to inform the optimisation of products and features.




As a Data Analyst, you will:




Monitor and report on key KPIs.
Deep-dive (using SQL) into customer data to provide product teams with detailed customer analysis.
Be hands-on with building visualisations in Tableau.
Identify data requirements, working with international data teams to ensure data is cleansed and prepared.
Support with the identification of new and innovative ways to leverage data to deliver new customer engagement opportunities, optimise channels and deliver economic efficiency.
Deliver enhanced customer profiling and segmentation.
Measure the effectiveness of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Provide ad-hoc analysis to inform the optimisation of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Advise on how advanced statistical and analytical techniques can further improve the understanding of customers.




To apply, you should have




Experience working as a Data Analyst with good exposure to statistical methodologies.
Intermediate SQL skills.
Advanced experience with Tableau (or a similar tool).
Advanced Excel skills.
Proven experience delivering impactful and actionable insights with a B2C environment.




Match Digital specialises in connecting talented individuals with businesses in the digital, tech, media and marcomms industries.

Title: Data Analyst (f/m/div)
HTML:
Become a strategic problem solver to develop data-driven solutions that meet business needs. Lead projects to deliver robust, sustainable solutions while independently shaping your analysis and presenting innovative ideas to diverse audiences. Build strong working relationships with key partners to drive business success. The role involves engaging with different stakeholders to identify strategic needs, work independently or collaboratively to develop data-driven solutions to meet business requirements. This includes leading projects to ensure the delivery of sustainable and scalable solutions, while also being self-directed in analyzing data and recommending innovative ideas for improvement. Additionally, it entails presenting to diverse organizational audiences and cultivating strong relationships with key business partners.

In your new role you will:

  • Understand the overall strategic requirements to inform your solutions;
  • Independently or working with a team to develop and deliver tools, data visualization and analysis to support the overall business;
  • Leading projects and tasks,ensuring the delivery of robust, sustainable and scalable solutions while engaging with IT and business partners;
  • Be self-directed in interrogating and understanding data to shape your analysis;
  • Recommend innovative ideas and procedures to improve existing strategies;
  • Present to audiences of varying organizational roles and hierarchy levels;
  • Develop solid working relationships with key partners across the business.

You are a results-driven professional with a Data Analysis background with an interest in Supply Chain processes. Also, you have solid communication skills and are able to build lasting relationships and to coordinate effectively with your colleagues. Your open-mindedness embraces new ideas and creative opportunities.

You are best equipped for this task if you have:

  • A Degree in IT, Data Analytics or similar;
  • At least 3 years of proven experience in Data Analysis. Background experience in a supply chain environment would be a plus;
  • Good understanding of Mathematics and Statistics, with an excellent Microsoft Excel (VBA) ability;
  • Previous experience in analytical roles using SQL, Python or similar;
  • Proven experience with Power BI and Tableau;
  • Knowledge of ERP would be a plus;
  • Highly organized, detail-oriented, a solid work ethic as well as demonstrated teamwork skills;
  • Ability to take ownership, function independently and effectively within teams and in a self-directed environment;
  • Solid communication skills, able to work with stakeholders from multiple levels and disciplines;
  • Fluency English with excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Please send us your CV in English.

Driving decarbonization and digitalization. Together.

Infineon designs, develops, manufactures, and markets a broad range of semiconductors and semiconductor-based solutions, focusing on key markets in the automotive, industrial, and consumer sectors. Its products range from standard components to special components for digital, analog, and mixed-signal applications to customer-specific solutions together with the appropriate software.

  • Welcome to Infineon Technologies Business Solutions in Porto! ‚Äì

Infineon Technologies Business Solutions is a vibrant global hub, driven by diverse talents and an operational culture of excellence, in a privileged geographic location. The team of more than 25 nationalities works together in a dynamic, diverse and inclusive environment. We lead innovation and digital transformation, shaping the future of Infineon Technologies. At the heart of everything we do, people matter most. Our ultimate goal is to craft a unique experience for both our customers and employees.

At our site you will find a range of diverse teams that have built a reputation for delivering high-quality services for all Infineon in Finance, Procurement, Human Resources, IT, Audit, Legal, Compliance, Business Continuity and Sustainability, Cyber Security, Communication, Corporate Supply Chain Logistics and Sales & Marketing.

Porto is a powerhouse of ideas and solutions, a key player in the global company‚Äôs puzzle, delivering specialized services and innovative solutions.

Together, Infineon Technologies Business Solutions will continue to shape the future, driving innovation and excellence for years to come.

We are on a journey to create the best Infineon for everyone.

This means we embrace diversity and inclusion and welcome everyone for who they are. At Infineon, we offer a working environment characterized by trust, openness, respect and tolerance and are committed to give all applicants and employees equal opportunities. We base our recruiting decisions on the applicant¬¥s experience and skills.

We look forward to receiving your resume, even if you do not entirely meet all the requirements of the job posting.

Please let your recruiter know if they need to pay special attention to something in order to enable your participation in the interview process.

Click here for more information about Diversity & Inclusion at Infineon.

Title: Data Analyst w/ Power Platform
Description:
Job Description



Context / team / project
- Integrate into our Data Team (ETL, Data Management, BI), working together with NY Data Office, Paris and Porto team members, as a unique team, and help Porto to upskill on this practice.
- Bring a differentiating expertise to our clients and stakeholders with integrity and responsibility. (Sustainable impact)
- Be agile, accountable, and resilient, according to the circumstances (Entrepreneurial mindset)
- Purposely striving to succeed together, Porto and Paris, as one team with openness and confidence to improve knowledge, practice, framework, ecosystem (Collective intelligence).
- Contribute on local initiative and project from assessment, use case identification, data preparation, implementation, industrialization‚Ä¶
- Contribute to data community.
- Animate data awareness, training‚Ä¶


Years of Experience:
‚Ä¢ > 5 years


Main Tasks & Responsibilities:


‚Ä¢ Work closely with business users to understand their requirements and challenges around data analytics, data reconciliation, and Power Platform solutions.
‚Ä¢ Translate these requirements into a data workflow, dashboards and/or applications solutions making use of Alteryx and Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI).
‚Ä¢ Working closely with business analysts, data scientists, data engineers and developers.
‚Ä¢ Analyze, estimate, and define tasks necessary deliver the data and power platform projects.
‚Ä¢ Drive insights to answer business questions with data and visualizations, transforming data into actionable insights.
‚Ä¢ Maintain and do the evolution of created assets during the projects.




Qualifications



Main Technical Requirements:


‚Ä¢ BS/MS Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Math, or a similar area;
‚Ä¢ Experience in data workflow creation (data preparation and data reconciliation) in Alteryx or similar data analytics tools, for example Dataiku, Knime, etc.
‚Ä¢ Experience with Business Intelligence - Data visualization tools, mainly Power BI;
‚Ä¢ Experience to develop and maintain Power Apps and Power Automate solutions;
‚Ä¢ Good knowledge about SQL.



Other Requirements:


‚Ä¢ Good level of English - minimum B2
‚Ä¢ Able to be quickly autonomous, proactive
‚Ä¢ Desire to learn more about new technologies as Power Platform and Dataiku.
‚Ä¢ A real passion for learning, doing things better and helping others;
‚Ä¢ Availability to travel abroad for short periods of time, as required



Nice to have:


‚Ä¢ Previous experience on financial area will be a big plus
‚Ä¢ Knowledge in agile methodologies and tools (Scrum/Kanban);
‚Ä¢ French is a big plus

‚Ä¢ Work closely with business users to understand their requirements and challenges around data analytics, data reconciliation, and Power Platform solutions.
‚Ä¢ Translate these requirements into a data workflow, dashboards and/or applications solutions making use of Alteryx and Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI).
‚Ä¢ Working closely with business analysts, data scientists, data engineers and developers.
‚Ä¢ Analyze, estimate, and define tasks necessary deliver the data and power platform projects.
‚Ä¢ Drive insights to answer business questions with data and visualizations, transforming data into actionable insights.
‚Ä¢ Maintain and do the evolution of created assets during the projects.


Qualifications

Main Technical Requirements:

‚Ä¢ BS/MS Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Math, or a similar area;
‚Ä¢ Experience in data workflow creation (data preparation and data reconciliation) in Alteryx or similar data analytics tools, for example Dataiku, Knime, etc.
‚Ä¢ Experience with Business Intelligence - Data visualization tools, mainly Power BI;
‚Ä¢ Experience to develop and maintain Power Apps and Power Automate solutions;
‚Ä¢ Good knowledge about SQL.


Other Requirements:

‚Ä¢ Good level of English - minimum B2
‚Ä¢ Able to be quickly autonomous, proactive
‚Ä¢ Desire to learn more about new technologies as Power Platform and Dataiku.
‚Ä¢ A real passion for learning, doing things better and helping others;
‚Ä¢ Availability to travel abroad for short periods of time, as required


Nice to have:

‚Ä¢ Previous experience on financial area will be a big plus
‚Ä¢ Knowledge in agile methodologies and tools (Scrum/Kanban);
‚Ä¢ French is a big plus

Title: Data Support Analyst
Description:
Who is Clever?

Clever Advertising is a multinational digital brand serving the iGaming industry for the last 15 years with innovative advertising and technology solutions.

We are dedicated to your professional and personal growth in an environment that values knowledge-sharing and mentorship.




Why joining Clever?

Working with us means joining a diverse team where each member contributes to collective success, supporting one another through shared goals and passions. We not only focus on achieving excellent results but also enjoy the journey, making every day both fulfilling and fun.




Where will I work from?

Porto, Portugal.




What is my department like?

Our Technology Department is the driving force behind the innovations that propel our company forward. Committed to creating scalable and high-quality solutions, we work in a collaborative environment where every idea matters. Our teams of experts in development, infrastructure, security, and data intelligence are driven by a passion for solving complex challenges and delivering impactful results. We value diversity of thought and believe that the best solutions arise from collaboration between diverse and creative minds




What is my role like?

We are looking for a dedicated and detail-oriented Data Support Analyst to join our Data Management team. The ideal candidate will have effective communication skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work collaboratively with various departments, ensuring that data operations are executed with accuracy and efficiency.




What will my daily tasks involve?

Assist the Data Management team in interacting with other departments, facilitating communication and collaboration to ensure that data projects meet the needs of all stakeholders.
Manage and resolve first-level support tickets related to data, including issues with dashboards, RPA bots, and data loading processes.
Monitor and ensure that dashboard loads are executed correctly, identifying and resolving any performance or loading issues.
Validate bots developed by the RPA team, ensuring they function as expected and comply with established requirements.
Create and maintain detailed documentation for data processes, RPA bots, and support procedures, ensuring that information is always up-to-date and accessible.




What is expected from me?

Minimum of 1 year of experience in data support, data analysis, or similar roles.
Familiarity with BI tools (Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
Basic knowledge of SQL and ETL practices.
Ability to maintain technical documentation.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to solve problems quickly and effectively.
Attention to detail and accuracy when working with data are differentiating factors.




What can I expect from Clever?

A competitive remuneration package
Superior health benefits
Employee cafeteria featuring meals approved by our nutritionist
Wellbeing support through our Happiness Department, including 24/7 medical app access,complimentary nutritional consultations, psychological support, and wellness webinars.
A commitment to professional growth with tailored development plans and opportunities for internal career moves.
An education-rich workplace with access to the Clever Academy and language learning opportunities.
A balanced approach to work-life dynamics.




At Clever, we believe in diversity and inclusion as drivers of innovation. We foster a work environment free from discrimination, where everyone has equal opportunities to succeed.




Ready to make a Clever choice?

Title: Fraud Data Analyst
Description:
FARFETCH exists for the love of fashion. Our mission is to be the global platform for luxury fashion, connecting creators, curators and consumers.

We're a positive platform for good, bringing together an incredible creative community made up by our people, our partners and our customers. This community is at the heart of our business success. We welcome differences, empower individuality and celebrate diverse skills and perspectives, creating an inclusive environment for everyone. We are FARFETCH for All.




OPERATIONS

We're passionate about operational excellence, acting with our customers and partners always in our heart. Covering the entire order journey, we create our online content, secure payments and fraud process compliance, ensure order fulfilment and delivery, while providing customer and partner care. In a nutshell, we love to create seamless and memorable luxury experiences for our customers all around the world.




PORTO

Our Porto office is located in Portugal's vibrant second city, known for its history and its creative yet cosy environment. You can have an informal meeting in the treehouse or play the piano during your lunch break!




THE ROLE

Reporting to the Fraud & Risk Investigations Manager, you will be pivotal in executing and refining our fraud prevention activities. Utilizing advanced tools and comprehensive data analysis, you will optimize fraud detection methods, enhance overall performance, and achieve key KPIs across all regions and business units.




WHAT YOU'LL DO

Build and maintain fraud reports and dashboards in BigQuery and Looker to enable real-time fraud analysis.
Proactively identify and resolve fraud issues, ensuring we‚Äôre balancing fraud prevention with customer experience.
Daily monitoring and reporting of fraud KPIs.
Produce ad hoc reports to evidence live issues and trends and develop solutions to prevent and mitigate risk.
Design, test and implement rules & logic to prevent fraud and reduce false positives.
Apply advanced analytical techniques to extract meaningful insights from large datasets to minimise fraud chargebacks whilst balancing customer friction
Work independently on fraud analytics and the analysis of large datasets to ensure appropriate feedback is given to the internal and external ML models.
Communicate and escalate fraud trends in a clear and understandable manner to stakeholders.




WHO YOU ARE

3 + years experience working in a fast-paced e commerce fraud environment
Proficiency in SQL (SQL Server, BigQuery, or similar)
Experience using data visualisation tools (Looker, PowerBI, Tableau, or similar)
Ability to transform data analysis into defined actions and improvement
Knowledge of fraud systems and controls e.g Forter, Riskified, Accertify
Ability to work autonomously in solving complex technical problems
Detail-oriented with a focus on data accuracy and quality
Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey technical concepts to a non-technical audience
Advanced in English, both written and oral.




REWARDS & BENEFITS

Health insurance for the whole family, flexible working environment and well-being support and tools
Extra days off, sabbatical program and days for you to give back for the community
Training opportunities and free access to Udemy
Flexible benefits program




EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES STATEMENT

FARFETCH is an equal opportunities employer ensuring that all applicants are treated equally and fairly throughout our recruitment process. We are determined that no applicant experiences discrimination on the basis of sex, race, ethnicity, religion or belief, disability, age, gender identity, ancestry, sexual orientation, veteran status, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, or any other basis prohibited by applicable law. We continue to build our consciously inclusive culture as part of our Positively FARFETCH strategy throughout our business, partnerships and communities.




The Fraud Operations team's mission is to protect our customers and reduce risk on the Farfetch Platform, while contributing to the growth of our business.

Title: Lead Insight Analyst
Description:
Lead Insight Analyst required to joining our rapidly expanding Data Analytics team on a permanent basis in Portugal.

The opportunity:

As a Lead Insight Analyst you will have the opportunity to work on some of our largest projects and key accounts. Reporting to the Head of Data Analytics, you will be responsible for analysing digital behaviour in order to provide key, actionable insight and critical recommendations to our clients. This is more than just an insight role; it‚Äôs an opportunity to help shape the digital strategies of some of the world‚Äôs leading brands and retailers! You will be tool agnostic and you will use tools like Google Analytics and Adobe Analytics for tracking data, GTM, Adobe Launch or Tealium for implementing tags and a mixture of data visualization tool as well as Excel and Powerpoint for visualisation. Additionally, you will be managing a small team of Analysts and will be providing oversight to ensure that their delivering tool quality analysis outputs.

Please note that this job is a full-time position located in Lisbon or Porto, but the selection process will be conducted in English.

Please send over your CV in English




What you‚Äôll be doing:

Shaping, sell and deliver large analytics programs of work.
Creating measurement plans that identify the customer behaviour to be tracked (you will work closely with our implementation analysts for this)
Establishing detailed reporting and visualisations that help our clients understand the performance of their digital channels
Using measurement tools to analyse digital user behaviours in detail, across a wide range of digital properties (websites, mobile applications, instore devices)
Creating detailed insight reports that cover key findings and recommendations
Presenting your findings to a senior-level client audience and helping them understand what it means for their business
Working with our internal UX and design teams to inform the creation of new websites and apps
Answering client queries and running training sessions with them
Having line management duties for a small team of analysts, including developing their skillset and driving the quality of their work

What we want from you:

Extensive experience working as a Lead Analyst providing insight, ideally in an ecommerce setting (client or agency)
Must have Advanced practical knowledge of Analytics tools (Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Content Square)
Numerically adept in using Excel (or similar) to analyse data
Previous experience supporting junior team members
Highly proficient in Microsoft Word and PowerPoint
Extensive experience working with senior client stakeholders
Effective time management and multitasking abilities
A proven track record of delivering large insight projects for leading B2C organisations

What we can offer you:

Alongside the opportunity to work with some of the most exciting brands around the world, we‚Äôll also prioritise your career development and help you grow your skills. We‚Äôll empower you to make a difference, allow you to be yourself, and respect who you are.

We offer a great benefits package including hybrid working that works for everyone, social events, training opportunities, medical and dental insurance, life assurance, meal cards and much more.

Our personality and behaviours: We believe that we are what we do, not just what we say. Our shared values and behaviours show how to bring the VML Enterprise Solution's culture to life through the actions we all take every day:

Connect Meaningfully
Inspire Creatively
Include Purposefully
Approach Positively




Our brilliant, talented people are what makes VML Enterprise Solutions what we are. That‚Äôs why we look for people who go beyond and always push our thinking to be better than yesterday.

AT VML Enterprise Solutions

Our Enterprise Solutions division houses strategic consultants, creative and technical architects and skilled developers and operators that together help some of the world‚Äôs leading organisations to deliver outstanding digital experiences across all major routes to market worldwide: marketplaces, online retailers, D2C, B2B and social platforms. With over 4,200 experts in 55 operational centres across 34 countries, our capabilities span the entire buying journey from customer acquisition, through engagement, to conversion and loyalty, driving multi-channel growth for world-leading brands.

We work with some of the most exciting brands such as The Coca-Cola Company, EY, Bosch, Unilever, Ford, DFS, Mercedes-Benz, Johnson & Johnson, Nestl√©, Sainsbury‚Äôs, Selfridges, Shell and Tiffany & Co. We‚Äôve built over 500 platforms for brands and retailers and generate in excess of $29bn annually for our clients and work with over 50 strategic partners including Adobe, SAP, Salesforce, HCL, Shopify, Sitecore, BigCommerce, commerce tools and Acquia. Our reputation is based on our people, and we believe we have some of the best in the business.

As our business grows internationally, we‚Äôre looking for new people to join us on our journey to inspire and take a key role in shaping some of the best commerce solutions, services, and websites in the world. Working as a team, no problem is insurmountable; we share in our client‚Äôs successes and believe that anyone can show creative bravery no matter what their role is in the team.

In our Lisbon or Porto office, you‚Äôll join a team of other specialists who are always ready to help each other. The team is part of our Enterprise Solutions network and works in coordination with our Local and EMEA client leads.

#LI-EMEA #LI-HYBRID #LI-JM1

We work with some of the most exciting brands such as The Coca-Cola Company, EY, Bosch, Unilever, Ford, DFS, Mercedes-Benz, Johnson & Johnson, Nestl√©, Sainsbury‚Äôs, Selfridges, Shell and Tiffany & Co. We‚Äôve built over 500 platforms for brands and retailers and generate in excess of $29bn annually for our clients and work with over 50 strategic partners including Adobe, SAP, Salesforce, HCL, Shopify, Sitecore, BigCommerce, commerce tools and Acquia. Our reputation is based on our people, and we believe we have some of the best in the business.

As our business grows internationally, we‚Äôre looking for new people to join us on our journey to inspire and take a key role in shaping some of the best commerce solutions, services, and websites in the world. Working as a team, no problem is insurmountable; we share in our client‚Äôs successes and believe that anyone can show creative bravery no matter what their role is in the team.

In our Lisbon or Porto office, you‚Äôll join a team of other specialists who are always ready to help each other. The team is part of our Enterprise Solutions network and works in coordination with our Local and EMEA client leads.

#LI-EMEA #LI-HYBRID #LI-JM1

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
BARKYN‚ÄôS VISION

Barkyn delivers health and happiness to pet families around the world.

Our mission is to impact an important part of dog families' lives by giving them more years, more joy, and a deeper bond. We're changing the pet market and how e-commerce should feel: human, personalized, and beautiful. We were considered one of Europe‚Äôs Top 100 Startups by Wired, Top 50 Technology Fast by Deloitte, and a success case by Web Summit.

THE ROLE

We're creating a loved brand in Europe, and this is where your story begins!

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will help our brand's evolution across Europe with the right data insights.

Specifically, we expect you to:


Execute Data initiatives, mainly reporting dashboards and in-depth data analysis
Define and improve the architecture of our Data structure and Dashboards to be aligned with our business goals
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams and team managers to ensure seamless execution and efficient prioritization



Mandatory requirements:


Minimum 7 years of experience at multiple companies and at least in one B2C business
Hands-on experience on reporting, analytics, dashboards and BI
Experience with BigQuery or similar and Google Cloud
Experience with Python



Brownie points:


Experience with AI models
Experience at a medium-sized startup, ideally at a scale-up stage
Dog owner.

Title: Full Stack Data Analyst
Description:
ü§îWho are we?




As the founding entity of RAINBOW PARTNERS, Quanteam is a consulting firm specializing in the fields of Banking, Finance, and Financial Services. Guided by our core values of closeness, teamwork, diversity, and excellence, our team of 740 expert consultants, representing 35 different nationalities, collaborates across 10 international offices: Paris, Lyon, New York, Montreal, London, Brussels, Geneva, Lisbon, Porto and Casablanca. Committed to sustainability (Ecovadis Gold), diversity (gender index: 92%), and quality of work life (Best Workplace Experience), Quanteam is a forward-thinking enterprise.




üöÄ Our Expertise




With a dual expertise in both business and IT, Quanteam supports its corporate clients (investment banks, asset management companies, private and retail banks, custodians, etc.) across the entire Front-to-Back spectrum in evolving their business activities and transformation projects.




Our teams are organized into 5 expertise areas:

‚û° Quantitative Finance

‚û° Risk, Compliance, and Regulatory

‚û° Operations and Finance

‚û° Transformation and Organization

‚û° Information Systems

In 2023, Quanteam generated a revenue of ‚Ç¨74.6 million.




üîéWe are looking for a Full Stack Data Analyst




We are looking for a talented Data Analyst with data science skills, expertise in ETL and DataViz solution.

The candidate will lead dashboard projects from End to End in cyber security risk management.

You will work closely with the other departments and entities within Cyber to identify business needs, design effective data models, develop and maintain dashboards using POWERBI, TABLEAU, DATAIKU and PostgreSQL for data processing and analysis.




YOUR MISSIONS:




Understand the company‚Äôs requirements and identify KPIs for the development of dashboards related to cyber security risk management.
Collect, clean, and transform data sets using ETL tools to create effective data models.
Develop and maintain dashboards and ensure the accuracy and availability of data related to managing cyber security risks.
Use Dataiku and PostgreSQL for data processing and analysis, including statistical techniques.
Leverage on machine learning algorithms to identify additional insights and define non explicit correlations between indicators.
Present findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner, making recommendations for action when appropriate to improve Dashboard production.
Continuously improve the accuracy and usability of data by monitoring data quality and developing new data models.
Demonstrate excellent problem-solving skills and a proactive approach to identifying problems and provide solutions.







YOUR PROFILE AND SKILLS:




A bachelor's degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics, or a related subject.
3+ years of experience as data Analyst, developing Dashboard and DataViz
Knowledge of algorithms is a plus and will enable the candidate to be a force for proposing useful content related to cyber security risk management.
Expertise with POWERBI, TABLEAU, DATAIKU, PostgreSQL and ETL tools.
Fluent in English.
Hybrid regime in Lisbon or Porto Office (depends on your location).




üöÄIf you feel this opportunity is for you, send your CV and join our team!

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Jumia (Full Time)
Description:
About Jumia:

Jumia believes that technology has the potential to transform everyday life in Africa for the better. Jumia was built to help consumers access millions of goods and services conveniently and at the best prices while opening up a new way for sellers to reach consumers and grow their businesses.

Listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in 2019, Jumia is the leading e-commerce company in Africa, operating in 11 countries. The Jumia platform consists of a marketplace, which connects sellers with consumers, a logistics service, which enables the shipment and delivery of packages from sellers to consumers, and a payment service, JumiaPay, which offers a safe and easy solution to facilitate online payment transactions. The company offers goods across a broad range of categories, such as phones and electronics, home appliances, fast-moving consumer goods, fashion and beauty.

What you will be doing


Lead the execution of data analysis projects, including collecting specifications, creating dashboards, and conducting in-depth analyses to drive business decisions
Develop and maintain complex SQL queries, Power BI dashboards, and Excel models to support various business units
Mentor and support junior colleagues in data analysis techniques, query optimization, and dashboard creatio
Perform quality assurance on data outputs, including queries, dashboard results, and visualizations to ensure accuracy and reliability
Communicate analytical findings and insights to senior stakeholders in a clear, concise, and actionable manner
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to standardize processes, improve team performance, and enhance overall efficiency
Assist the team manager in handling ad-hoc requests and managing cross-team projects
Contribute to the development of best practices and documentation for data analysis processes.


What we are looking for


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related quantitative field
Minimum of 5 years of experience in data analysis, preferably in the e-commerce or retail sector
Advanced proficiency in SQL, Power BI, and Excel; familiarity with JIRA and Confluence is a plus
Demonstrated experience in creating and maintaining complex dashboards and conducting in-depth data analysis
Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to translate business requirements into analytical solutions
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex data insights to both technical and non-technical audiences
Experience in mentoring junior team members and contributing to process improvements
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
Knowledge of e-commerce metrics and KPIs is highly desirable
Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git) and data visualization best practices
This job description outlines the key responsibilities and requirements for a Senior Data Analyst at Jumia, emphasizing the technical skills, leadership qualities, and industry knowledge needed for success in this role.


We Offer:


A unique experience in an entrepreneurial, yet structured environment
A unique opportunity of having strong impact in building the African e-commerce sector
The opportunity to become part of a highly professional and dynamic team
An unparalleled personal and professional growth as our longer term objective is to train the next generation of leaders


Please ensure to only apply for jobs with Jumia through our official website.

Jumia will never charge you a fee to apply for a job: be wary of websites that claim to help you apply for a Jumia job or that charge a fee to get you a job.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique, and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, teamwork.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability, or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!

We are looking for an Amazing: Data Engineer

Seniority: Senior (5+ years)

Type of position: Hybrid from Braga. Candidates must be living in Portugal already!

The amazing you, will have:


Expertise in PySpark
Expertise in SQL
Airflow and GCP is a nice to have
Good English Knowledge
Familiarity with Scala is a bonus
Hybrid model in Braga



Why should you become part of our family?


You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term;
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity;
Free training programs: our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster;
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work;
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that¬¥s why a hybrid system works for us and for you;
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home;
Full Onsite projects: if you prefer the company of your colleagues!

Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psychologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days‚Ä¶ all remote!


Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Innovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.
