Title: Data Visualization Engineer - Saudi Arabia
Description:
Make an impact by working for sectors where technology is the enabler, everything is ground-breaking and there‚Äôs a constant need to be innovative.

Be part of the team that combines business knowledge, technological edge and a design experience. Our different backgrounds and know-how are key in developing solutions and experiences for digital clients.

Face challenges and learn other ways of thinking and seeing the world - there‚Äôs always room for your energy and creativity.

About The Role

The Data Visualization Engineer is responsible for extracting, preparing, and cleansing data, as well as designing and creating visually engaging and informative data visualizations.

As a part of your job, you will:


Collaborate with data analysts and business stakeholders to understand data requirements and objectives for visualization projects.
Connect and integrate visualization tools with various data sources, ensuring seamless and efficient data access.
Extract, prepare, and cleanse data from various sources, ensuring data quality, integrity, and accuracy for visualization purposes.
Design and develop visually engaging and insightful data visualizations using appropriate tools and techniques.



What are we looking for?


BSc and/or MSc in Computer Science or similar;
Previous experience with Data Visualization, Business Intelligence, and ETL processes;
Proficiency in Power BI;
Proficiency in data prep tools or components as Tableau Prep, Power Query, Alteryx, or similar;
Solid understanding of data extraction, preparation, and cleansing techniques to ensure data quality and integrity;
Experience with database management systems, SQL, and various data formats, such as CSV, JSON, and XML;
Ability to connect and integrate visualization tools with various data sources, such as APIs, databases, or data lakes.



Personal traits:

Ability to adapt to different contexts, teams and Clients

Teamwork skills but also sense of autonomy

Motivation for international projects and ok if travel is included

Willingness to collaborate with other players

Strong communication skills

We want people who like to roll up their sleeves and open their minds. Believe this is you? Come join the Team!

Celfocus is a European high-tech system integrator, providing professional services focused on creating business value through Analytics and Cognitive solutions ‚Äì addressing Telecommunications, Energy & Utilities, Financial Services and other markets' strategic opportunities.

Serving Clients in 25+ countries, Celfocus delivers solutions such as accelerating digital network transformation in Autonomous Networks, elevating and monetising business services in B2B2x ecosystems, and providing highly relevant customer experiences through Hyper-personalisation solutions.

About The Role

The Data Visualization Engineer is responsible for extracting, preparing, and cleansing data, as well as designing and creating visually engaging and informative data visualizations.

As a part of your job, you will:

  • Collaborate with data analysts and business stakeholders to understand data requirements and objectives for visualization projects.
  • Connect and integrate visualization tools with various data sources, ensuring seamless and efficient data access.
  • Extract, prepare, and cleanse data from various sources, ensuring data quality, integrity, and accuracy for visualization purposes.
  • Design and develop visually engaging and insightful data visualizations using appropriate tools and techniques.


What are we looking for?

  • BSc and/or MSc in Computer Science or similar;
  • Previous experience with Data Visualization, Business Intelligence, and ETL processes;
  • Proficiency in Power BI;
  • Proficiency in data prep tools or components as Tableau Prep, Power Query, Alteryx, or similar;
  • Solid understanding of data extraction, preparation, and cleansing techniques to ensure data quality and integrity;
  • Experience with database management systems, SQL, and various data formats, such as CSV, JSON, and XML;
  • Ability to connect and integrate visualization tools with various data sources, such as APIs, databases, or data lakes.


Personal traits:

Ability to adapt to different contexts, teams and Clients

Teamwork skills but also sense of autonomy

Motivation for international projects and ok if travel is included

Willingness to collaborate with other players

Strong communication skills

We want people who like to roll up their sleeves and open their minds. Believe this is you? Come join the Team!

Celfocus is a European high-tech system integrator, providing professional services focused on creating business value through Analytics and Cognitive solutions ‚Äì addressing Telecommunications, Energy & Utilities, Financial Services and other markets' strategic opportunities.

Serving Clients in 25+ countries, Celfocus delivers solutions such as accelerating digital network transformation in Autonomous Networks, elevating and monetising business services in B2B2x ecosystems, and providing highly relevant customer experiences through Hyper-personalisation solutions.

Title: Lead Data Engineer
Description:
Do you want to be part of building Vestas new Design Centre?

Vestas Technology & Operations > Research & Development (R&D) > Plant Data

Vestas Technology & Operations, a cornerstone of Vestas, is committed to innovation, product development, and continuous improvement. We aim to develop high products and technologies that build down the cost of energy, delivering maximum value to both our customers and Vestas.

As a part of Vestas Technology & Operations, the Modelling & Analytics, Plant Data team is responsible for the creation and management of products and services related to Vestas Plant Data Offerings. Our accomplished and diverse team of Data Engineers is focused on designing products that facilitate data collection, processing and storage from thousands of power plants across the world. The team also supports data storage and conducts data analytics on a hybrid data platform setup that supports multiple data applications for our customers.

Our overarching mission is to reduce the cost of energy by harnessing the extensive data collected and stored by Vestas from power plants worldwide. Join us in this mission to make a meaningful impact on the future of renewable energy.

Responsibilities

Potential candidate is expected to be 70% hands on with the data engineering team and engage with the architects and other stakeholders (PM, PO etc) for the remainder.

Perform upstream and downstream impact analysis of complex data flows which involved multiple source systems.
Contribute actively to design and delivery of migrating data products from legacy to cloud setup.
Facilitate key POC‚Äôs & mentor team data engineers on technical solutions.
Facilitate and contribute to formal Code & design reviews.
Oversight and contribution to managing operational data products (Level 3 Support).
Working with Architects, SME‚Äôs, business and product stakeholders in identifying data products and workloads in legacy warehouse.
Participate and co-own product architecture and drive strategic roadmap for plant data warehouse.

Qualifications

Master's degree in Electrical and Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Software engineering or related fields are preferences.
+7 years of experience in on-prem & cloud data warehousing domain.
Formidable command on advanced SQL & ELT design patterns & data flow/ workload performance optimization.

We envision that you possess experience in designing, building, and maintaining data products within hybrid environments.

Additionally, you should identify with at least one of the following qualifications:

Experience in data workload migration from on prem to cloud ETL + Data Warehouse.
Experience in Azure services + Snowflake + DBT would be an added advantage.
Extensive hands-on data modelling experience in cloud data warehouse and data structures.
Experience with SQL server, SSIS & SSAS would be a positive factor.
Familiarity with agile development methodologies and DevOps practices.
Experience with data mesh implementation,
Python, Py-Spark, Databricks would a bonus.

Competencies

On individual capacity, we anticipate that you:

Possess a collaborative and open-minded nature, eager to contribute to a globally diverse cross-functional team within the organization
Display curiosity and enthusiasm for developing innovative data products that generate value
Thrive in diverse environments and exhibit flexibility in adapting to evolving conditions
Exhibit good communication skills, coupled with a practical, problem-solving approach to accomplishing tasks
Embrace a commitment to continuous learning and a desire to contribute to the collective growth of the team

What We Offer

An aspirational position that lets you work on the key data areas in Vestas and be part of projects that redefine the Vestas data landscape.

Opportunity to work with and address challenges related to processing, developing and delivering value from true large scale industrial IOT data.

Take part in creating a green & sustainable future for the planet.

Additional information

We look forward to receiving your application as soon as possible, as we will be reviewing applications on a rolling basis. To apply for this opportunity please submit your resume in English.




BEWARE ‚Äì RECRUITMENT FRAUDIt has come to our attention that there are a number of fraudulent emails from people pretending to work for Vestas. Read more via this link, https://www.vestas.com/en/careers/our-recruitment-process

DEIB StatementAt Vestas, we recognize the value of diversity, equity, and inclusion in driving innovation and success. We strongly encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply, particularly those who may hesitate due to their identity or feel they do not meet every criterion. As our CEO states, "Expertise and talent come in many forms, and a diverse workforce enhances our ability to think differently and solve the complex challenges of our industry". Your unique perspective is what will help us powering the solution for a sustainable, green energy future.

About VestasVestas is the energy industry‚Äôs global partner on sustainable energy solutions. We are specialised in designing, manufacturing, installing, and servicing wind turbines, both onshore and offshore. Across the globe, we have installed more wind power than anyone else. We consider ourselves pioneers within the industry, as we continuously aim to design new solutions and technologies to create a more sustainable future for all of us. With more than 173 GW of wind power installed worldwide and 40+ years of experience in wind energy, we have an unmatched track record demonstrating our expertise within the field. With 29,000 employees globally, we are a diverse team united by a common goal: to power the solution ‚Äì today, tomorrow, and far into the future. Vestas promotes a diverse workforce which embraces all social identities and is free of any discrimination. We commit to create and sustain an environment that acknowledges and harvests different experiences, skills, and perspectives. We also aim to give everyone equal access to opportunity. To learn more about our company and life at Vestas, we invite you to visit our website at www.vestas.com and follow us on our social media channels. We also encourage you to join our Talent Universe to receive notifications on new and relevant postings.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
As one of the world's leading logistics companies, we have opened a new IT Hub in Porto, Portugal. Our vision is to lead the transformation of the logistics industry into a technology-enabled, data-driven value chain. We envision a world where product teams can easily discover and consume data across domains and source systems on a central data platform in a consistent way. We will achieve this by building a data network based on the new KN technology platform. Within this data network, data stores are the curated data products that represent the KN business as a digital twin. Join our fascinating and international working environment and be part of the team responsible for the further development of our digital logistics processes.

Your Role

As an IT Business Analyst for our Data Stores, you will be the domain and application expert, working closely with the engineering team. You will play a key role in designing and maintaining the conceptual and logical domain model behind our data products covering sea, air and road logistics. You will translate user cases and requirements relevant to our stakeholders into development-ready user stories. You will also work closely with the highly skilled engineering team in Hamburg and Porto and support them throughout the entire software lifecycle!

Your Responsibilities


Support all product management related tasks required to build and operate our data products.
Support the product team in requirements engineering: You will define the requirements of a use case and support the prioritization of requirements.
Specify user stories and epics to translate the roadmap into manageable elements to be implemented according to agile principles.
Test implemented features and support the team with root cause analysis in case of bugs.
Support product management by articulating tactical and strategic requirements to management, business stakeholders, and developers.
Support the maintenance of product related documentation.
Provide guidance, support, and mentorship to other team members.


Your Skills And Experiences


3+ years of requirements engineering/feature specification experience in software development or experience from working in a business intelligence team.
Strong written and verbal communication skills, including technical writing skills in English. Enjoy writing concise user stories and have strong experience writing good documentation.
Ability to gather and analyze requirements, abstract and communicate complex content to various stakeholder groups at all levels of the organization.
Experience working with data modeling or other formal specifications in complex environments, ideally at enterprise scale.
Self-starter, able to motivate the team in a dynamic environment. Team player, you enjoy working collaboratively and are willing to develop and empower others.
Master's degree in a logistics field with demonstrated technical aptitude or master's degree in a technical field (computer or natural sciences, engineering, business) with demonstrated interest in logistics.
Experience with the applied tech stack is a plus (Jira, Confluence, Enterprise Architect, AWS, Kafka, XML/XSD, Avro).
Fluency in written and spoken English. Portuguese and/or German is a plus.


Good Reasons to Join

Your work has a direct impact on the future of logistics and IT. Your team is made up of experts who are shaping the IT industry in Portugal and around the world. We want you to feel comfortable in our working environment, where you will be dealing with different cultures. That is why we offer flexible working hours and the opportunity to work remotely. We value teamwork, continuous learning and diversity. Kuehne + Nagel offers you a tailor-made career with individual planning and team leaders who will support you in every way. On a personal level, we support you with a wide range of work-life balance options, supplementary health insurance and our EAP - Employee Assistant Program.

Title: Data Engineer - GCP
HTML:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:


Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success.

Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.


Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.


Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.


At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.


We are looking for a Data Engineer - GCP for a project based in Porto (hybrid - twice a week at the office).


Responsabilities:

  • Develop, maintain, and optimize data transformation workflows using Google BigQuery;
  • Create and manage views in BigQuery to support data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes;
  • Collaborate with data analysts and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and translate them into technical solutions;
  • Ensure data accuracy and integrity through regular data quality checks and troubleshooting;
  • Monitor and improve system performance to ensure efficient data processing;
  • Document data transformation processes and maintain comprehensive records of data workflows.


Requirements:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or a related field;
  • 2-5 years of experience in a data engineering role, or a similar position, is required;
  • Proficiency with SQL and experience in writing complex queries;
  • Experience with Google BigQuery and other Google Cloud Platform tools;
  • Strong understanding of ETL processes and data transformation techniques;
  • Demonstrable experience with data modeling and data warehousing;
  • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail;
  • Fluent English (mandatory).


If you‚Äôre interested in this job please send your CV in English to catarina.sa@decskill.com with reference ‚ÄúCS/DataEngineer_GCP‚Äù.


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Engineer (Hybrid @Porto)
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: Data Engineer

Seniority: 6+

Type of position: Hybrid (2x/week at Porto Office)




The amazing you, will have:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field;
6+ years of experience as a Data Engineer;
Expertise on end-to-end Data Pipeline Development, ETL processes and Alteryx;
Knowledge in Data Mesh concepts (Starburst, Trino);
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or Scala;
Strong knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases;
Experience with Big Data technologies such as Databricks, Hadoop, Apache Spark, Kafka;
Availability for a hybrid regime at Porto (Portugal);
Fluency in English is mandatory.




To turn yourself from amazing to unique, you¬¥ll have (plus):

French AND/OR Portuguese fluency.







Why should you become part of our family?

You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that¬¥s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days‚Ä¶ all remote!




Who are we?




Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

Title: Data Engineer (Portugal-based Remote/Hybrid)
HTML:
Sword Health is on a mission to free two billion people from pain as the world‚Äôs first and only end-to-end platform to predict, prevent and treat pain. Delivering a 62% reduction in pain and a 60% reduction in surgery intent, at Sword, we are using technology to save millions for our 2,500+ enterprise clients across three continents. Today, we hold the majority of industry patents, win 70% of competitive evaluations, and have raised more than $300 million from top venture firms like Founders Fund, General Catalyst, and Khosla Ventures. Recognized as a Forbes Best Startup Employer in 2023, this award highlights our focus on being a destination for the best and brightest talent. Not only have we experienced unprecedented growth since our market debut in 2020, but we‚Äôve also created a remarkable mission and value-driven environment that is loved by our growing team. With a recent valuation of $2 billion, we are in a phase of hyper growth and expansion, and we‚Äôre looking for individuals with passion, commitment, and energy to help us scale our impact. Joining Sword Health means committing to a set of core values, chief amongst them to ‚Äúdo it for the patients‚Äù every day, and to always ‚Äúdeliver more than expected‚Äù on behalf of our members and clients. This is an opportunity for you to make a significant difference on a massive scale as you work alongside 800+ (and growing!) talented colleagues, spanning two continents. Your charge? To help us build a pain-free world, powered by technology, enhanced by people ‚Äî accessible to all. As a Data Engineer you will be responsible for creating and delivering client reports, based on snapshots of our data warehouse. The ideal candidate will possess strong SQL skills, excellent communication abilities, and a keen eye for detail. you will work closely with both technical teams and non-technical stakeholders to align requirements and ensure that all reporting needs are met accurately and efficiently. What you'll be doing:

  • Develop and maintain SQL queries to extract data from the data warehouse for client reports
  • Maintain our Reporting framework and adding features to it (new layout capabilities)
  • Create and automate the delivery of data snapshots
  • Communicate complex technical processes and requirements clearly to non-technical stakeholders
  • Work closely with the Customer Success Manager to understand the reporting needs and ensure accurate alignment with their requirements
  • Ensure data accuracy and integrity in all reports and snapshots provided to clients
  • Troubleshoot and resolve any issues related to data extraction, transformation, and delivery
  • Collaborate with internal teams to optimize and improve data reporting processes
  • Maintain thorough documentation of all processes and procedures related to client reporting


What you need to have:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Science, or a related field (or equivalent experience)
  • Proven experience in a data reporting, for at least 2 years minimum
  • Strong proficiency in SQL and experience with data warehousing concepts
  • Experience with dbt and airflow are a plus
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain technical processes to non-technical stakeholders
  • Exceptional attention to detail and a commitment to data accuracy
  • Proven ability to align requirements and deliverables with client needs
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment


What we would love to see:

  • Familiarity with data visualization tools and techniques is a plus
  • Comfortable with Customer Facing meetings
  • Capability of translating technical conversations to non technical stakeholders


To ensure you feel good solving a big Human problem, we offer:

  • A stimulating, fast-paced environment with lots of room for creativity
  • A bright future at a promising high-tech startup company
  • Career development and growth, with a competitive salary
  • The opportunity to work with a talented team and to add real value to an innovative solution with the potential to change the future of healthcare
  • A flexible environment where you can control your hours (remotely) with unlimited vacation
  • Access to our health and well-being program (digital therapist sessions)
  • Remote or Hybrid work policy


*Please note that this position does not offer relocation assistance. Candidates must possess a valid EU visa and be based in Portugal. US - Sword Benefits & Perks:

  • Comprehensive health, dental and vision insurance*;
  • Equity shares*;
  • Discretionary PTO plan*;

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success.

Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.




Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.




Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for a Data Engineer for a hybrid project based in Porto.




Responsibilities:

Develop, maintain, and optimize data transformation workflows using Google BigQuery.
Create and manage views in BigQuery to support data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes.
Collaborate with data analysts and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity through regular data quality checks and troubleshooting.
Monitor and improve system performance to ensure efficient data processing.
Document data transformation processes and maintain comprehensive records of data workflows.




Requirements:

Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field.
+2 years of experience in a data engineering role, or a similar position, is required.
Proficiency with SQL Server and experience in writing complex queries.
Experience with Google BigQuery and other Google Cloud Platform tools.
Strong understanding of ETL processes and data transformation techniques.
Demonstrable experience with data modeling and data warehousing.
Experience with other data integration and ETL tools such as Apache Airflow, Talend, or Informatica (Nice to have).
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Fluency in English.







If you‚Äôre interested in this job please send your CV in English to carolina.novais@decskill.com with reference ‚ÄúCN/DE‚Äù.




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Analytics Engineer
Description:
We are looking for an Analytics Engineer to join our fast growing Mobility Team; where we finance progress in mobility, and clean energy adoption.

As an analytics engineer in mobility, you would be working with a cross-functional team both in Mobility and the wider analytics team in the Fintech side of the business. Additionally, you would own analytics datasets and pipelines for the specific product domain and work together with your cross-functional partners to improve our understanding of the area.

About Us

At M-KOPA, applying best practices is important to us in order to build reliable, well tested, efficient and documented data assets.

Your role would be focused on Dimensional Data modelling and visualization, Data Engineering, Business and Product Optimization, Cloud Platform Utilization and Data Management.

You would be building easy to understand and consistently modelled datasets to serve metrics, dashboards and exploratory analysis; including building data transformation pipelines, primarily by using SQL and Python in dbt, and Airflow infrastructure.

You would also be developing semantic models in Looker, build dashboards and coach users on how to use self-serve capabilities of our platform while working together with software engineers to ensure that the data necessary for analysis is captured well in our systems.

This is a fully remote role, within the following time zone (UTC -1 / UTC+3). Our engineers work remotely from locations such as UK, Europe and Africa. You will be reporting to the group Head of Technology - Mobility.

Expertise

Our expectation is that you have extensive experience with Python, Java and proficiency in SQL. Additionally, working with data warehouse technologies, and with BI tools such as Looker or Tableau and dimensional data modelling for analytics / big data infrastructures would make you an ideal candidate for the role.

Experience working with orchestration systems such as airflow working with dbt will equally be essential for this role.

Why M-KOPA?

We are a diverse and inclusive company that empowers our people to own their careers through diverse development programs, coaching partnerships, and on-the-job training. We support individual journeys with family-friendly policies, prioritize well-being, and embrace flexibility.

Join us in shaping the future of M-KOPA as we grow together. Explore more at m-kopa.com.

Recognized thrice by the Financial Times as one Africa's fastest growing company (2022, 2023 and 2024) and by TIME100 Most influential companies in the world 2023 and 2024 , we've served over 4 million customers, unlocking $1 billion in cumulative credit for the unbanked across Africa.

Title: Senior Data Governance Officer
HTML:
Company Description

Natixis in Portugal is a Centre of Expertise whose mission is to transform traditional banking by developing innovative solutions for the business, operations and work culture of Groupe BPCE worldwide.

Natixis in Portugal is part of the Global Financial Services division, where it applies technology for the development of financial expertise in its two global business lines ‚Äì Corporate & Investment Banking and Asset & Wealth Management ‚Äì and, transversally, for the entities of Groupe BPCE.

The Centre of Expertise, based in Porto, currently has more than 2,400 employees from over 30 nationalities, organised in three main departments: Information Technology, Banking Support Activities and Compliance. These teams work in an integrated, inclusive and transversal way, supporting and creating value for all the business lines and platforms of the group. The project in Porto is one of the biggest investments in Human Resources ever made by Groupe BPCE worldwide.

A disruptive mindset and a culture of proximity and agility identify Natixis in Portugal Team and reflect the company's mission to transform traditional banking at a global scale: a perfect match in the Portuguese dynamics and entrepreneurial ecosystem.

In 2024, Top Employers Institute has awarded Natixis in Portugal the Top Employer Portugal accreditation for the second time. This certification recognizes excellence in people practices, following the example of our head office, in France, who was certified Top Employer France for the eight year in a row.

Job Description

Team presentation and main goal:

As part of the Finance Direction, you will integrate the Financial Data Integrity department (FDI) which oversees the labelling of financial data for CIB activities of Natixis (balance sheet and off-balance sheet).

You will join a team of 6 people in Porto.

As a Senior Data Governance Officer, of a major French banking institution with international dimension, you will:

  • Support Data Management initiatives for Internal & Regulatory framework toward improvement of the quality of reports produced by Natixis CIB;
  • Participate in the Data monitoring for CIB activities (Financing, Global market, etc.)

You will be in contact with the other teams of FDI, internal Finance partners and Finance IT teams.

Main tasks and goals:

As a Senior Data Governance Officer, your primary tasks will be:

1- Data Systems and Analytics:

  • Develop solutions for data extraction, exploration, and transformation using SQL and other technologies;
  • Interface between business line and IT to translate business requirements into data sources and queries, supporting the creation of KPI metrics for dashboards;
  • Design and implement data architectures, along with new dashboards, to enhance business intelligence capabilities;
  • Manage and improve the use of data visualization tools like Power BI, ensuring the effective presentation of data to stakeholders;.
  • Own the creation and maintenance of scheduled reporting, including Power BI dashboards, to regularly inform business decisions.

2- Requirements and Coordination:

  • Oversee the full lifecycle of business requirements, from elicitation and analysis to documentation, management, and solution translation;
  • Plan and conduct workshops, interviews, and prototyping sessions to collect, clarify, and confirm business requirements;
  • Coordinate with Finance IT to monitor and prioritize the remediation plans and overall business requirements;
  • Ensure the effective coordination and implementation of financial issues remediation with relevant committees and IT teams.

3- Data Governance and Strategy (Technical View & Impact):

  • Participate in the coordination of the Data Domain Office (DDO) network for finance, including involvement in framework committees and data quality frameworks for projects regarding all technical request;
  • Contribute to the strategic planning of DM roadmap, aiming to align data management practices with business objectives regarding the technical impact.

4- Monitoring and Collaboration:

  • Monitor the implementation of business requirements and data strategies in collaboration with IT teams.
  • Support the management and enhancement of data visualization and BI solutions, fostering a culture of data-driven decision making.
  • Collaborate with various teams to promote cross-functional unity and ensure the seamless integration of technical data insights into business processes.

Additional information:

You will be part of a bi-localised team with a local manager and a functional manager Paris based, with regular interactions Paris team.

The ability to develop a network within the various teams of the Natixis ecosystem, and an aptitude for collaborative and group work are key factors of success in this position.

Qualifications

  • Master‚Äôs degree in Finance, Math, Data Analytics, Data Science or Data Engineering;
  • Data Management and Governance;
  • BCBS 239;
  • Banking environment, regulations, and products;
  • Data Analyst, with expertise in data visualization tools like Power BI and Tableau;
  • Data manipulation using DAX, M, Excel, SQL, and Python;
  • Synthesize complex datasets into clear visualizations and dashboards;
  • Big Data environments and technical tools for data analysis;
  • English (mandatory) and French (as a plus).

Soft Skills:

  • Strong communication and relationship-building skills;
  • Analytical mindset with problem-solving capabilities;
  • Curious, proactive, and able to work in a fast-paced environment;
  • Teamwork orientation and coaching skills to foster a collaborative atmosphere.

Only CV¬¥s in English will be considered.

Additional Information

At Natixis, we are committed to fostering a working environment where each and every one of our people is treated with dignity and respect and where every voice is heard. Our differences make us collectively stronger and are a source of fulfilment, innovation and performance.

In the framework of its Diversity, Equity & Inclusion policy, Natixis in Portugal has implemented a Blind CV Screening process, with the purpose of reducing hiring bias. A blind CV excludes any personal details which refer to the applicant‚Äôs gender, age or ethnicity. When applying for our positions, please submit a blind CV, that is, with no picture, name, gender, age, nationality, ethnicity and address. Your personal statement, work experience, courses and certifications, education, skills and contact information is what matters to us.

#MuchMoreThanJustAJob

Early morning. Campo 24 de Agosto. In 4 minutes, you are clocking in at the office. Start your day having breakfast with the Team and grab fresh fruit on the way to your seat, in one of Porto‚Äôs most typical neighborhoods. This Purple Day is going to be a busy one: daily meeting ensuring all team members are on the same page regarding work status, priorities and blockers, language class and, just after, a Talent Management meeting with your manager, discussing your career path.

Lunch break. Today, your Team is onboarding newcomers, but also welcoming French colleagues: the perfect excuse to walk downtown and bond over a francesinha. When returning, inhale nature and peace of mind in Natixis Urban Garden (look at the crops; ready to harvest!).

Back inside. Brainstorming session on a new, exciting project in our disruptive and immersive Manaus Village. The afternoon went flying (tasks, meetings, some jokes with your teammates). End it on a high note: celebrating cultural diversity with a Diwali, the Indian festival of lights.

Tomorrow, you attend a conference led by influential speakers in your industry and, the day after, you will work from home, benefitting from some focus time to complete that report and soft skills course on LinkedIn Learning. Once you are done with your work for the day, strike the right note playing with Natixis band or be part of a board games session. If that is too steady for you, meet your colleagues to catch some waves or sail the Douro river during golden hour.

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
We are hiring freelance Portuguese speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.




This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, e.g., verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.




Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & Portuguese
You must be living in Portugal for the last 2 consecutive years
Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information
You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Portugal
Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. Maps, News, Audio tasks, Relevance)
Applicants must be 18 years or over.




Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.




Why Join the TELUS International AI Community?

Earn extra income
Access to our community wellbeing initiative
Remote work & Location Independence
Be your own boss
Flexible Hours to fit in with your lifestyle
Be a part of an online community




TELUS International AI-Data Solutions partners with a diverse and vibrant community to help our customers enhance their AI and machine learning models. The work of our AI Community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world. Our AI Community works in our proprietary AI training platform handling all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects. We offer flexible work-from-home opportunities for people with passion for languages. The jobs are part-time, and there is no fixed schedule. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, come join our global AI community. www.telusinternational.com







If you have any questions, do not hesitate to contact us at sourcingteam121@telusinternational.ai

Title: Data Developer
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique, and amazing YOU!




@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, teamwork.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability, or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




ONLY APPLY IF YOU ARE LEGAL TO WORK HERE IN PORTUGAL




We are looking for an Amazing: Data base Developer




Seniority: 4 years




Technical skills:

KSH development
Java development Spring Boot, Spring Batch
Python development (Data handling)
Toolchain CI/CD (principle, tools, automated test...)
Cloud concept with container, Object Storage (COS) and exchange protocol (type S3)

Proficiency knowledges:

Security rules and protocols
Exchange file protocols (CFT)
Distributed architecture
Integration of technical components with associated flows (3-party architecture, SAML authentication, Web services, https, etc.)
LINUX environment




English (C1)




The amazing you, will have:

French (B2 / C1)




ONLY APPLY IF YOU ARE LEGAL TO WORK HERE IN PORTUGAL




Why should you become part of our family?

You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term;

Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity. Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster;

International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work;

Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):

Full Onsite projects: if you prefer the company of your colleagues!

Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psychologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days‚Ä¶ all remote!




Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Innovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
THE TEAM


The Global Client Analytics (GCA) team is responsible for providing data, insights, and analysis to Global Markets front office.
The team aims to build a solid database from various sources and develop analysis, reports and dashboards to provide valuable insight to the Front Office in a rapid, agile manner.
Our team is responsible for multiple steps regarding data processing: Data Feeds industrialization, ETL, Data Warehousing and Data Visualization. We are in direct contact with business sponsors, sales, and traders.
We seek to shape the technologies available to the client‚Äôs needs - we plan in processing the data using Python and SQL, while delivering the final product in Tableau, Power BI, APIs, and Chat bots.


Responsabilities


To be part of an international and diverse team who helps Global Markets Front Office to get to know their clients better and identify opportunities and trends throught what data can tell.
As a Data Analyst, you will play a vital role in our team. Working directly with one or more of the bank's business areas, you will provide valuable insights to drive business growth, understading their needs, proposing and implementing data-driven solutions (analysis, visualization and automation). You will exercise a lot of problem identification and problem solving skills.
You will have the opportunity to take ownership of business essential analytical projects that involve retrieving, preparing and analysing complex datasets using data/statistical models and best practices in data visualization for the reporting creation, with the goal to produce insights and automated tools that will guide strategic solutions.
You will move between technical and non-technical areas and should be able to communicate well with different types of professionals. It is very important to be able to clearly and concisely understand stekeholders‚Äô needs and translate these to our technical team, as well as present the results of complex analysis to our stakeholders.
You must be prepared for routine changes, each day will be filled with new and excited challenges.


Mandatory Experience And Knowledge


Academic background in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics or related fields
Availability to work in the hybrid model or in person in the Lisbon or Porto office
Experience in any data visualization tool such as Tableau or Power BI
Experience in data analysis with programming, preferably Python (Pandas)
Proficiency in SQL
Fluency in written and spoken English
Ability to analysze, synthetize and simplify.
Knowledge of descriptive statistics and hypothesis testing is a plus.
Knowledge in Big Data technology such as Pyspark, Presto and Airflow is a plus
Knowledge of Power Query and DAX is a plus

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
About us




We love data.

Envisioning advanced data architectures and bringing them to live is our passion.

reeeliance is a consultancy specializing in Data Management, Fast Data, Advanced Analytics, and DataOps. We further support our clients in modernizing their SAP landscape and moving their business to the cloud.




Based in Hamburg, Berlin, and Porto, we combine strategic foresight with sound data and software engineering craftsmanship to define, build, and operate scalable information ecosystems for our international clients, helping them transform into real data-driven enterprises.




About the role




Data is undeniably one of the world's most valuable resources. However, it's futile if it's not in the right place or the right setup. We strive to place data where it's needed most and can be used to its fullest potential.




Become a valued member of our data integration team and build with us highly scalable data architectures and fast data pipelines for our multinational clients. Our use cases range from data warehouse and lakehouse architectures implementations over IoT and data streaming setups to sophisticated AI scenarios, in industries ranging from manufacturing, consumer products, healthcare to banking and insurance, just to name a few.




Our Tech Stack at a glance

Coding: SQL, Python | Data Pipeline: Matillion, VaultSpeed | Data Storage: Snowflake, Azure Synapse | DevOps: Azure DevOps, GitLab




Your responsibilities:




In this role you have the chance to design, build and maintain data pipelines according to the client's business needs and embed them end-to-end into the given data stack
As a Data Engineer you will maintain and optimize the data infrastructure required for data extraction, transformation, and loading from a wide variety of data sources
You build, maintain, and deploy data artifacts on cloud platforms
You will ensure of data accuracy, integrity, privacy, security, and compliance by applying data quality assurances methods
Your responsibility will include monitoring of data pipeline performance as well as the implementation of optimization strategies
You will work together with both reeeliance and client staff as part of an agile team




Our requirements:




Proficiency in both classic and recent data modeling concepts
Applicable knowledge in data warehousing architectures and best practice design
Experience and confidence in using at least one ETL tool and proficiency in Python
Ability to read and understand complex data flows paired with strong SQL skills
Hands on experience in orchestrating data pipelines within cloud platforms like AWS or Azure
Problem-solving attitude
Independent working style
Experience with working as part of a team in agile project setups
A university degree in computer science, information technology, or related discipline
Articulate with impeccable verbal and written communication skills in English. Strong & discerning listener. Another language skill is a plus




What we offer:




Responsible roles in international projects
Space to grow and to take over responsibility
Dedicated onboarding program
Work with the cutting-edge technology
A permanent employment in a family-friendly company,
Working in a multinational team (more than 15 nationalities)
Flexible working hours
Participation in regular team events in Berlin and Hamburg
Further training opportunities
Modern equipment
Classes of German language
And many other Job perks (childcare subsidy, company pension scheme, job bike, etc‚Ä¶)




We are looking for passionate people to join our growing team.




JOIN US ‚Äì and grab your opportunity!




Please have in mind only short-listed candidates will be contacted.




For any questions, please write to marija.sekularac@reeeliance.com or send a DM.

Title: Financial Resources Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job

The Financial Resources Data Analyst plays an important and accountable role in providing support on the management of Global Markets Resources, namely Liquidity, Balance Sheet and Capital and the monitoring of future regulations.

The Financial Resources Data Analyst measures, allocates and optimizes Resources to ensure that the operational entity grows revenue, market share, and profitability in a sustainable way.

Your Main Activities Are


Collect, Prepare, consolidate data and Monitoring and keep track of Gaps on Global Markets Resources.
Responsible for database production and maintenance.
Assist on the preparation of presentations on topics related to Global Market resources.
Provides assistance to incoming requests from different regulators.
Responsible for producing GM Resources metrics, following a continuous improvement mindset (acquiring and building knowledge on the different business Lines, units and organization).
Develop knowledge on technical skills and apply those in order to efficiently perform the tasks.
Build knowledge and understanding on the 5 main types for Global markets and Help monitor those - Credit; Counterparty; Equity; Market; Operational.
Build knowledge and easiness in the main tools and software used by the team.


Profile And Skills To Success


Bachelors/MSc in Economics, Finance and Accounting
Very good communication skills
Analytical ability, attention to details, autonomy
Ability to collaborate/Teamwork
Proactivity
Risk management - Risk analysis
Technical skills ‚Äì R, VBA and Python

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Jumia (Full Time)
Description:
About Jumia:

Jumia believes that technology has the potential to transform everyday life in Africa for the better. Jumia was built to help consumers access millions of goods and services conveniently and at the best prices while opening up a new way for sellers to reach consumers and grow their businesses.

Listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in 2019, Jumia is the leading e-commerce company in Africa, operating in 11 countries. The Jumia platform consists of a marketplace, which connects sellers with consumers, a logistics service, which enables the shipment and delivery of packages from sellers to consumers, and a payment service, JumiaPay, which offers a safe and easy solution to facilitate online payment transactions. The company offers goods across a broad range of categories, such as phones and electronics, home appliances, fast-moving consumer goods, fashion and beauty.

What you will be doing


Lead the execution of data analysis projects, including collecting specifications, creating dashboards, and conducting in-depth analyses to drive business decisions
Develop and maintain complex SQL queries, Power BI dashboards, and Excel models to support various business units
Mentor and support junior colleagues in data analysis techniques, query optimization, and dashboard creatio
Perform quality assurance on data outputs, including queries, dashboard results, and visualizations to ensure accuracy and reliability
Communicate analytical findings and insights to senior stakeholders in a clear, concise, and actionable manner
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to standardize processes, improve team performance, and enhance overall efficiency
Assist the team manager in handling ad-hoc requests and managing cross-team projects
Contribute to the development of best practices and documentation for data analysis processes.


What we are looking for


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related quantitative field
Minimum of 5 years of experience in data analysis, preferably in the e-commerce or retail sector
Advanced proficiency in SQL, Power BI, and Excel; familiarity with JIRA and Confluence is a plus
Demonstrated experience in creating and maintaining complex dashboards and conducting in-depth data analysis
Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to translate business requirements into analytical solutions
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex data insights to both technical and non-technical audiences
Experience in mentoring junior team members and contributing to process improvements
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
Knowledge of e-commerce metrics and KPIs is highly desirable
Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git) and data visualization best practices
This job description outlines the key responsibilities and requirements for a Senior Data Analyst at Jumia, emphasizing the technical skills, leadership qualities, and industry knowledge needed for success in this role.


We Offer:


A unique experience in an entrepreneurial, yet structured environment
A unique opportunity of having strong impact in building the African e-commerce sector
The opportunity to become part of a highly professional and dynamic team
An unparalleled personal and professional growth as our longer term objective is to train the next generation of leaders


Please ensure to only apply for jobs with Jumia through our official website.

Jumia will never charge you a fee to apply for a job: be wary of websites that claim to help you apply for a Jumia job or that charge a fee to get you a job.
Show more
HTML:
About Jumia:

Jumia believes that technology has the potential to transform everyday life in Africa for the better. Jumia was built to help consumers access millions of goods and services conveniently and at the best prices while opening up a new way for sellers to reach consumers and grow their businesses.

Listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in 2019, Jumia is the leading e-commerce company in Africa, operating in 11 countries. The Jumia platform consists of a marketplace, which connects sellers with consumers, a logistics service, which enables the shipment and delivery of packages from sellers to consumers, and a payment service, JumiaPay, which offers a safe and easy solution to facilitate online payment transactions. The company offers goods across a broad range of categories, such as phones and electronics, home appliances, fast-moving consumer goods, fashion and beauty.

What you will be doing

  • Lead the execution of data analysis projects, including collecting specifications, creating dashboards, and conducting in-depth analyses to drive business decisions
  • Develop and maintain complex SQL queries, Power BI dashboards, and Excel models to support various business units
  • Mentor and support junior colleagues in data analysis techniques, query optimization, and dashboard creatio
  • Perform quality assurance on data outputs, including queries, dashboard results, and visualizations to ensure accuracy and reliability
  • Communicate analytical findings and insights to senior stakeholders in a clear, concise, and actionable manner
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to standardize processes, improve team performance, and enhance overall efficiency
  • Assist the team manager in handling ad-hoc requests and managing cross-team projects
  • Contribute to the development of best practices and documentation for data analysis processes.

What we are looking for

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related quantitative field
  • Minimum of 5 years of experience in data analysis, preferably in the e-commerce or retail sector
  • Advanced proficiency in SQL, Power BI, and Excel; familiarity with JIRA and Confluence is a plus
  • Demonstrated experience in creating and maintaining complex dashboards and conducting in-depth data analysis
  • Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to translate business requirements into analytical solutions
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex data insights to both technical and non-technical audiences
  • Experience in mentoring junior team members and contributing to process improvements
  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
  • Knowledge of e-commerce metrics and KPIs is highly desirable
  • Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git) and data visualization best practices
  • This job description outlines the key responsibilities and requirements for a Senior Data Analyst at Jumia, emphasizing the technical skills, leadership qualities, and industry knowledge needed for success in this role.

We Offer:

  • A unique experience in an entrepreneurial, yet structured environment
  • A unique opportunity of having strong impact in building the African e-commerce sector
  • The opportunity to become part of a highly professional and dynamic team
  • An unparalleled personal and professional growth as our longer term objective is to train the next generation of leaders

Please ensure to only apply for jobs with Jumia through our official website.

Jumia will never charge you a fee to apply for a job: be wary of websites that claim to help you apply for a Jumia job or that charge a fee to get you a job.

Title: Data Governance Analyst (m/f)
HTML:
Dellent is a consulting company focused in System Information and Telecommunications. Our goal is to help our candidates and consultants to take a step forward in their careers through projects that meet their needs and expectations.

In this project you‚Äôll contact with the European stock market area and will be able to work for a leading global trading platform that knows the importance of surveillance issues. Despite its development center being located in Porto and all administrative support in Lisbon, you will be part of a multicultural team that is spread across several European cities.

We are looking for a Data Governance Analyst to work in a project in Porto (hybrid model).

Requirements

  • 5+ years of experience in data management, data governance or related roles;
  • Experience of implementing, using, managing and promoting a Data Cataloguing solution (i.e.metadata tool);
  • Good understanding of data governance principles, frameworks and best practices;
  • Proficiency in SQL;
  • Excellent communication and people skills;
  • Problem-solving and critical thinking: ability to critically analyse issue and pro-actively develop effective options for recommendation;
  • Strong capacity of teamwork;
  • Fluency in English.

We Offer

  • Integration in a dynamic, experienced and friendly team;
  • Technical, behavioral and linguistics training opportunities;
  • Career development.

If this project fits your career expectations, submit your application through our website here. You can also explore our content about the job market here.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We're building the future of advertising and are looking for innovative minds to help us do it.

Darkroom is a vertically integrated digital agency pioneering the next generation of consumer-facing brands. A category leader in results-driven growth marketing, Darkroom‚Äôs success is attributed to our unique partnership model, purposefully built to launch brands to market and accelerate growth across direct-to-consumer. We work with game-changing brands such as Crate & Barrel, Popchips, FEED, Olipop, & CALPAK.

Position Overview:

We're seeking a Data Engineer with a strong background in ETL processes, BigQuery, and Python to support a wide array of data engineering projects for our agency and enterprise clients. This role will focus on maintaining and optimizing our data infrastructure, ensuring the seamless flow of data, and providing the backbone for our data-driven decision-making.

This role supports teams working in US Eastern Standard/Daylight Time and should be flexible to support and work in these times.

What You‚Äôll Do:


Design, build, and maintain scalable ETL processes to support data flow from various sources.
Maintain and optimize our BigQuery database, ensuring high performance and data integrity.
Write, troubleshoot, and optimize SQL queries to support various data needs.
Use Python to automate data processes, integrate data sources, and enhance data workflows.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Operations, Product, Marketing & Sales, Finance, and Engineering, to solve complex data problems.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports in Looker Studio to provide actionable insights to clients and internal teams.
Ensure continuous improvement of data processes through iterative testing and learning strategies.


You Should Apply If This Sounds Like You:


1 - 3 years of industry experience in data engineering, with a focus on maintaining and optimizing large-scale data systems.
Expertise in BigQuery, SQL, and Python for data processing, automation, and analysis.
Proven experience with ETL processes and tools.
Familiarity with data visualization tools, especially Looker Studio.
Strong analytical skills and the ability to manipulate, analyze, and interpret large datasets.
Experience in e-commerce marketing, with a strong understanding of platforms like Shopify, Meta (formerly Facebook) Ads, and Google Ads, is a plus.
Self-starter with an entrepreneurial spirit who thrives in a fast-paced environment.


What It‚Äôs Like to Work at Darkroom:

We're building the future of advertising and are looking for the minds to help us do it. We only seek out the best‚Äîfrom our clients to our people. Our team is our most sacred asset, and we offer highly competitive salaries and the following perks:


Unlimited Vacation Policy and Holidays: Rebooting is one of the most important parts of growth. At Darkroom, you have access to a flexible vacation policy, and 10 holidays throughout the year to keep you recharged and sharp.
Remote-First Culture: With hubs in LA, The Bay Area, New York, Philly, Lisbon, S√£o Paulo, and Pakistan, we offer a strong community base and endless opportunities for growth.
Endless Opportunities for Growth: Our agency is founded on an interdisciplinary approach, giving Darkroomers insights into services far beyond your job description. Grow your skills and interests beyond your niche and stay at the forefront of the industry through total immersion in cross-functional collaboration.


Equal Opportunity Statement:

Darkroom is an equal opportunity workplace‚Äîwe are dedicated to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national orientation, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique, and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, teamwork.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability, or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!

We are looking for an Amazing: Data Engineer

Seniority: Senior (5+ years)

Type of position: Hybrid from Braga. Candidates must be living in Portugal already!

The amazing you, will have:


Expertise in PySpark
Expertise in SQL
Airflow and GCP is a nice to have
Good English Knowledge
Familiarity with Scala is a bonus
Hybrid model in Braga



Why should you become part of our family?


You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term;
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity;
Free training programs: our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster;
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work;
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that¬¥s why a hybrid system works for us and for you;
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home;
Full Onsite projects: if you prefer the company of your colleagues!

Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psychologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days‚Ä¶ all remote!


Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Innovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

Title: HR Senior Data Analyst (f/m/div)
HTML:
Are you a data-oriented person with good stakeholder management skills? Do you want to play a role in the future of Infineon‚Äôs HR Data Analysis? With your reporting knowledge and data processes savviness, combined with a solid track record of BI solutions deployment, you shall be a valuable addition to our team! Apply now and become part of an innovative team dedicated to driving HR transformation forward! In this role, you will be responsible for developing and delivering state-of-the-art data solutions, as well as further enhancing existing ones. You will act as an expert consultant towards several stakeholders, partnering up with counterparts across different areas in order to translate business needs into fact-based solutions.

In your new role, you will:

  • Develop new self-service data solutions, such as Certified Data Sources, Dashboards, or List Reports;
  • Own and handle existing solutions, namely by troubleshooting & bug-fixing, enhancing & maintaining features throughout life-cycle, enabling & supporting end-users, as well as managing involved stakeholders and relevant communication flows;
  • Trend-scout and consult on data-related matters;
  • Act as topic matter expert for assigned HR pillars data, whilst ensuring a cross-functional scope;
  • Provide guidance to junior colleagues on technical logics and systematics;
  • Support HR & business in taking better, faster, fact-based decisions, driving HR transformation further.

You are proactive, result-oriented and have a structured and self-driven working style. Your strong communication skills allow you to build and leverage solid relations and cooperate with different stakeholders. Furthermore, you have strong analytical skills combined with the ability to develop user-friendly BI solutions to support decision-makers.

You are best equipped for this task if you have:

  • A University degree in Business Administration, Human Resources, Information Technology, or similar field of studies;
  • 3+ years of analytics working experience ‚Äì ideally linked to Human Resources;
  • Sound knowledge and understanding of reporting solutions & data analysis process, as well as proven experience in identifying trends and visualizing data in order to build value-add solutions for customers;
  • BI software proficiency ‚Äì both on data flows and visualization ends - preferably Tableau;
  • Analytical and conceptual skills, combined with hands-on spirit and outstanding planning capacity;
  • Team spirit, high attention to detail and stakeholder management experience, preferably in globally operating organizations;
  • Fluency in English (mandatory) ‚Äì knowledge of German is an advantage.

Please send us your CV in English

Driving decarbonization and digitalization. Together.

Infineon designs, develops, manufactures, and markets a broad range of semiconductors and semiconductor-based solutions, focusing on key markets in the automotive, industrial, and consumer sectors. Its products range from standard components to special components for digital, analog, and mixed-signal applications to customer-specific solutions together with the appropriate software.

  • Welcome at Infineon Technologies Business Solutions in Porto! -

Infineon Technologies Business Solutions is a vibrant global hub, driven by diverse talents and an operational culture of excellence, in a privileged geographic location. The team of more than 25 nationalities works together in a dynamic, diverse and inclusive environment. We lead innovation and digital transformation, shaping the future of Infineon Technologies. At the heart of everything we do, people matter most. Our ultimate goal is to craft a unique experience for both our customers and employees.

At our site you will find a range of diverse teams that have built a reputation for delivering high-quality services for all Infineon in Finance, Procurement, Human Resources, IT, Audit, Legal, Compliance, Business Continuity and Sustainability, Cyber Security, Communication, Corporate Supply Chain Logistics and Sales & Marketing. Porto is a powerhouse of ideas and solutions, a key player in the global company‚Äôs puzzle, delivering specialized services and innovative solutions.

Together, Infineon Technologies Business Solutions will continue to shape the future, driving innovation and excellence for years to come.

We are on a journey to create the best Infineon for everyone.

This means we embrace diversity and inclusion and welcome everyone for who they are. At Infineon, we offer a working environment characterized by trust, openness, respect and tolerance and are committed to give all applicants and employees equal opportunities. We base our recruiting decisions on the applicant¬¥s experience and skills.

We look forward to receiving your resume, even if you do not entirely meet all the requirements of the job posting.

Please let your recruiter know if they need to pay special attention to something in order to enable your participation in the interview process.

Click here for more information about Diversity & Inclusion at Infineon.
